loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Lumière sont des  6 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.Tous  les prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles  divers tels que la préparation et vente de l’encens par Mariam Dembélé, l’achat vente du bois de chauffe, des gingembre etc.
Mariam compte acheter avec son  prêt  20kg de guenni + 10kg de magnon kisenin. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes.
Les encens prêts à l’utilisation sont vendus au  marché d’HAMDALLAYE et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Lumière group are all married women. Their average age is 33 and they have, on average, 6 children. They live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a neighbourhood in Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They have repaid all of their previous loans.
These women work in various trades, buying and selling firewood, ginger etc. Mariam Dembélé makes and sells incense. Mariam plans to buy 20kg of guenni and 10kg of magnon kisenin with her loan. She buys her stock from wholesalers at the big market in Sikasso.
She sells the ready-to-use incense at the Hamdallaye market and within her family, mostly to women. Her customers pay with cash and often with credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18.500 FCFA, part of which will go towards family expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana B. is from the village of Tugas. She is 65 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marciana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector of fishing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of ocean-caught fish in the market. Marciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Marciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Marciana from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for loan from Asasah to repair her son’s rickshaw. She lives with her family in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan, where her son is a rickshaw driver. He has been in this work for the last six years. He learnt this driving skill from his father. He got his education till 8th standard and couldn’t study further because his father had no financial resources besides his meager income.  

Rani started making artificial flowers a few years ago to support her family financially. She sells her flowers to gift shops and in the community as well and generates income for the family. She is very good at her art and gets regular orders. Rani will use the loan amount for repairing her son’s rickshaw. 

A newly maintained rickshaw will run more smoothly and help her son to work for longer hours thus making him more money.

loans.use: Repair her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya D. lives with her husband and two children in Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Enhtuya operates a consumer products trading business in her  district. She sells a variety of food products, out of a stall, at a market. Enhtuya started her food products sales business in 2007. 

Since starting her business, Enhtuya has gained much experience as a businesswoman and has built a stable operation. For the future, her dream is to own and operate her own trading center with many different types of businesses. Enhtuya is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to sell at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his home by changing the flooring in one bedroom using tiles.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: El Sr. Rolando es un cliente antiguo y puntual de la institución, trabaja con nosotros desde el año 2005, tiene su pastelería ubicada en la zona de Pampahasi en la avenida principal, tiene muchos años con esta actividad por lo que es muy conocido por la zona. Vive en otra zona, con su esposa y sus hijos que le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar harina, azúcar, leche en polvo que es lo que utiliz a diario en la elaboracion de las tortas, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rolando has been a client of the institution for a long time. He has worked with us since 2005, and he is punctual. He has a pastry shop located on the main avenue in the Pampahasi area. He has been doing this activity for a lot of years, and he is well known in the area. He lives in another area with his wife and their children, who help him in the business. The loan he is now requesting is to buy flour, sugar, and powdered milk. He uses these everyday in making the cakes. He is very grateful to the institution for the confidence placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make cakes

loans.name: Tola's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tola S. is 35 years old. She is the village group loan president, having been selected by its 25 members. The group members all live in Ta Reab Doun S. Village, Kandal Province. The members of this village loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Tola S. is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Kokheng Thou, is a sales representative for a company. Through their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to further support her vegetable selling business, Mrs. Tola S. will use the loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

The couple has two children. One attends the local school, while the youngest child is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Astria

texts.es: Astria tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene ocho hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Astria, el factor más relevante es “la creatividad y la perseverancia”; desde luego lo aplicó para el trabajo agrícola que realiza, es así que cuando sembró café, que es el producto que tiene para generarse los ingresos que necesita, pudo recolectar en cantidad y ahora sus asiduos compradores se sienten satisfechos por la calidad de este fruto. Normalmente trabaja en compañía de su familia, y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, además asegura que minimiza en gastos, ya que no necesita de mano de obra de terceras personas. Usualmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio competitivo. Su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, solo que en los días domingo descansa, para que esté más tiempo con su familia. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su producción agrícola, asimismo piensa construir su casa  base de material noble, con la finalidad darle comodidad y seguridad a su familia. Este es su sexta crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables con sus respectivos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con la finalidad de que lo pueda darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Astria is 46 years old. She is married and has eight children. They live together in Quimbiri, located in Cusco's beautiful woods, where they have their own house. The most relevant thing for Astria is "creativity and perseverance"--a maxim she applies to her agricultural work. That's how she cultivates coffee, which is the source of her income. She is able to harvest a large amount of coffee, and her customers are happy with the quality of her product. She normally works alongside her family, and they work together well. There is also the additional savings in expenses, since there is no need to hire outside workers. She usually sells her coffee in distribution centers in her area and at a competitive price. Her daily routine is to leave home at 7 am and return at 6 pm. She only rests on Sunday, when she can be with her family. Her plans for the future are to increase her agricultural production so as to build a house with good materials so that her family can be safer and more comfortable. This is her six loan with microfinance partner MFP, and she promises to meet her payment schedule. She also would like to thank her community bank, where everyone is responsible for paying their respective loans. She will use this money to invest in buying supplies and fertilizer in order to adequately maintain her coffee plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions and fertilizer for her coffee plants

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean M. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Mary Jean is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling gasoline, by the liter, in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional gasoline to sell. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Mwahija Yosuph is in her mid-forties, and is married with four children. She is engaged in the sale — wholesale and retail — of cement, water, juice, and corn husks which are used as chicken feed. Mwahija has been selling these products for the past seven years, and works daily between 7:30 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. The business earns Mwahija a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwahija's fourth Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Her previous loans were used to increase her business — loans which she has successfully repaid. Mwahija aims to use this loan to buy more cement and water. 

Mwahija will share this loan with her loan group Subira, which has thirteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Mwahija is wearing red and black, in the back row.

loans.use: Cement and water inventory

loans.name: Stanslaus

texts.en: Stanslaus O. O. is forty one years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have five children, between the ages of 4 and 15 years. Stanslaus and his wife would like to provide a quality education for each of his children to the university level. His business is located at Kibera and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He sells charcoal to the local people. He has been in this business for ten years now and has one employee. He says that the business is profitable. He says that his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 15,000 to buy charcoal to be sold to expand his business, while meeting his customers' demands. He hopes that, in future, he will be the major supplier of charcoal in Kibera. He also sees himself owning a plot of land. He describes himself as hardworking, honest and patient.

loans.use: Charcoal

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia T. is from the village of Cauacan, Capirpiriwan Cordon. She is 46 years old. Virginia is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virginia T. group.

Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan.  She is 32 years old.  Marilyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI.  Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin M., a widow, has six children — five sons and one daughter: three of them are married and live outside the family home, one has full-time employment in Phnom Penh and the other two assist their mother in farming. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Rin M. has been a weaver since 2005. She is also a farmer who grows ginger. She is requesting a loan of US$1,200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and will use a part of her loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her ginger farm.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and for farm use.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba K. smokes fish for sale in Takoradi. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a driver. Abiba uses her income to assist her husband ensure that the family is well taken care off.  Abiba will use the loan to purchase additional fresh fish to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abiba plans to save to buy a piece of land.

In this picture, Abiba has finished arranging the fish to be smoked.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S. is  from  Banteay Meanchey province and is married to Kuy Mang, 28, an ice cream seller. They have one child.  Keo S. is a tailor and she has been running her sewing business since 2000. Keo S. provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers admire the good service she provides. 

Currently, Keo S.’s husband uses his old motorbike (Tok Tok) to pick up his ice cream for selling. Now, her husband wants to decorate his old motorbike, but he lacks money to do it. Keo S. will use her loan to help her husband to decorate the old motorcycle.

loans.use: To decorate the motorcycle used for selling ice cream

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: La señora María Mercedes González Ríos desde hace 1 año comenzó con un estanquillo pensando el bienestar económico de la familia, para apoya a su esposo con los gastos al igual de esta manera estar al tanto de su hija de dos años que necesita la protección de ella. María necesita un préstamo para surtir su negocio de mercancía para ofrecer variedad de productos que el cliente pueda consumir a un mejor precio y de esta manera sean incrementadas sus ventas.
texts.en:
One year ago, with her family's financial well-being in mind, María Mercedes González Ríos set up a small store so that she could support her husband with their expenses and, at the same time, be close to her 2 year-old daughter who needs her protection.

María needs a loan so that she can stock her store with merchandise which will enable her to offer her customers a variety of food products at a better price and, thereby, increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 7 enfants. Elle habitent le quartier Pelengana sud, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché de Pelengana. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de céréales (mil et riz),  des galettes à base de mil et d’habillements (pagnes wax, chemises et bazins). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariama  Djiré est une vendeuse de céréales qui compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter cinq sacs de riz avec les forains de Niono au grand marché de Ségou en gros. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Pelengana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Mariama Djiré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, prendre en charge les besoins du foyer et les soins de santé des enfants. 
Elle ambitionne acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Ségou.
texts.en:
Djiguisseme Group (“Hope”) is composed of four married women, who on average are 45 years old and have seven children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Pelengana Sud, the administrative center of a rural municipality in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of kinship and when they ran their businesses at the market in Pelengana. The group members sell cereals (millet and rice), waffles made from millet, and clothes (wax pagnes, shirts and basins).

Faced with the need to increase their working capital and inventory paying cash down, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now at their eighth solidarity loan.

Mrs Mariama Djiré sells cereals. She intends to use her loan to buy 5 sacks of rice from wholesalers in Niono at the market in Ségou. She retails her goods, for cash or credit, from her home and at the market in Pelengana to a clientele made up of women and men.

Mrs Mariama Djiré expects to make an average profit of 35,000 CFA francs a month, which will be reinvested in her business and spent to pay for household expenses and health care for her children. Her ambition is to buy a plot of land and have her own house in Ségou.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn S., 43, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells sugar canes and snacks, earning an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband is employed at a weaving factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $15 on food and $49 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina B. is married and has five children. She completed a senior high school education. For 21 years, Philomina has been selling fruits at Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi. 

Her husband is a tailor and Philomina supplements his income with her earnings. She helps pay for school fees and utility bills. 

Philomina will use the loan to purchase more fruit expand her business. The new profit from her expanded business will be used to build a fruit shop.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit expand her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 36 años; vive en concubinato con Isaías. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Jordy, Jordan y Wilson. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arveja, habas y papa en sus terrenos propios ubicados en el caserío de Anispampa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de parte de su esposo.”Cuando cosecho mis sembríos, mi esposo sale a vender los sacos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma”, menciona. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, y conejos; los cuales vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando lo solicitan. Además de dedicarse al negocio de compra y venta de maíz, también los vender por unidad. Su principal dificultad, es la falta de capital, pues cosecha y siembra constantemente; invirtiendo en el mantenimiento constante de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente gustosa de poder aportar en el desarrollo de su asociación. Julia, comprará con el crédito 3 cosechas de maíz; los cuales comercializará por unidad en el mercado mayorista.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband Isaías.  They have 3 children: Jordy, Jordan and Wilson.  The family lives together in their own home which is located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo.  Julia has been growing corn, peas, beans and potatoes on her own land, which is located in the village of Anispampa, for 20 years.  What she most likes about her work is the support that she receives from her husband.  "When I harvest my crops, my husband takes the sacks to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma," she says.  Julia also raises animals such as guinea pigs and rabbits which she sells to people in her village when they request them.  As well as working in her business buying and selling corn, she also sells these products by the unit.  The main difficulty that she faces is a lack of capital since she sows and harvests constantly, and invests in constantly maintaining her crops.

Julia is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" community bank and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She feels glad to be able to help in the development of the association.  Julia will use her loan to buy three harvests of corn which she will then sell by the unit in the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy three harvests of corn which she will then sell by the unit

loans.name: Iderbat

texts.en:
Iderbat, 31, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. His wife works as a teacher and his elder son attends a local school. They have an average standard of living. 

Iderbat worked as a manual laborer in Korea for a few years. When he came back to Mongolia, he started driving a taxi. He supports his family with the money he earns. He plans to start selling cell phones in the near future in addition to his taxi service.  He is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to begin selling cellphones in order to increase my income". He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to buy cellphones from Erlian for his new business.

loans.use: to buy cellphones to sell

loans.name: Kalonvi

texts.ru: Бердиева Калонви проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Ее дети и муж работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Калонви занимается растениеводством. У себя дома он имеет большой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и картофель. Этим видом деятельности занимается 4 года. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева.
texts.en: Kalonvi B. lives in the region of Jilikul. She is 45 years old. She is married and has five children. Her children and husband work in the collective farm. Kalonvi does agriculture. She has a big plot of land at home where she sows wheat and potatoes. She has been in this business for four years. The purpose of the loan is to buy mineral fertilizer for the sowing.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his young family and his desire is to build a house and educate his children. He has been in the retail business for two years. The business is profitable as he has been able to meet the daily needs of his family. His hardships are seasonal business and theft and his vision is a wholesale shop plus building a house. Amon needs the loan to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es una persona que siempre a buscado el bienestar de su familia. Ella todas las mañanas sale a trabajar en 2 casas particulares como empleada domestica; para poder ganar un poco mas de dinero para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar aunque labora como guardia  en un pollo frito y albañil en sus horas libres.
Margarita piensa en darle una buena educación a sus hijos y dejarles mejor patrimonio, es por ello que quiere construir un baño completo con todos los servicios para esto necesita comprar material ya que su esposo es quien se encargaría de la construcción.
texts.en:
Margarita is a person who has always sought her family’s wellbeing.  She goes out every morning to work in two private homes as a Domestic Employee to earn a bit more money to help her husband, who works as a Security Guard and as a Bricklayer in his free time, cover household expenses.

Margarita wants to give her children a good education and leave them a better patrimony so she wants to build a full bathroom.  To do so, she needs building materials and supplies since her husband will take care of doing the construction.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Adriana Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Adriana Ramona, de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Esta casada con el Sr. Carmelo con quien tiene un hijo de 8 años, quien se encuentra en la etapa primaria de la Educación Básica.
Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, posee una clientela bien formada, vende sus mercaderias al contado y a crédito, el cual cobra en forma semanal, por las zonas de Paranambu, Yhovy, Potrero Po´i, 3 de Mayo,Itá Potrero, entre otros.
Es una señora muy sacrificada y trabajadora, el crédito que retiró en la etapa anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropas para invierno, ya que posee mucha demanda en esta época.
Pero como no le abastece para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes este es el segundo crédito que solicita a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de ropas de invierno como abrigos principalmente y de cacerolas para emprender un nuevo producto a ofertar.
texts.en:
Adriana Ramona is 32 years old and her business is selling clothes.  She is married to Carmelo and they have an 8 year-old son who is in elementary school.  She has been in this business for more than seven years and has a well-established customer base.  She sells her merchandise for cash and on credit, and collects payment every week.  She sells in Paranambu, Yhovy, Potrero Po'i, 3 de Mayo, Itá Potrero and other areas.

Adriana Ramona is a very selfless and hard-working woman.  She invested her previous loan in buying winter clothes since she has a lot of demand at this time of year.  However, it was not enough to cover her customers' needs and so she is requesting this second loan in order to acquire a larger quantity of winter clothes (mainly coats) and also some pans so that she can embark on selling a new type of product.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes and pans

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is a single mother with 2 children. She is 27 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rudelyn has been selling snack food in the street for 5 years, earning a living of PHP 2,800 per month. Her income is not enough to sustain her family's daily needs and to provide for her children's education. Therefore, Rudelyn has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients to make her snack food.

Rudelyn has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes that she will have a building for her refreshments so that she can help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: As shown in the photo, Mabel sells different types of cloth, slippers, etc. at Elmina. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is into carpentry. She has been selling cloth, slippers, etc. for five years. She assists her husband in the payment of household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Byron Andres

texts.es:
Byron es un joven soñador que ha hecho de su creatividad y talento una manera de generar ingresos, Byron es un tatuador que viven en la ciudad de Medellín, del departamento de Antioquia quien lleva varios años ejerciendo esta labor no solo como una manera de expresarse y prestar un servicio satisfactorio a sus clientes si no también como una manera de salir adelante, generar ingresos y mejorar su situación económica.

Su mayor sueño es tener su propio local ya que actualmente atiende a sus clientes desde su casa, pero para esto él es conciente que tiene que seguir trabajando mucho y esforzarse por mejorar cada día, así el progreso que logrará poco a poco le brindará la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños. Por ahora Byron está trabajando para mejorar el servicio, por lo tanto deberá comprar insumos e implementos de higiene indispensables para su labor, y solicita un crédito que le permita comprar dichas cosas con las cuales esta seguro mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Byron is a young dreamer who has turned his creativity and talent into a way of making money.  Byron is a tattoo artist who lives in the city of Medellín, in Antioquia department.  He has been in this line of work for several years.  It is not only a way of expressing himself and providing a satisfactory service to his customers but also a way to get ahead in life, make income and improve his financial situation.

Byron's biggest dream is to own his own premises since he currently serves his customers in his home.  However, in order to achieve this he is aware that he must continue working a lot and make an effort to improve every day.  In this way, the progress that he gradually makes will provide him with the opportunity to fulfil his dreams.  For now, Byron is working to improve his service.  He needs to buy supplies and hygiene tools which are essential for his work.  He is requesting a loan that will enable him to buy these items.  He is certain that this will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hygiene tools

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Eduviges tiene  51 años de edad, el tiene 01 hija en edad escollar,  cuenta con casa propia ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo  su domicilio por estar ubicado en una zona urbana y transitada , cuenta con todos los servicios básicos , como lo es agua , energía eléctrica y telefonía , entre otros 

Eduviges cuenta con un negocio en un mercado de la ciudad, ella  se  ha establecido en un puesto de comida y bebida en el interior del mercado, ella ofrece menú diariamente, desde hace 11 años, en todo este tiempo ella ha podido conseguir clientela  fija y fidelizada a su negocio 

Eduviges esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 3000 nuevos soles para que ella pueda , ella desea poder tener mayor seguridad y poder brindar a sus clientes más comodidad.

Eduviges quiere crecer como empresaria, cuenta con muy buenas referencias y muchas  ganas de salir adelante y poder brindarle a su  familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eduviges is 51 and has one school-aged daughter. She has her own home in the center of Chiclayo city. Her home has all of the basic services (water, electricity and phone, among others) because it is located in a busy, urban area.

Eduviges has a business in the city market. She has established a stall in the market where she sells food and drink. She offers a daily menu. She has done this for 11 years, and during this time she has been able to establish a fixed and loyal customer base.

Eduviges is requesting a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She wants to have greater security and offer her customers more comfort.

Eduviges wants to expand as a businesswoman. She has very good references and a great desire to get ahead and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her business' facilities with metal structure and furniture.

loans.name: Celia's Group

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años vive en Pujilí cerca de Latacunga junto con su esposo y 6 hijos que tienen 35, 29, 24, 21, 17, 7 años, se describe como una persona responsable, amable con la gente, le gusta conversar mucho con las personas.

Trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra y crianza de conejos con sus hijos y la nuera, empezó su trabajo hace 35 años; es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de conejos, semilla y abono para su terreno, este prestamo le ayudaría a incrementar su producción y de esta manera a incrementar los ingresos y mejorar sus calidad de vida.

Su sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y también quiere que su negocio se convierta en una empresa.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives in Pujilí near Latacunga with her husband and six children who are 35, 29, 24, 17 and 7 years old.  She describes herself as a responsible person who is kind to others and who very much enjoys chatting with people.

She works in farming and raising rabbits with her children and her daughter-in-law.  Her work started 35 years ago.  

This is the first time she’s worked with Fodemi.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy rabbits, seeds and manure for her field.  The loan will help her increase production and thus increase income and improve her quality of life.

Her dream is that her children get ahead and also that her business becomes a firm.

loans.use: to buy rabbits, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 43-year-old hard-working man, who is supporting a family of five by selling frozen meat, chicken and fish. He even has special equipment in his shop for cutting meat based on the customer's desire (small pieces, steaks, chopped meat).

Hani has applied for this loan in order to expand his shop by renting the next door shop and buying more equipment and making a special section for barbequing as a new service to be added.

loans.use: To expand his shop by renting the next door shop and buying more equipment and making a special section for barbequing.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa was born in 1967 and lives in Nhoi Duoi village with her husband, who works in construction, and two children, who are too young to attend school.  Her husband earns about 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month. Thoa's family owns a restaurant, and she has supplemented the family's income by working there for many years. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month, and joined SEDA in 2006 as a way to increase her income and improve her family's life. She has already taken out and repaid her first loan, which was for 8,066,000 VND. This time she is applying for a loan for 9,810,000 VND to expand her restaurant by buying new chairs, new tables and other items.

loans.use: to expand a family restaurant by buying new chairs, tables and other items.

loans.name: Cherono

texts.en:
Cherono is aged 27 and is a farmer in Litein area, South Rift Kenya. She is married with 2 children age 4 and 2 and has been in farming for 4 years. She fully relies on farming for her family upkeep. Her farm produces tea, milk and eggs.

Cherono has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She has previously requested two loans which she promptly repaid. She says her focus is to have three dairy cows and use the income generated to educate her children.

She compliments Juhudi for availing smallholder farmers with loans but laments about high costs of maintenance for the dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children aged fifteen, nine, five and three. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because she assists them with their schooling. 

In 1997, Kadiatu established her imported foodstuffs business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more inventory. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open her business in other areas in the town. The loan has helped her to provide livelihoods for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more imported foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin, 39, is married woman. She lives with her three children in Kompong Chhnang province where she works as a basket maker. She has to buy strips of bamboo or bendable strips of wood from a local market, and then she uses her skills to weave them together to make baskets. From this business, she typically earns about $1.50 USD each day. However, she also relies on the income from her husband and daughter who work outdoors. 

Mrs. Yin has dreamed of having a general store to sell mixed products, yet she doesn’t have any capital to do that. She is asking for some funds and help from Kiva’s lenders in the sum of about $175 USD to build a store near her house to sell grocery products. With the increase in her income, she will support her children until they finish senior high school.

loans.use: to build a little store near her house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas como lechugas, repollo y papas entre otras hortalizas, la socia también se dedica a tejer chompas, pantalones y sombreros, ella lo hace a pedidos, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de siembra de hortalizas y quiere mejorar en el negocio de tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para alquilar el terreno para sembrar hortalizas y comprar lana para que teja las chompas y pantalones.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta Communal Bank, which is located in the Urubamba district of the province by the same name, department of Cusco.

She is Ms. Vilma, a 36-year-old with 4 children and a live-in partner. She alternates her daily chores with her agriculture business. She cultivates vegetables like lettuce, cabbage, and potatoes, among other produce. She also knits sweaters, pants, and hats to order. Through these two businesses, she is able to help her children get ahead. The member wishes to expand her crops and improve her knitting business. She is requesting this loan in order to rent land for vegetable cultivation, and to purchase wool to knit sweaters and pants.

Ms. Vilma is happy about the loan, and she commits to repaying it back on time.

loans.use: to rent a crop field and to purchase wool.

loans.name: Kudakwashe Group

texts.en:
Mutsai is 63 years old. She is a widow and with seven adult children aged 41, 39, 37, 34, 31, 28 and 28. She has five grandchildren whom she also stays with. She receives rent from her other house which she is renting out for additional income.

She operates her poultry business out of her home. She has been in the business for more than 20 years. She has two employees who help her run the business. She wants to buy feed and chicks with the loan. The challenges she faces in the business include high competition and chicks dying prematurely due to inadequate medicines. 

She is requesting a loan of US$300 to buy chicken feed and chicks. She hopes to be able to provide for her family's needs with the profits from the business. She has a vision of owning her own poultry shop.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad la hace hermosa su mezcla pintoresca entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus lugares con abundante naturaleza, su gente quienes son de un corazón cálido y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 28, 27 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son solteros y viven independientes y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio familiar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa trabaja desde su casa, se dedica con su esposo a elaborar tortas y pan, también tienen una tienda en donde trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, levadura, azúcar y otros víveres para su negocio.

Su meta es crecer más en su tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” (April 12th Society). She lives in the central section of the city of Cuenca. The beauty of this picturesque city is a result of blending the colonial with the modern. There is abundant natural beauty. The people possess warm hearts and have been able to maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Rosa is 42 years old, married, and has three children (ages 28, 27, and 9). Her two older children are single and live independently, while her youngest child attends an elementary school in the city. Her husband helps with the family business. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Rosa works from home. She and her husband produce cakes and bread. They also have a shop where they work Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 10pm. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after she was invited to join by a neighbor. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients for her business. Her goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maghanoy's Group

texts.en:
Cresencia is married with 4 adult-aged children. Cresencia is 60 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Ozamiz City.

Cresencia sells assorted goods to her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for general store to purchase daily commodities like foods (canned goods, biscuits, etc.).

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for one year. Cresencia hopes to expand her business in years to come. Cresencia is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase daily commodities like foods (canned goods, biscuits, etc.).

loans.name: Minerva Estrella

texts.es:
Minerva es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, la señora estudió educación secundaria (incompleta).

Trabaja más de dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosinas, también se dedica a la venta de comida.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará utensilios como vajillas, ollas,  víveres para la preparación de alimentos, también invertirá en la salud de su hija.
En el negocio le ayuda su hija, su esposo realiza servicio de taxi (transporte). 

La señora desea implementar y reabrir su tienda de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo y el plazo de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Minerva is a member of the communal bank "Brisas del Lago," located in the province and department of Puno.  She is 33 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children.  She completed part of middle school.

Minerva has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for more than 2 years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her business selling candy.  She also has a business selling food.

With this new loan of 800 Peruvian soles, she will buy kitchenware such as dishes and pots, and groceries to prepare her food.  In addition, she will invest in the health of her daughter.

Her daughter helps her with the business, and her husband works as a taxi driver.

What Minerva likes most about her communal bank is that the loans have easy payment terms.

loans.use: to buy dishes, pots and groceries to prepare her food

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud is a married man with eight children; six attend school.  His wife is a farmer and she contributes to the welfare of their family.  He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Masoud has operated a tailoring business for the past 15 years.  His clients are his neighbors.  He faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand.  He hopes to expand his business.

With the Kshs 45,000 loan, he wants to purchase more fabrics and embroideries for his business.  He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is separated and has eight children. She is 51 years old and resides at Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Diosdada plants, harvests, and sells bananas to earn a living and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Diosdada wants to make improvements to her house and to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Vidal De Jesus

texts.es: Vidal, debido a la necesidad de adquirir más dinero para invertirlo en el negocio, está solicitando un crédito nuevo para comprar leña y  maíz por mayor cantidad, esto le ayudará para darle continuidad al progreso dentro del negocio, mejorando la disponibilidad para atender las necesidades de los clientes y tener mejor capacidad de respuesta. Ella considera que ha tenido efectos positivos con la inversión realizada del préstamo anterior, esperando tener una mejor experiencia en este nuevo préstamo.
texts.en: Because Vidal now needs more money to invest in her business, she is seeking a new loan to buy wood and corn in larger quantities. This will help her continue the progress she is making with the business. She will have more time to attend to her customers’ needs and ability to respond to them. Vidal believes that the previous loan has had positive effects and expects to have an even better experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
Because the group was successful during the last loan period and the price for piglets now is increasing, the Sumbersari Permai group decided to continue and ask for a higher loan. Now they get 15M IDR and per member they get 1,5M IDR. 

Ni Kadek, as the head of the group, will use her loan to purchase four more piglets. She will cover the feed out of her own money. She’s very confident to run the business because of the good market now for the fattening. She hopes the cooperation between MUK and the group will last until all the members can run their businesses by themselves.

loans.use: To purchase four more piglets.

loans.name: Grupo Los Monarca Group

texts.es:
Un lugar con encanto, muy escondido pero con muchos colores gracias a las mariposas monarca que llegan ya por estas fechas, es un lugar turístico muchas personas llegan al lugar para visitar al lugar, para admirar las bellezas de la mariposa, es un lugar de origen mazahua, algunas personas aun conservan sus costumbres y tradiciones para no olvidar sus orígenes.
 David es muy alegre, platicador pero sobretodo muy trabajador tiene 31 años de edad esta casado con la señora Maria del Socorro, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian su educación primaria.
 David es electricista pero ademas de eso le encanta manejar un taxi, platica aquel el negocio lo inicio porque su papá siempre ha sido uno de los mejores taxistas, así que cambien el se animo a iniciar con su propio taxi, platica que inicio con un taxi pirata, pero poco a poco con sus ganancias pudo comprarse un taxi en mejor estado y poder arreglar todos sus papeles para que pudiera transitar por las calles sin ningún problema.
 Desde hace dos años tiene una base estable sin ningún detalles donde trabaja todos los días trabaja, "Pero los días lunes yo viajo a la ciudad de México porque hago viajes especiales y ahí si trabajo desde las 3:00 pm pero son días que mis ganancias aumentan" Comento David muy contento. Ahora con su nuevo préstamo comprara refacciones para su auto, el esta muy contento y agradecido porque ya no tendrá que preocuparse por reunir dinero para comprar sus refacciones, su única dificultad es la competencia sin embargo David todos los días se esfuerza por tener los mejores clientes tratarlos muy bien para que puedan volver a solicitarle sus servicios.
 Su único sueño es que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional pero ademas que su negocio siga creciendo porque de alguna manera quiere obtener una cadena de autos para darle trabajo a otras personas.
La fotografia fue tomada en las escaleritas del municipio, David es quien tiene la chamarra negra*

loans.use: Comprara reaciones para su carro.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz has been engaged in farming for 4 years.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 ne bought 0,04 hectare plot of land. She cultivates the plot of land to grow vegetables.
She is 30, married, has a child, lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village..
Now she needs  a loan of $800 to buy in addition the plot of land in order to grow the vegetables.

loans.use: To buy plot of land

loans.name: Joncilia

texts.en:
Joncilia (pictured with one of her daughters who helps run her clothing store) raises seven children out of her thatched home outside Trou-du-Nord in north western Haiti. To support her large family, she has opened up two stores outside her house, situated along a small river heavily frequented by her neighbours. Joncilia runs a small candy stand as well as a clothing store. This loan will allow Joniclia to pay for transportation to the larger markets near the Dominican boarder and have capital to purchase a larger amount of clothes so she will not have to travel as frequently to replenish her inventory. She is hard-working and a well-respected member of her town. Joncilia has established a good business plan and clientele base but needs additional funding to make her businesses more self-sustainable while still supporting her seven children and saving for improving their home and their future.

NOTE: Jonicilia and four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community have formed a solidarity group to receive equal shares of $400 of this $1200 loan to develop their respective businesses. They have each gone through Esperanza´s business training program and proven to be responsible leaders of their household and community. They have each been evaluated and Esperanza personnel have determined that they are in the greatest need for micro-credit services in order to provide the basic necessities for their children and support the community.

loans.use: Purchase pants, shirts, dresses, hats in bulk; pay for transportation to the markets; increase capital for investment and savings

loans.name: Stora

texts.en: Stora lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and she has good work experience. She is a widow supporting her family since her husband's death 8 years ago during the war. She took her first cycle group loan and bought sewing machines and does a good business and helps her family. Now she wants to take anther loan to expand her business and buy extra materials for tailoring.  She wants  make a better future for her children. She is happy with all her family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for tailoring

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio has two sons, ages 2 and 3. He works as a construction worker alongside his wife and they live in his parents' home. They have no other income.

Because construction work is too strenuous for his wife, they would like for her to start a business selling habas (similar to green peas) in the rural areas of La Paz.

The loan will be used as seed money to buy inventory to start her new business. Habas are a main food staple of the rural families of Bolivia; they are boiled and served with cheese and potatos.

This is Julio's first loan with IMPRO and he has been evaluated and found to qualify. The loan will enable him to improve his wife's working conditions while allowing her to contribute to the family's support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio tiene dos hijo de 2 y 3 años de edad. Trabaja de albañil juntamente con su esposa y viven en la casa de sus padres. No tienen otros ingresos. El trabajo de albañil es un trabajo muy pesado para su esposa, por tal motivo la señora trabajara de comerciante de Haba en las zonas rurales de La Paz. El crédito requerido será utilizado como capital de arranque para la compra de mercadería (habas) y así iniciar esta nueva actividad. Para vuestra información, las habas son hortalizas muy parecidas a las alverjas cuyo nombre en ingles es “green peas”, solo que son mas grandes. Las habas son alimento esencial para la gente del campo, pues se pueden hervir y se comen con queso y papa. Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado, de esa forma Julio podrá ofrecerle mejor condición de trabajo para su esposa y esta misma ayudara a la manutención de la familia.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Vaialalua

texts.en: Ms Vaialalua is a single lady who is twenty seven years old. She didn’t finish school due to the lack of financial support from her parents. Instead, she stayed home and started a vegetable garden and plantation business with the help of her father. She said she only has two hands to work with, but the weeds grew much faster for her two hands, and she now needs some chemicals to kill them. She applied for the amount of US $300 to buy chemicals like gromoxome, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain good growth of her produce. She really appreciates the help she has received from the SPBD program because she believed without them, she could not continue her small business.

loans.use: To buy the chemicals and vegetables seeds for her plantation and vegetable garden

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia, 47, is a loving mother of three. Her husband left her six years ago, and since then she has served as the father and mother for her children and has been their sole provider, thanks to her perseverance and dedication toward her work. She sells clothing items, and little by little the business has progressed and given Natalia favorable results and filled here with satisfaction and joy. Her hard work has helped improve the quality of life for her family. Of course, Natalia wants to keep prospering along with her business and keep advancing the family, helping her beloved children go to college and improve the situation in her country. To help her carry out her goals, Natalia is requesting a loan to purchase more articles for her business to sell so she can increase her income. This exemplary and courageous mother waits for your kind support and good heart to help move her and her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Natalia de 47 años, es madre de tres hijos a los que ama mucho, su esposo la abandonó hace siete años y desde entonces desempeño las funciones de padre y madre de sus retoños, siendo así el único sustento familiar, gracias a la perseverancia y dedicación que le puso a su negocio, la oferta de prendas de vestir.Poco a poco fue progresando obteniendo resultados favorables que la llenan de satisfacción y alegría, su buen desempeño en su noble labor ha podido contribuir notablemente a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Sin embargo Natalia desea seguir prosperando con su oficio que le está permitiendo sacar adelante a su familia, ofreciéndoles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos a fin de que muy pronto puedan contribuir con mejorar la situación de su familia y de su país..Para concretar sus planes Natalia solicita un préstamo para adquirir artículos para su comercialización y así obtener mayor beneficio económico. Esta ejemplar y valerosa madre espera el apoyo de tu gentil y buen corazón para salir adelante junto a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in more products to offer a wider quantity and variety.

loans.name: Louis Adotè

texts.fr:
At 43 years of age, Mr. Louis Adotè E. is married and has three (3) children. Having been struck blind, he is supported by his wife in his art business (dying fabrics). It is difficult to meet the needs of the family due to limited means. Mr. Louis is asking for a loan of $600 to buy fabric and dyes in order to increase his productivity in the market and to deal with the household difficulties through the increased profit margin in order to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 43 ans, Monsieur E. Louis Adotè est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Frappé par la cécité (non voyant), il est soutenu par sa femme dans son activité d’art (Teinture de tissus). Difficile de subvenir aux besoins de la famille par leur maigre moyen. Monsieur Louis sollicite un prêt de $600 pour acheter des tissus et teintures afin d’accroître sa productivité sur le marché et de faire face aux difficultés familiales par la marge bénéficiaire dégagée afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fabric and dyes

loans.name: Alindi

texts.en: Alindi is a 37 year old married man. He lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Alindi has 2 children. Alindi sells vegetables around the region and uses his pick up truck for transportation. Alindi is a popular young man in his village and in the neighboring surroundings. He needs a loan to help him replace his pick up truck.

loans.use: To replace his pick up truck

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es:
Mario lives a rural community of Ticuantepe; he is married and has 2 minor age children. Eight years ago he started a small business in his humble home because he was unemployed at the time and the head of the household. Together with his wife, he decided to open a grocery store which would offer food products for his neighbors. His goal was to offer a variety of products that were affordable and easily accessible since they live in a very mountainous area far away from town, several kilometers away from the central market of the municipality.

Currently the grocery store is in need of a major investment. The area is growing and his customers are requesting more products. He wants to diversify his supply of red and white meat. His customers buy daily what they consume and he would like to guarantee the availability of all the products that they need to prepare their meals and feed their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Mario habita en una comunidad rural de Ticuantepe, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, hace 8 años en su humilde vivienda creó su pequeño negocio, ya que se encontraba sin empleo en ese momento y era él la cabeza de su hogar, al verse en esa situación decidió junto a su esposa montar una pulpería en la que ofrecerían productos alimenticios de consumo masivo a sus vecinos, con el objetivo de ofrecerles una variedad de productos que estuviesen al alcance del bolsillo y que lo encontraran muy cerca de sus viviendas, ya que habitan en una zona muy montañosa, alejada del pueblo y en la cual recorren varios kilómetros para transitar y llegar al mercado central de ese municipio.

Actualmente, la pulpería requiere de mayor inversión, ya que la zona donde habita esta creciendo y sus clientes están demandando mayormente los productos, además de diversificar la oferta de carne roja y blanca, ya que sus clientes compran día a día lo que consumen y por lo mismo desean garantizarles todos los productos que necesitan para elaborar sus comidas y alimentar a sus familias.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil, milk, juices, bread, chicken, meat, eggs, cheese, vegetables.

loans.name: Doribell Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doribell C., who is 34 years old, lives with her husband and 2 young kids in Villa Reconciliacion. Together her and her husband work selling wood, something they have been doing for 11 years. They need a loan to buy some mahogany, royal cedar and light cedar, which are the best sellers. With their mutual efforts as a marriage partnership they have given their family all that is needed, they have a good credit rating and they hope that, in these difficult times, the price of wood would go up so that with great effort their business would move forwards.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

DORIBELL C., de 34 años de edad, habita con sus esposo y dos hijos menores en Villa Reconciliación es casada y junto a su esposo trabajan e el comercio de madera desde hace 11 años. Necesitan un crédito para comprar madera de caoba, cedro real y cedro macho que son las variedades de mayor venta, con el esfuerzo mutuo como matrimonio han mantenido su hogar sin mayores necesidades, han crecido con su buen comportamiento de crédito y aspiran en estos tiempos difíciles en que el precio de la madera esta alto poner sus mejores esfuerzos para sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a variety of wood/Comprar variedades de madera

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a single woman. Mwanaidi owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. She works from 7am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $310 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory, such as blue band, juice, rice and flour.

loans.use: To increase the inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
T. Jumagul, a 45-year-old widowed market vendor living with her parents, is the mother of a marvelous daughter who helps Jumagul sell a variety of vegetables and fruits including tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, apricots, apples, and strawberries. Buying produce from the local farmers early every morning, she then sells it in the local market.

She works very hard to give her dearest daughter a good education and make her happy; to cover the educational expenses as her daughter enters university, Jumagul is planning to increase her working capital. In order to expand the range of produce she sells, she is requesting a $500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months. Jumagul and her daughter are counting on your help and thank you for your support.

loans.use: To increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 57 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. She has a very difficult life: her husband passed away, and she was taking care of 4 children by herself. She is very hard-working and self-motivated. Her children are now grown-up, working and building their own families. Living in rural area, her income is mainly from agricultural activities and breeding animals. Joining the TYM Fund, she is able to borrow money and use it in breeding animals. Therefore, she is now having a fair amount of saving money to help her children. Her children also come to assist her with her agricultural works. Her income is 100 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest in breeding pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết 57 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004 với hoàn cảnh vất vả chồng mất sớm, bản thân chị gánh vác tất cả công việc gia đình và nuôi 4 người con. Với bản chất chịu thương chịu khó chị luôn có ý trí vượt lên số phận, hiện nay các con chị đã trưởng thành và xây dựng gia đình, xuất thân từ nông thôn mọi thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu trông vào nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn và sử dụng vốn của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, từ việc chăn nuôi đó mà chị đã tích lũy được số tiền kha khá số tiền này đều được chi lo xây dựng cho các con chị, các con chị nay đều đã có cuộc sông riêng, tuy vậy các con chị vẫn thường xuyên hỗ trợ chị các công việc nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi, những lúc nhàn rỗi chị vẫn đi làm thuê, thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn nay chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: Breeding pigs and chickens

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aïssatou N. is married with seven children in her care. She is requesting this loan to fund her business rearing table chickens and at the same time buy and sell cloth dyed using a resist-dye technique found in Senegal called "thioup.” She will thus be able to help improve the living conditions, health and survival of her family. This loan will be repaid in a single installment at the end of six months.  
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Mme Aïssatou N. est mariée, avec 07 enfants à charge. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour financer son projet d’élevage de poulet de chaire et en même temps acheter et revendre des tissus teints « THIOUP ». Elle contribuera ainsi à améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de survie de sa famille. Ce prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois .

loans.use: To fund her project of rearing table chickens and also buy and sell cloth

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 42 years old, divorced, and now lives on her own. She has lived in the city of Juliaca for 31 years, having left her own village to look for a better life in a bigger city. Since then, she has worked making and selling textiles, a business which has supported her all these years. As she was unable to finish her education, she was not able to pursue a more formal profession.

Alejandrina likes her work. She first learned to sew from her mother, who taught her many important things such as believing in herself. She works hard to make sure she has a good future as she gets older. With the loan, she will be able to grow her business, purchase the material she needs and maybe even open her own small shop in the future, where she could work with other women who like Alejandrina, have been strong and capable on their own.

Alejandrina tiene 42 años, es divorciada y vive sola, ya que no tuvo hijos. Ella reside en Juliaca hace 31 años, partió de su pueblo para buscarse una mejor vida en la ciudad, desde entonces se ha dedicado a la venta de prendas tejidas a máquina, negocio que le ha servido para mantenerse durante toda su vida, ya que al no terminar su primaria no se pudo valer de armas para forjarse un futuro profesional.A Alejandrina le gusta su trabajo, el tejer se lo enseñó su madre, de la cual aprendió muchas cosas, como valerse por sí misma, pero como toda labor también tiene su parte difícil, en este caso es terminar la producción de sus prendas. Alejandrina trabaja para forjarse un mejor futuro y asegurar su vejez. Con el préstamo, esta valiente mujer podrá agrandar su negocio, comprando materiales y si es posible poner un taller en el futuro, donde pueda dar trabajo a otras mujeres que como ella que siempre se han valido solas.

a Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL NEEDED TO MAKE HER TEXTILES, GROW HER BUSINESS, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT HERSELF.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María Elena, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la región  y  provincia de  San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, útiles escolares, pasamanería y artículos para regalos. Ya tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. San Pedro Nº 253, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, quienes son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, juguetes, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para  surtir bien su negocio y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Maria Elena tiene 44 años de edad,  vive con su esposo quien la apoya en el negocio en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio, porque le gusta lo que hace. Su meta es continuar con el negocio, seguir creciendo y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena, member of “Las Orquídeas” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. Her main business is the sale of groceries, school supplies, sewing trimmings, and gift items. She has been in this business for a while, and it is going well for her. Her store is located in her own home in Jr. San Pedro No. 253, and her clients—mostly neighbors and friends—frequent her business daily. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which she will repay in six installments, she hopes to buy essential products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, non-perishables of different sizes, toys, toilet paper, detergent, and soaps of different brands and sizes to better supply her business and meet her customers demands. María Elena is 44 years old and lives with her husband—who helps her run the business in his free time. She is a hardworking and charismatic woman. She enjoys what she does and would very much like to continue her business. Her ultimate goal is to continue with and keep expanding her business and to have it stocked to both her and her clients’ satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing essential products (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc).

loans.name: Centrobank Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Centrobank esta ubicado en el centro de Huancavelica, se encuentra muy cerca del parque Santa Ana, el malecón Santa Rosa y el Río Ichu. Sus actividades con comerciales, agricultura y ganadería.

Angela H., tiene 1 hijo pequeño a quien a tenido muy joven, desde hace 3 meses vende chalinas, gorros, guantes, pues tiene que mantener a su hijo, solicita un préstamo para incrementar material para su negocio,. Angela sueña con ser profesional y tener una tiendecita.

Roheni Galli, es conviviente tiene un bebe de 3 meses, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, a veces vende dulces, al quedar embarazada sus padres la votaron de su casas, desde ese entonces aprendió lo que es trabajar, con su préstamo quiere comprar una parrilla para vender sus anticuchos.

Elvia Z., es casada, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, con los prestamos que ha recibido ha ido incrementando su negocio, ahora vende chalinas, gorras y quiere comprar mas mercadería para poder tener mas ingresos y ahorrar.
texts.en:
The communal bank Centrobank is located in the center of Huancavelica, very close to Santa Ana Park, the Santa Rosa promenade, and the Ichu River. Their activities are as merchants, farmers, and raising livestock.

Angela H. has a small son, who she had when she was very young. For three months she has been selling shawls, caps and gloves, as she must support her son. She seeks a loan to increase the inventory for her business. She dreams of being a professional and having a little store.

Roheni Galli lives is partnered and has a 3-month old baby. She dedicates herself to the sale of anticuchos (beef kabobs), and sometimes sells candy. When she became pregnant, her parents threw her out of their house and since then she has learned what it is to work. With her loan, she would like to buy a grill to use in selling her anticuchos.

Elvia Z. is married and has two children. She dedicates herself to raising cuyes (guinea pigs). With previous loans, she has grown her business. Now, she sells shawls and caps and would like to buy more merchandise to increase her income and be able to save.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The communal bank Centrobank needs 6,000.00 new soles so that its 13 members can invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal A. is a 32 year old businessman. He is a husband and the father of one male child who is currently in school. He trades in cows and onions. He buys the cows and the bags of onions from the northern part of Ghana, and sometimes travels to Niger and other West African countries. He then supplies restaurant operators with meat for their meals. Beef is enjoyed by many Ghanaian households because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable. 

Faisal's business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the animals from the farmers. With the loan, he wishes to buy more cows and bags of onions. The loan will provide the resources he needs to meet the demands of his customers for good quality meat. He also hopes to save more to support his son in school.
