texts.en: Fida'ee is a 40-year-old young man who is married and has two sons. He lives in Ramallah city in Palestine. Fida'ee drives a taxi that he owns and it is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase a car repair kit and pay for licensing and insuring the taxi, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Fida'ee takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the repair kit for the taxi to fix things when needed and to pay for licensing and insuring the taxi so it will be legal. Fida'ee will work extra hours to increase his income and live with his family in better conditions. Fida'ee is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring his car and to buy a car repair kit.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra María tiene 34 años, su actividad es una pulpería en donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. A pesar de ser una comarca muy pequeña ella ha logrado brindar a sus clientes los productos que le solicitan como granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico, fósforos, cigarrillos, golosinas entre otros. Es por eso que se siente motivada a realizar este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 34 years old. She has a small grocery store where she takes care of customers from 7:00AM in the morning until 10:00PM at night. 

Despite being a very small area she has been able to provide her customers with what they want, such as basic grains, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, cigarettes, candy and other items, and this is what motivates her to ask for a loan in order to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, cigarettes, and candy

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw currently runs on petrol which is very expensive, so he wants to install a CNG kit (set of components and tools that are installed in a vehicle so it can operate using both gasoline and compressed natural gas or CNG) on his rickshaw that will minimize his expenses and increase his rickshaw’s mileage. 
He has been providing transport services to passengers for the past 10 years and Fouzia is very confident that by utilizing the loan he will be able to run his business better and increase his profits. 
Fouzia is 33 years old and she has no children yet, so she spends most of her time doing decorative embroidery which earns her good profits every month. She learned this skill from her mother. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fouzia”.

loans.use: To install a CNG kit in a rickhsaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Socorro es una de las integrantes de Banco solidario Amor De Mujeres, tiene 63 años tiene 6 hijos bajo su cargo, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, desde hace mas de 18 años, su comarca se llama las mojarras en donde trabaja en su propia vivienda. Este es el primer crédito que solicita para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, servilletas entre otros productos. Ya que le permitirá generar ingresos para aportar al hogar y tiene como meta proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. Al igual que Socorro las otras integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy contentas por este financiamiento ya que cada una de ellas tiene diferentes negocios. En este banco comunal se encuentran Danelia, Otilia, Jeyling, Socorro, Gertrudis, Oneyda, Ana, Meylin, Lourdes, Migdania, Telma, Reyna, Yalma, Martha y Ana.
texts.en: Socorro, 63, is one of the members of the Amor de Mujeres community bank.  She has 6 children, all of whom she supports.  She has operated a business making and selling tortillas for 18 years.  She operates her shop, called Las Mojarras, from her house.  This is her first loan and she will use it to buy maize, quicklime, firewood, bags and other kitchen supplies that she needs for the business.  The loan will help her to increase the income she needs to support her family.  She also wants to make improvements to her house.  The other members of the group have various businesses and, like Socorro, are grateful for the help the bank provides.  The members of the group are: Danelia, Otilia, Jeyling, Socorro, Gertrudis, Oneyda, Ana, Meylin, Lourdes, Migdania, Telma, Reyna, Yalma, Martha and Ana.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 28-year-old single man, who opened a small food store four years ago. From the profit that he makes from the store, he is planning to marry and have his own family. To be able to do that, and to be well prepared to start a new family, Alaa sees that he should improve his food store by adding more products to make more profit. He also wants to build a storage for the store. In order to achieve that, he has applied for a loan to start the store improvement phase step-by-step.

loans.use: to add more food products and build a storage room for the store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Rosita has a sari-sari store. She earns about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Rosita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase stocks for her general store.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Rosita would like to have merchandise to earn enough money to meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 28 años, empezó con su negocia hace 5 años atrás, comenzó vendiendo lamina y con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de Dios ha podido agrandar su negocio hasta establecer un bazar.

Trabaja todos los días de 6 y 30 de la mañana hasta las 8 y 30 de la noche. Su única dificultad es la delincuencia, ya que el sector es algo peligroso. Está casada y su esposo trabaja como maestro contratista, y tienen 3 hijos de 12, 6 que estudian en escuela fiscal y su último hijo de 2 años.

Tienes muchas aspiraciones por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo caudernos, laminas, papelería. Su meta es terminar de darles la educación a sus hijos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mariana, 28, started her business five years ago; she started out selling illustrated prints and with effort and God’s help she has been able to enlarge her business until she opened a store.

She works every day from 6:30 in the morning until 8:30 at night.  Her only difficulty is delinquency because her neighborhood is a bit dangerous.  She’s married and her husband works as a building contractor.  They have three children who are 12 and 6 years old and attending public school; her youngest son is two years old.

She has many hopes and this is why she wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, laminated prints and stationery supplies.  Her goal is to finish providing education for her children and to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, illustrated prints and paper goods.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school. 
 
For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maryjean

texts.en:
Maryjean is 37 years old, married and blessed with four children. She works in a farming business and has been planting rice for over 10 years. It provides them great economic benefits. She wants to improve their business to receive a good profit. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs of planting.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to gather enough income to lift up her family out of poverty and save for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Orestes

texts.es:
Orestes tiene 44 años, convive con Carlota de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia. Orestes es un hombre con deseos de superación, con bastante experiencia para los negocios. A los 7 años se separó de su familia y no fue al aolegio viviendo de pequeños trabajos para subsistir, cuando ya tenía 18 años conoció a Carlota y juntos formaron una familia, entonces ya trabajaba como agricultor cultivando café en la parcela que su suegro le cedió. Poco a poco fueron saliendo de la pobreza y compraron su propio terreno donde ahora construyeron su vivienda. Ahi montaron una tienda de abarrotes y venta de combustibles, con la finalidad de incrementar su ingreso económico familiar.
Está feliz y contento por su labor ya que le es tan rentable que piensa en un futuro ampliar su negocio.
Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles invertirá en el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, por lo que contratará peones.
texts.en:
Orestes, 44, lives with Carlota, 40, and they have three children.  They live together in the settlement of Chuvivana in Sivia District.  Orestes is a man who very much wants to get ahead and has quite a bit of business experience.  

At the age of seven he left his family and did not attend school living off small jobs to subsist.  When he turned 18 he met Carlota and they formed a family.  He was already working as a coffee farmer then on a piece of land his father-in-law ceded to him.  Gradually they started to move out of poverty and they bought their own piece of property where they built their house.  They opened a store there selling groceries and fuel in order to increase family income.  He is happy and content with his work because he feels it’s profitable and in future he plans to expand it.

This will be his first MFP loan and he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to invest in his fields: he will hire day laborers.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Proeun

texts.en: Mrs. Proeun, 32, is a married woman who is in the business of pig raising business. She has been in this business for more than 2 years. She typically earns an average of $4.00 per day to cover her daily needs. And presently she has been blessed with 2 school-age children attending in a local public primary school. Proeun wants to improve her business: buys additional piglets to raise, build a healthy pigpen for her pigs and purchase pig feeds. However, she has inadequate capital to attain her goal. Therefore, she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to support in her pig fattening business. She hopes that her business will improve and thereby increase her household revenue.

loans.use: to support in her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una persona que gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante ha podido superar grandes dificultades que le ha presentado la vida. Diana asistió a un curso donde aprendió el corte y cepillado del cabello, y posteriormente montó su negocio de sala de belleza en su propia casa. Debido a circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad, se vio en la obligación de cerrar su negocio y emigrar hacia otro país en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de progreso. En este país no duró mucho tiempo y decidió regresar a Colombia para continuar con su negocio de sala de belleza. Hace 6 meses que regresó al país y debido al poco capital con el que cuenta, ha sido muy poco en lo que ha podido avanzar en el montaje de su salón de belleza. Es por esto que Diana espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder la compra de una silla, un lava-cabezas y avisos publicitarios para terminar el montaje de su salón de belleza. 
Diana espera que de esta manera su negocio genere mayores ingresos y de esta manera pueda ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida sus 2 hijos, además de poder cumplirles su sueño de acceder a una educación universitaria. Diana también espera que su negocio crezca y se consolide, gracias a la buena ubicación que tiene, y pueda generar un puesto de trabajo para una persona muy necesitada.

loans.use: Compra de una silla, un lava-cabezas y avisos publicitarios para terminar el montaje de su salón de belleza.

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Naum, 28, is a farmer who has worked in the fields all his life. When she was a child her parents taught him everything related to agriculture.
She lives in the rich highlands of Kapsowar with her husband and 5 children. Naum has been practicing farming for the past 7 years and, through those years, she has been able to support her family. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk, and crop farming.

The Kapsowar area is populated and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Nahum's biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry. 

Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kapsowar and you don’t need to be a large scale farmer or have so many poultry birds to benefit from it. Through the loan, Naum will be able to sell eggs, meat and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in her area.

Naum has been facing challenges accessing finances but she feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make her dream come true. Naum chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and is on a reducing basis. Naum underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. 

Through the loan, Naum’s income will increase and her life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for her family and a positive impact on the community.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Maria Bertila

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, estudio hasta primer grado, tuvo que abandonar sus estudios porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos; está soltera, pero es madre de un joven de 21 años de edad, quien hace un año terminó bachillerato.

María, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era un niña y al no poder estudiar se dedicó a trabajar a cuidar una anciana y para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo, madruga para caminar 15 minutos hasta donde toma el autobús y luego viaja 4 kilómetros y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos cerdos y concentrado para que crezcan y obtener ganancia cuando los venda. 

María, sueña con realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y tener más cerdos para vender.

loans.use: para comprar dos cerdos y concentrado para que crezcan y obtener ganancia cuando los venda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HER NURSERY SCHOOL

loans.name: Guido

texts.en:
Guido produces rice and corn on lands given to him by his father, with also some small production of plantains. He lives with his brother who he works in the fields with. He will invest the loan to plant for the next cycle. He will prepare the lands and also buy fertilizer and seeds. Although he does not have children, he is still very family oriented. He is very close to his mother, father and brother. He hopes he can fix the lands so they can be productive for years to come. He is also hoping to start a family of his own in the near future.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: I. Osman  is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He is the very successful business owner of a small bakery. Here, in a small, narrow room, his older daughter and wife bake bread from early morning till late night.Therefore, Osman has applied for a 1200 USD loan to improve his wife and daughter's working conditions by purchasing a ventilation system.

loans.use: To enlarge his bakery and purchase a ventilation system for better working conditions.

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Luis and his wife sell clothing. They have set up a part of their home as a store for their clients to come and visit. During the day, Luis travels to the rural sector of Ecuador in his truck offering his products in the small towns. While he is away, his wife sells the clothing from their home. Luis started selling clothes after losing a job he held in a large company for about 15 years. He bought a used truck and started investing all of his savings.

He now needs this, his second loan, because he wants to continue investing in new styles of clothing and shoes. He will also try to invest in a new line of products such as soaps, detergents and other household items. He is 65 years old and has 2 children with his wife.

loans.use: Invest in more clothes and a line of cleaning products

loans.name: Letoee

texts.en: Mrs. K. is a fifty eight year old woman married with four children and she has been getting loans from SPBD from the past three years; this will be her fifth loan. Most of her past loans were used for improvement of her business by buying chemicals to kill weeds and and purchase fertilizers for the growth of her crops. She is also looking to purchase a toilet set to improve the health condition of her family. She hopes that her next loan will used to repair their house even further. She is happy with both her businesses (plantation and pancake sales) as it is a great help to her many family and church commitments and contributions. She plans to remain in the SPBD program for a long time in order to obtain more loans for her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy gromoxone, sting, and fertilizer for the plantation, as well as the ingredients needed for pancakes. Also to buy cement and toilet seat for her bathroom.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina belongs to the Calzadina Cooperative Bank in Moyobamba. She sells groceries from her home and cold soft drinks at a stand at a nearby school. She also bakes bread and pastries. She is a hard-working woman who enjoys and challenge and being able to support herself. With this loan for 400 soles, or about $150, to be repaid in four installments. Orfelina will stock groceries including rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, soda, and other household goods like detergent. She is 49 years and has four children. Two of her daughters help with the businesses. Orfelina is very proud of her success and hopes to continue to offer her customers everything they need from a single location.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfelina pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidad Calzadina, vive en Moyobamba, Región San Martín. Se dedica la venta D. abarrotes en su casa, pero también ella venD. refrigerios en un kiosko que alquiló en el colegio D. su localidad, así mismo se dedica a la preparación y venta D. panes y dulces. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque es una persona muy dinámica que le encanta los retos y tiene habilidades para el negocio, con su dinamismo ella genera sus propios ingresos lo cual incrementa su autoestima así como su crecimiento como persona y mujer. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 400.00 soles ($ 134.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar en sacos, cajas D. leche D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, aceite en cajas, paquetes D. detergentes, fideos, gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, y demás productos para surtir mejor su negocio. Tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, dos D. sus hijas le apoyan en el negocio y en las actividades D. la casa, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha su clientela aumentó, su meta es contar con un negocio bien implementado para que el cliente encuentre todo lo que busca en un solo lugar.

loans.use: To stock groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Her husband has a very unpredictable income. She has been in the business of extracting oil for 12 years. She buys palm nuts in the surrounding villages, extracts the oil, and sells that oil at the local market. She uses old fashioned methods to extract the oil. This loan would allow her to buy enough palm nuts to increase her production in order to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Akou A. est agée de 35 ans ,mariée et mère de 6 ans. Son mari a des revenus très irréguliers. Elle exercerce l'activité d'extration d'huile depuis de 12 ans. Elle achete des noix de palm dans les villages environnants, extrait de l'huile de palm et revend cette huile sur le marché local . Elle utilise les méthodes artisanales pour extraire l'huille. Le présent emprunt va la servir à acheter assez de noix de palm pour augmenter la production afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 60 bowls of palm nuts in surrounding villages, extraction of cooking oil and sale at the market

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura, age 28, is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 9. Since March 2007, Ashura has been running a charcoal business: she sells charcoal from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$110. Ashura hopes to receive a loan to increase the monthly charcoal sales volume. She belongs to the loan group Mtanzania.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Lukoto East G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose N.. She is currently in the business of selling cabbages and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Rose is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a coffee trader. She has 7 children ranging from age 5 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 9500 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add more capital to the business. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Edith N., Lucy Namugere, Monica K., and Teopista N.. Edith N. has a business in coffee selling and wants to boost business. Lucy Namugere is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to add capital. Monica K. operates a business of cabbage selling and wants to uplift business. Teopista N. is currently in the business of operating a hotel and is requesting a loan to add to the business and provide better quality services.

loans.use: To boost vegetable business

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
San Juan de Loro is one of the most beautiful valleys of the Puno department. Its residents are fruit-growers and produce a great variety of fruit such as papayas, oranges, bananas, cacao, etc. Octavia is no stranger to this activity. As a resident of this beautiful valley, she got started in the fruit-growing business since she was a child. For many years she used to distribute a large variety of fruits, from her native city, to different wholesale buyers. However, she later realized that she could earn higher profits selling her merchandise directly to the consumer. Therefore, four years ago she decided to obtain a stand at the Santa Bárbara Market in the city of Juliaca, whence she sells her fresh and delicious fruit.

At the moment, as she takes note of the demands of the market, she hopes to expand the quantity and variety of her products. It is with this purpose that she comes to you requesting a loan. Your help will allow Octavia to carry out her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

San Juan de Loro, es uno de los valles más hermosos del departamento de Puno, sus pobladores son productores de una gran variedad de frutas como papayas, naranjas, plátanos, cacao, etc, y doña Octavia no es ajena a esta actividad, ella como pobladora de ese hermoso valle desde muy niña se dedicó a la producción de frutas.Durante mucho años distribuía una inmensa variedad de frutas desde su misma ciudad natal a los diferentes compradores mayoristas, pero observó que podía obtener mayores ingresos económicos siendo la vendedora directa de su mercadería, es por ello que desde hace 4 años decidió adquirir su puesto de venta en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde ahí se dedica a vender sus deliciosas y frescas frutas.

En esta oportunidad observando la demanda del mercado tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad y variedad de productos, es con ese propósito recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo. Tu importante aporte permitirá concretar los planes de Octavia.

loans.use: To increase her capital and be able to offer a greater quantity of fruits.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: Rehana K. is the group leader. She is married and a mother of seven: three boys and four girls. Her family resides in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore. Her husband makes a living driving a horse cart.  He also knows how to tailor clothing. He transports wood based on orders in his cart.  He needs a loan to buy an additional cart for the business to increase his income. The other women in the group are: Zubaida B. (who wants to buy a horse), Balqees B. (who will buy a horse cart) and Kalsoom B. (who needs this loan for her husband who is a turner).

loans.use: to buy an additional cartt

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akuélé K. was born August 29, 1960 in Lomé. She is a married mother of three children. In April 2005, she established a dry cleaning business (JEANNA PRESSING) in the Attiégou neighborhood in Lomé. In her store, she also sells telephone cards and has a telephone booth. Mrs. Akuélé K. is a very energetic woman who sells nearly anything that can’t be found elsewhere in the neighborhood. With the first five loans she obtained, she purchased a washing machine and a refrigerator. The loan she is currently requesting will allow her to purchase 25 bags of charcoal, 10 dozen pairs of shoes and 20 bouquets of flowers. Once she sells these items, she will be able to increase her income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Akuélé est née le 29 août 1960 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. En Avril 2005, elle a crée un centre de lavage à sec (JEANNA PRESSING) dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Dans son centre, elle vend également des cartes de recharges et dispose d’une cabine téléphonique. Madame K. Akuélé est une femme très dynamique qui vend presque tout ce qui n’est pas dans son quartier. Avec les cinq premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenu, elle a acquis, une machine à laver, un réfrigérateur. Le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter vingt cinq (25) sacs de charbons de bois, dix (10) douzaines de chaussures et vingt (20) bouquets de fleurs. Ainsi à l’issue de ces ventes elle pourra augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of 25 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Doan Thi T. first joined TYM in 2001 in order to have more capital to raise cattle. In the first loan, she borrow 1 million VND to buy breeding pigs and by the third loan cycle, her family has been able to buy a cow and start raising them as well. Hard work and careful preparation paid off as her family standard of living has dramatically changed. All her children now are grown up and have their own families. In this cyclem, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in raising cattle. Her family monthly income is 3 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đoàn Thị Tuyên 56 Tuổi, năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để chăn nuôi, thấy rằng nếu chỉ làm ruộng thì kinh tế gia đình khó phát triển, nên anh chị đã cố gắng chăn nuôi để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 1.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, sau 2 vòng vay vốn gia đình chị đã mua thêm được 1 con bò vừa phục vụ nhà nông và lại sinh sản, các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò và lợn thịt, chăn nuôi hiệu quả gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi cần thiết cho gia đình, 3 con chị đã lớn đều xây dựng gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xịn vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng .

loans.use: Raise cattle

loans.name: Mukawera

texts.en:
Mukawera J. was born in 1961. She lives in Gatsata. She has been a widow since 1994 when her husband died during the genocide. They had four children when her husband died. After the genocide, she took another three orphans under her charge. Currently, one child is in secondary school while the others are in primary school. In 1996, with 20,000 RWF as capital, she began selling dresses second-hand in the local market. At the end of the year, she had 80,000 RWF as capital.

She came to VFC requesting a loan in order to increase her capital and diversify the goods she sells. She wants a loan to begin a new kind of business selling tires.

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat Shahbaz baji is the wife of M.. She lives in the small city of Kasur, in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. Farhat baji is a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has a electronics shop where he sells stoves and washing machines. Farhat baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors. Farhat baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more stoves and washing machines for her husband's electronics shop.

Farhat baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji and Hamidan baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Amna baji wants a loan to buy decorative embroidery material (thread and cloth). Sakina baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies

loans.name: Ni Putu Yeni Kiswanti

texts.id: Putu Yeni adalah seorang ibu muda yang tinggal di desa Manistutu yang jauh dari keramaian kota. Putu hidup bersama dengan suami dan anaknya yang berumur 6 tahun. Putu menekuni usaha ternak babi karena harus membantu penghasilan suaminya yang seorang petani dimana memang dirasakan tidak cukup memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga di jaman sekarang ini. Dalam menekuni usahanya Putu tergabung di kelompok ternak babi Kembang Mekar. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI memberi pengaruh yang sangat bagus untuk perkembangan usaha ternak babinya. Untuk jangka waktu pemeliharaan 5 bulan Putu Yeni bisa mendapat keuntungan sampai Rp.500.000,-. Karena itulah Putu Yeni melanjutkan kerja sama dengan DINARI melalui pinjaman yang kedua. Pinjaman berjangka waktu 6 bukan ini akan digunakannya untuk menambah populasi ternak babinya dengan membeli 3 ekor bibit penggemukan disamping induk babi yang sudah dimilikinya. Dan sisa dari pembelian bibit akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak. Diharapkan dengan bertambahnya jumlah peliharaan serta pinjaman yang semakin meningkat maka bisa dimanfaatkan untuk membeli pakan yang lebih berkualitas sehingga akan menghasilkan panen yang lebih baik dari sebelumnya dan pada akhir periode nanti bisa mengembalikan pinjaman dari DINARI. Program DINARI secara ekonomi memang memberi dampak yang baik bagi keluarga Putu Yeni.
texts.en:
Putu Yeni is a young housewife lives in Manistutu village, away from a crowd of a city.putu lives with her husband and their 6 years old son. She is running a pig breeding business to help her husband, a farmer with low income, in fulfilling their family’s daily needs. Putu Yeni is a member of Kembang Mekar, a group of pig breeders. The first loan earned from DINARI gave a good impact that in 5 months, Putu Yeni was able to earn up to Rp 500,000 income. That is why she proposed to earn the second loan. The proposed loan will be a 6 months period loan with repayment on the end of the period. Putu Yeni will use the loan to purchase 3 more piglets; the rest will be used to purchase fodder. She hopes by the increase of the number of the piglets and the more capital she manages, she will be able to earn more. DINARI program really gives a good impact for Putu Yenis’s economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo Group

texts.en: "Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculos" ("Women Beating Obstacles") is a group of 14 women and 1 man. All members are excited about receiving their first loan, and are ready to start changing their lives and futures. This first loan they are requesting is around $150 US for each person and they plan to start businesses ranging from clothing stores to small restaurants. Germania is the chosen representative of this group, and she was chosen due to her hard-work ethic and diligence. She has been single for 22 years now, and has three children she has to take care of. She wants to start her own business to take care of her kids and loved ones more than for herself. She says she is excited about this opportunity and ready to take this step, and so is the rest of the group! On behalf of Germania, the group, and Esperanza International------ Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: This group of people want to create and improve their small businesses to provide better lives for their families.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena G. S. tiene 51 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II  y vive en la calle Spelucín Mz 10 lote 13 del Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz I del Puerto de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió  hasta segundo año de primaria y ya no continuó estudiando por falta de medios económicos, debido a que sus padres eran muy pobres.
Se casó a los 15 años y actualmente tiene 5 hijos, los 5 casados, con ella viven 3 nietos debido a que sus padres se encuentran trabajando en el extranjero.
Elena vende cerveza, gaseosa y alquila cuartos, tiene diez cuartos alquilados a trabajadores del puerto, los cuales le pagan para que les cocine la cena que no la tienen como pensión. Su negocio es en su casa.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas con ese préstamo empesó a comprar la cerveza y la gaseosa.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará material para arreglar sus cuartos, como mesitas de noche, colchas, etc.
Sueña con construir un gran hotel.
texts.en:
Elena G. S. is 51 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” and lives at Spelucín Mz 10 lote 13 in the Asentamiento Humano Auraora Diaz I neighborhood, Puerto de Salaverry city, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed second year of primary school but didn’t continue with her studies due to lack of money as her parents were very poor. She married at 15 years of age and today has 5 children, all are married, and 3 grandchildren live with her as their parents are working abroad. Elena sells beer, soda pop and rents rooms. She has 10 rooms rented to port workers, who then pay her to cook dinner as that is not included in the rent. Her business is located in her home. Her first loan for 300 soles was repaid in 4 payments and she bought beer and soda pop. With this loan for 2000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy materials to fix up her rooms, such as nightstands, bedspreads, etc. She dreams of building a great hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furnishings such as tables and bedspreads for rooms she rents

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San P. is a 44-year-old widow and lives in Angk village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who has a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces some problems because her field is far from an irrigation system.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump, rice seed, and fertilizer, and the rest of money to hire laborers to work in the field. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this loan. Mrs. San P. has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is a farmer to help the mother, and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pump, rice seed, and fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es:
La señora Delina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, también tiene un locutorio y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa. 

Con este crédito D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará  ropa para damas caballeros y niños, así como también invertirá en juguetes para aprovechar las fiestas D. navidad.
 
La señora Delina tiene 64 años D. edad, es madre D. 03 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y quiere más adelante implementar mejor su tópico para dar servicio D. inyectables y curaciones porque también estudió primeros auxilios.
texts.en:
Delina belongs to the “Santa Ana” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region of the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics, and she also has a public phone service and her business is located in her home. With this loan for S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy clothing for women, men and children, and she will invest in toys to take advantage of the Christmas holidays. Delina is 64 years old and mother of 3 grown children. She now lives with her husband and in the future she wants to expand her business to proviD. services related to injectables and treatments because she also studied first aid.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toys and clothing for women, men and children

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Narcisa del Socorro Martínez tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Narcisa tiene 1 hijo con la edad de 12 años y cursa recientemente el 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como capataz de la finca Santa Cecilia, sus propósitos son de mantener un buen comportamiento en los pagos ya que si mantiene su record crediticio podrá serle de mucha ayuda para el futuro sus deseos son de abrir otra actividad económica y así incrementar sus ingresos que son necesarios para proporcionarle a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan para que estos no pasen dificultades para el día de mañana sus sueños son de darle mejoras a su propiedad ya que su familia lo es todo por lo que quiere que sus hijos tengan su propia casa con las mejoras necesarias para que este sea un lugar digno donde vivir y todo esto lo quiere lograr con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo constante.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el destace de cerdo y venta en pie, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Doña Narcisa inicia este negocio por que en su familia ya existía este tipo de negocio y fue de forma hereditaria que logro quedarse con este negocio por lo que no le fue tan difícil desempeñarlo pero en lo que tuvo mas problemas fue en llamar la atención de su clientela porque tenia bastante competencia y todas las personas que se dedicaban a este tipo de oficio ya tenia sus propios clientes por lo que al inicio decide salir a la calles a ofrecer la carne y los nacatamales y los diferentes clientes que logro atraer fueron de otros lugares y así llegaban los clientes a su casa de habitación en busca del nacatamal, fritos y charrascas y sus mismos clientes fueron los que lograron darle fama y así sus vecinos se acercaban a su casa y compran lo que mas les gusta por lo que ahora solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que buscar la venta de los cerdos y tiene que recorrer varios lugares en busca de la mejor oferta para ella y sacar provecho de su producción.
texts.en:
Narcisa del Socorro Martínez is forty-four years old and married. She has one son, who is twelve years old and recently entered fifth grade. Her partner is a foreman on the farm Santa Cecilia. Narcisa aims to maintain her good credit record –it will be a huge help to her in the future. Narcisa dreams of opening another business – it could increase her income so that she could better support her children. She wants to give them all they need to live day-to-day without difficulty. She wishes also to make improvements to their property, since it is all her family has. and she wants her children to have their own house with good quality necessities; she wants it to be a decent place to live. She wants to achieve all this with much effort and constant work. Narcisa raises pigs and sells the pork on foot. Her operation is at her house. She has had this business for twelve years. She got involved in the business because this type of business was already in her family. She has stuck with it because it is not too difficult, but she had trouble attracting customers because she has a lot of competition, and all the people in this type of business already had their own customers. This is why, in the beginning, she decided to go out into the streets to try to sell her meat and nacatamales (a special Latin American tamale). The different customers she gained were from other places. They began coming to her house to buy nacatamales, fried foods, and charrascas. These customers made her business known, and her neighbors came by her house and bought more that they liked. Now she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, since she has to look for pigs and travel here and there to get them at the best price and make the most of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la casa que adquirieron hace tres años. Ella y su familia tienen una fábrica de zapatos donde elaboran los más bellos calzados hechos  base de cuero, vendiéndolos a diferentes comerciantes al por mayor, pues su producción es en grandes cantidades sobre todo en la temporada escolar donde elaboran zapatos que son enviados a otras provincias y vendidos a mayores costos. Dentro de todo este proceso de producción Gladys está encargada de las ventas y lleva los productos al centro de la capital para distribuirlos y si hay oportunidad, los vende personalmente, lo cual le agrada mucho y lo realiza los días viernes y sábados que son días muy buenos para el comercio, el resto de días se ocupa de la administración de la fábrica y sobre todo del personal, pues sus estudios como administradora le ayudan a poder desenvolverse en esta área. Con el tiempo desea mejorar su comercalizacion y está tramitando algunos papeles para negociar con entidades gubernamentales que están solicitando grandes cantidades de mercadería para los colegios más pobres del país, y ella desea ser parte de este proyecto. Gladys es una de las clientes más antiguas de MFP, este es su séptimo préstamo. Nos cuenta que el tiempo que logró tener con la institucion le ayudo a mejorar su fábrica y sus relaciones interpersonales. Los 1500 soles de su crédito los invertirá en la producción de zapatos para aprovechar la temporada escolar y tener mayores ingresos para hacer crecer el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house they bought three years ago. She and her family have a shoe factory where they make beautiful leather shoes, selling them wholesale to a number of retailers. They manufacture large quantities of shoes, especially during the school year, when they make shoes and send them to other provinces where they sell at higher prices. Within the production process, Gladys is in charge of sales and takes products to the capital to distribute them and, if she has the opportunity, even to sell them to individuals. She enjoys the work and does it every Friday and Saturday, which are very good days for business. The rest of the week, she takes care of running the factory and managing the staff, since her education in administration helps her in that area. She hopes eventually to improve her marketing, and is submitting paperwork to negotiate with governmental bodies that have requested large quantities of merchandise for the poorest schools in the country. She would like to be part of that project. Gladys is one of MFP's oldest clients, and this is her seventh loan. She tells us that her time working with our institution has helped her improve her factory and her interpersonal relations. The 1500 soles from her loan will be used to manufacture more shoes, in order to take advantage of the school year and increase profits so they can make the family business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ramp up shoe manufacturing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is engaged in food vending and tricycle service. She started this business by selling barbecue every afternoon in her back yard. She displays her menu in front of the house. She also accepts orders of rice cakes for additional income. 

Evelyn is 48 years old, married and a mother of four children. One child who is studying at college level is starting to have higher expenses at school. Evelyn dreams that this business will turn into a restaurant located in the municipal plaza. She also hopes that they will have their own house in the future and that her daughter will be able to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and pay for tricycle registration

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema S., 33, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the fishing and fishmonger business. She sells to the villagers and public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala (27USD).  SPBD loans are Tumema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy timber and cement for home improvement and the rest will used for other purposes.

loans.use: To buy timber and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Yvon Mireyna

texts.es:
La señora Yvon Mireyna U. M. tiene 25 años, vive en Saucipe, distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Computación e Informática, carrera que abandono al salir embarazada y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Yvon se dedica a la venta de ropa, al inicio se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa interior durante casi 4 años hasta que decidió empezar la venta de polos, jeans, camisa, así como zapatos, este negocio le da muchas ganancias y le ha permitido comprar sus electrodomésticos para su hogar, también se dedica a la siembra de panca en sociedad con su esposo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para aumentar  su capital.  
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de ropa  e insumos para la siembra de panca.
Yvon tiene el sueño de construir su casa y tener una tienda de ropa.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs Yvon Mireyna U. M. is 25 and lives in Saucipe in the District Paijan, Ascope Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied Computer Science , a career she abandoned when she got pregnant and had to devote herself to her home. She has two small children who depend entirely on her. Yvon sells clothes. Initially she focused on selling beauty products and under garments for almost 4 years until she decided to start selling polos, jeans, shirts and shoes. This business gives her good profits and has allowed her to buy appliances for her home. She also works with her husband to grow maize. Her business developed at home. With the first loan of 300 soles she received from her community bank "Manos Unidas", she purchased beauty products to increase her stock. With the loan of 1700 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase clothing and supplies for planting maize. Yvon dreams of building her house and having a clothing store. She belongs to "a glass of milk" in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and supplies for planting maize

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. Some are in senior high and others in junior high schools. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. She lives with her husband and the children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Ama is a businesswoman. She sells both washing and toilet soap in the local market. Ama says she also hawks in her community and treks to other markets to sell her products. Ama procures the soap from wholesalers in the nearby communities at reasonable prices. She has been in business for eight years and desires to expand her business. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure cartons of soap

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Очилова Саломат проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 39 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. По специальности  бухгалтер. Проработала бухгалтером 4 года. Теперь занимается бизнесом. Торгует одеждой на рынке Вахдата. планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Получив кредит она сможет завезти сезонный товар и обеспечить рынок необходимыми вещами.
texts.en:
Salomat O. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. She has a degree in accounting and 4 years of job experience as an accountant. Currently she sells clothes at the Vakhdat market. Salomat would like to take out this loan to expand her inventory. This loan will allow her to bring in seasonal goods and provide the local markets with necessary clothes.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en Jr. Bolognesi Nº 300, Distrito de Nuevo Cajamarca, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años, 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Gloria, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the "Las Violetas II" Community Bank and lives at 300 Bolognesi Street, Nuevo Cajamarca District, San Martin Province and Department. She is married, 43 years old, and has 2 children, both independent with families of their own. Because of her character and her desire to fulfill her dreams she started a business selling groceries. With the earnings from the business, she has helped support her household. From the beginning her business has continually added customers. She now has steady customers who come to her store every day because she offers all of the products that a housewife needs and because she attends to the needs of her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 3000 PEN she wants to invest in buying sacks of rice and sugar, packets of cookies, pasta and salt, milk, canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene articles in order to be able to continue providing good service to her customers. Gloria feels strong and able to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have development opportunities in their communities.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, cookies, milk, etc.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Roberta es viuda, tiene 63 años y 7 hijos, Roberta tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Roberta se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo, productos que comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Roberta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas y para el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Roberta son que su ultimo hijos culmine sus estudios y comprar un tractor agrícola.
texts.en:
Roberta is a member of the community bank “Los Claveles”. She is 63 years old, a widow and has 7 children. Roberta has a shop in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits.

Roberta is dedicated to agriculture as well and has crops of corn and wheat, products that she sells at the city market. She is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested buying soft drinks and paying workers. Roberta's dreams are that her youngest child will finish his education and that she will be able to buy a tractor.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital ( To buy soft drinks and pay workers )

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Jazmina es una mujer que trabaja para sobresalir adelante con su negocio se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, y manualidades, tiene ocho años  de estar en las ventas, tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de nueve años que estudia, este negocio lo inicio con prestamos que Afodenic atorgo este es su sexto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, zapatos y materia prima para hacer las manualidades. Su meta es poder tener clientes nuevos, mejores ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Jazmina is a woman who works to succeed with her business selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and handicrafts. She has been in sales for 8 years. She is 31 years old, lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She has a 9 year old son in school. She began this business with loans from Afodenic. This is her 6th loan which will be invested in clothing, shoes, and materials to make handicrafts. Her goals are to gain new customers and higher sales. She is grateful to her institution for the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, shoes, and materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is a member of Tunda borrower group.She is a 35-year-old woman,she is married and is a mother of three children. Her children are aged 15, 13 and 8 years.

 Tausi started her own business selling crops 3 years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earn a monthly profit of approximately 450,000 Tsh.
    
This is Tausi`s second loan from BRAC Taznania. She requested 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops for sale. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Tausi hopes to pay school fees, expand her business, and save money.

loans.use: To buy crops for sale

loans.name: Elena Gerenarda

texts.es:
la sra. ELENA GERENARDA M. A. tiene 10 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de productos naturales, vende una gran variedad de productos como ser: Cremas, 
desodorantes, jabones, pastas dentales, vitaminas, etc…
Elena vende el producto de manera ambulante en diferentes colonias de la ciudad de Danlí.- 
Es casada y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales todos dependen del matrimonio.
su esposo es ingeniero agronomo y presta sus servicios como facilitador, juntos cubren los gastos de educación, alimentación, salud y vestuario para sus hijos.
con los ingresos que tiene doña elena de su negocio, cubre sus compromisos fianancieros y sus gastos
personales.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena Gerenarda M. A. has 10 years of business experience. She sells a variety of natural products including crèmes, deodorants, soaps, toothpastes, vitamins, etc. She sells her products door-to-door in different neighborhoods within the city of Danlí.

She is married and the mother of 4 dependent children. Her husband is an agricultural engineer and offers his services as a consultant. Together they cover the cost of feeding, educating, clothing, and providing health care for their children. With the earnings from her business, Doña Elena is able to meet her financial commitments and personal expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Bibi Khdiga Group

texts.en:
Bibi Khdiga is the group leader of the Bibi Khdiga Group. There are four members in this group. They want a loan to expand their businesses, so they have requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. 

Bibi Khdiga wants a loan for her husband who has a cigarette cart. Shime wants loan for his tailoring business. D. M. wants a loan for his general store. Basmallah wants a loan for her cosmetics shop. 

They are very happy about the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en: B. Musa is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man of 15 years and has nine children of his own and he takes care of three orphans. He is a businessman involved in the buying and selling of produce from Jinja Central market for nine years and he is able to make 400,000 UGX profit per month. His previous business was selling ground nuts in a glass and this changed because the current business is more profitable. Among his produce, he deals in the buying and selling of millet, ground nuts, beans and soya beans and he hopes to include others. He is good at managing his books and he has a dream of building his own full-fledged house and getting a better education for his children. He needs a loan to partly buy more produce for his business and also buy more building materials to build his house. Musa is indeed a very hardworking man.

loans.use: Buying more stock of produce for increased sales

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo B. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin. He is 34 years old. Wilfredo is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector  raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Wilfredo has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Wilfredo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 47 years old and works as a manicurist in her village. She is married to Amado, a farmer; they were gifted with five children, two of whom are presently studying. Some of their children are working abroad as domestic helpers, which also helps them financially. 

Isabelita wanted to have a stable source of income to help her husband in supporting the needs of their family; consequently, she came up with her own business where she offers manicure and pedicure services. Additionally, she is also planting vegetables in their farm as an additional source of income.  She wants to borrow PHP 10,000; she will use the money to pursue her plans in both her manicure and her vegetable business.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of her businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe E. is from the village of San Andres, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Mariefe is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Mariefe owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mariefe has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mariefe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariefe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Mariefe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mariefe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: James Nderitu

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and married to Hellen. They are blessed with two daughters. He has been operating a retail shop for the past five years. He learned about the Kiva partner, KADET, through marketing outreach in his home town of Sagana. James has never borrowed from another MFI (micro-finance institution). James' business is located in a scarcely populated area of middle class people, and as a result the competition is low, which is a big advantage to his business as long as the shop is well stocked.

He is planning to expand his business with the loan he has applied for. He intends to open a cafe, which is under construction, with the extra profit he is expecting from his shop. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children and to improve their standard of living. He describes himself as a hardworking man, creative and faithful.

loans.use: To expand his retail business in Sagana.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with 5 children and she is 44 years old. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells gently used clothes in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. The demands for her fairly used clothes are high by those in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more nice used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gently used clothes to sell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 24 años, es una joven muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre Julia de 54 años y su hermano Edgar de 28 años, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Ella tiene un stand de ropa y zapatos muy bonito en una de las galerías más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde con muchas ganas y alegría ofrece a sus clientas los hermosos vestidos que vende. Todos los fines de semana viaja rumbo a la ciudad de Tacna (sur del país) para comprar los modelos más novedosos y llamativos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre el vestido que mejor le quedará, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su stand sin poder salir. 
Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Claudia con MFP y está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más vestidos nuevos para implementar mejor su stand.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 24-year-old woman who is sincere and very hard-working. She lives in her own home with her 54-year-old mother named Julia and her 28-year-old brother named Edgar. What she most wants is to excel in life.

She owns a nice clothing and shoe stand in one of the most important shopping malls in Juliaca, where she eagerly and cheerfully sells lovely outfits to her customers. Every weekend, she travels to Tacna (in the southern part of the country) to purchase the most innovative and eye-catching designs.

What she likes most about her job is being able to advise her customers on which dress looks best on them. She has been in business for 4 years and considers the most difficult aspect of her job to be having to stay in her stand all day long without being able to go out.

Over time, she hopes that her business will grow and that it will yield bigger profits.

This is Claudia’s first loan with MFP, and she is determined make her payments on time because she would like to request more loans in the future. She is a very active member who gets along well with other members of her communal bank. With this 500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more clothing to restock her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin S. is 56 years old, and she lives in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a widow with three children; one is a laborer at a garment factory, while the others are studying at a local public school. 

Mrs. Chin S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to support her family by cultivating rice, and she also is a Khmer cake maker.  While her family tries to work hard, they do not earn enough income.  She wants to start a new duck breeding business, but does not have enough money. 

Thus, Mrs. Chin S. decided to request a loan to buy 1000 ducks, and will use the rest of the loan to buy one ton of rice to make duck food.

loans.use: To buy 1000 ducks and one ton of rice to make duck food

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia is a good LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Anthonia is 40 years old and married with seven children. Her children are excelling in their jobs and education. She sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to improve her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena S. and her husband own a five hectares rice field.  Sometimes she hires laborers to help them prepare the land for planting.  

She has been married to her husband Larry for twenty years. She has an eight-year-old child whom she loves taking care of.

Ma. Elena is asking for a loan from CEVI.  She said that if granted, it would really be helpful her buy the necessary farm inputs she needs such as seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 27-year-old married man with three children. He has been running a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as soaps, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and maize flour. He also rents out residential houses to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to support his family, and his business has really grown. He has previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya and successfully paid. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to stock maize flour and cooking fat. He hopes to renovate his rental houses into modern houses in the future. He is determined to expand his shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Decididas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Decididas  lo integran tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es  Yolanda del Carmen Solórzano quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Según comento Solórzano todo inicio  con la venta de carne y luego fue variando en cuanto a los productos que realiza y comercializa.  Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Claudia Leticia Gómez de 32 años quien destaza cerdo y vende nacatamales, un plato típico nicaragüense y Elizabeth del Carmen Ortiz comercializa cosméticos. Ellas invertirán el crédito en materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Decididas” (Determined Ones) group is composed of three, hard-working women; one of whom is Yolanda del Carmen Solórzano, who is the group coordinator. According to her, everything started with meat sales; she gradually varied the products that she sells. She will use this loan to buy meat. The other group members are Claudia Leticia Gómez, 32, who butchers pork and sells nacatamales (traditional Nicaraguan tamale) and Elizabeth del Carmen Ortiz, who sells cosmetics. They will invest their funds in raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena N. is from the village of Olango. She is 51 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nena plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately $790 during harvest season.

In 2008, Nena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Nena is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Leela Group

texts.en:
Betty T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Leela Group. She is 40 years old and is married with five children who range from 14 to 20 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Betty could not continue her education through 6th grade due to lack of support.
