For 25 years Betty has been selling foodstuffs such as pepper, garden eggs (eggplant) and okra at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started her business with 50,00 Liberian dollars as working capital. She sometimes faces problems with so many competitors around her business site.

Betty’s goal and dream is to grow her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 70,000 Liberian dollar loan to purchase more garden eggs, pepper and okra for sale.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Betty is holding the sign. Darlington T. is inset at the lower right because he was not in attendance at the meeting when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To purchase more garden eggs, peppers and okra for sale

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Донияров Рустам проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 24 года. Холост. Образование среднее. У него дилерский центр, где он предоставляет услугу, т.е. пополняет счет, продает карточки. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Rustam D. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 24 years old, single. He has a secondary education. Rustam has a dealer center, where he provides services, such as adding funds to accounts and selling cards. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie B. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells her raised pigs. In 2006, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. She is 36 years old and married with four children between the ages of 12 and 19. Three of the children are currently attending school.

She has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and during that time has employed people on a temporary basis depending on the work load. Her main products are milk and eggs which she sells locally. She also relies on the income from her husband who is employed and farming on rented land to provide for the family's basic needs. Her biggest challenge has been the unfavorable market prices for her eggs.

Sarah has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after successfully completing a previous loan of 30,000 KES. She has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to expand her poultry project. The proceeds from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, she hopes to have increased the number of her poultry and to be earning sufficient income.

She hopes that the loan amounts will be increased in the future.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has been working as a carpenter since 2005 and has many woodworking skills. He is proud of his competitive prices, honesty, experience, strong reputation and high quality products.

Omar notes that his financial situation was a challenge for him when he first started his business. He is requesting a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua which he plans to use to purchase wood and tools for his work.

In the future, Omar plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and tools for his work

loans.name: Rock Of Ages-Jinja Group

texts.en:
John T.'s calling card for the last four years has been that he always tries to make a favorable and lasting impression on his customers. This is why his shop in Busana-Lugazi has been having a roaring business. The good rapport he has struck with his clientele is responsible for the good 350,000 shillings his business generates in a month. 

John began this business with savings from his previous fishing business. He, like many other retail business people, also operates a commercial motorcycle business commonly known as "boda boda". With this loan, he wants to buy in bulk and restock his retail shop with highly desirable domestic items such as soap, plastics, sugar and salt.

loans.use: To purchase bulk items such as sugar and salt.

loans.name: Olga Zulema

texts.es:
la sra. Olga Zulema M. vive Nacaome Valle, se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos para dama y caballeros, tiene mas de tres años de experiencia en este tipo negocio, sus ventas son de lunes a sabado en el interior del mercado y los domingos ventas ambulantes estas las realiza en barrios y colonias de Nacaome y Goascoran.
 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos.
Olga es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
su mayor deseo es que sus gemelos crescan sanos.
texts.en:
Olga Zulema M. lives in the Nacaome Valley. She buys and sells ladies' and gentlemen's shoes. She has more than three years in the field. She carries out her sales from Monday to Saturday in the market and on Sundays she sells door to door in the various districts and colonies of the Nacaome and Gaoscoran regions. The loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Olga is a very hard working person with a great appetite for success. Her greatest wish is to see her twin boys grow up healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Chan Sithy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Sithy P., 23 years old, is married and has a child who is just two years old and not yet I. school. Her husband, Mr. Sopheak Sao, is a soldier while Chan Sithy sells groceries I. Sdau Kanlaeng village I. Kandal province. With both working, they are able to earn a small income to support the family.

Chan Sithy was selected to be the village bank president by its twenty-eight members. She will use her loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her grocery business and so increase the family’s income. The other members of this village bank will use their loans to support their different ventures.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her grocery business

loans.name: Elmer Jules

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Elmer; tiene 39 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja como empleado desde hace 15 años en la agencia de turismo Real, el socio está necesitando un capital para poner un nuevo negocio que por tratarse de una cábala el prefiere mantenerlo en secreto hasta que lo haga realidad.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Elmer is 39 years old, married and has two children. He has worked for the last 15 years as an employee of the Real tourism agency. He needs capital to launch a new business that, due to a superstition, he prefers to keep a secret until it becomes a reality. He is thankful for the loan through this medium and similarly commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a new project

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 40-year-old member of the Embakasi Upendo group in Faulu Kenya.  She is married and has three children aged 10, 5 and 2.  All her children are in school.  

For a living, she sells second-hand clothes. She has been running the business for two years.  Previously she was operating a grocery shop to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been encouraged to save her money.  

Violet has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock of clothes.  She hopes to open a boutique in the future.  In five years, she wants to diversify into other products.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Pinina Armandina

texts.es: Pinina se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en general desde hace más de diez años, su pequeña tienda se llama “TANIA” , Se inicio apañando cochinilla y cosechando tuna para una tercera persona que exportaba estas semillas y ganando su confianza la dueña de dicha plantación le prestó cuatrocientos nuevos soles con lo que apertura su pequeño negocio, atraves del tiempo ha logrado sostener su hogar con la ayuda de su esposo que es  albañil, ha logrado dar estudios a sus hijos y comprar algunos artefactos eléctricos para su uso, el capital recibido lo invertirá en la compra de tarjetas de recarga para teléfonos celulares que tienen cierta demanda en la zona  donde tiene su pequeña bodega, Pinina está contenta por conseguir capital para su inversión que le brindara ganancias en corto plazo.
texts.en:
Pinene has sold groceries for more than ten years in her small shop called "TANIA."  She started out harvesting cochineal and prickly pear for a third person who exported the seeds and then earned the plantation owner's confidence, who lent her 400 soles to open her small business. 

Through the years she has managed to sustain her home with her husband's help, who is a mason.  She has also managed to provide her children an eduction and to buy some appliances.  She will invest the capital received in the purchase of rechargeable cards for mobile phones that are in demand in the area where she has her small store, Pinina is happy to raise capital for an investment that will provide short-term gains.

loans.use: To buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia R. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old. Cecilia is married. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cecilia also works hard to have savings for the family.

Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 30 years old. Evelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. 

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel G. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 34 years old. Joel is single. To make a living, Joel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: vegetable farming and food vending. She lives in Brgy. Cagubaan, Alegria, Cebu. 

Josefina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with both the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard on her vegetable farm and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.  

Josefina wants to borrow PHP 13,000 so that she can purchase new equipment. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Josefina hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of farm equipment

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 28 años, es un padre soltero y trabajador; que vive junto a su hijo, Roy, de 4 años de edad, al que cría y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. El trabajo al que se dedica esté valiente hombre es la agricultura, hace tan solo 5 años que comenzó a comercializar sus sembríos de tubérculos en la variedad de, papa, olluco y oca. Lo que más le gusta a Luis es pasar la mayor parte del día en sus sembríos, pues según afirma, “ya está acostumbrado a esa rutina”. Mientras que cuida de sus cultivos, Luis, aprovecha el tiempo para criar las cabezas de ganado ovino que tienen hace algunos años; los cuales junto a su cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero él, aún tiene muchas visiones, una de ellas es comprar un carro, para poder dedicarse al trasporte público, asimismo abrir una tienda de comestibles, ya que en su localidad no hay una. Este es el  tercer crédito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal, se encuentra agradecido por el apoyo que le brindaron al aceptar su integración. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus sembríos de las diferentes variedades de tubérculos.
texts.en: Luis, age 28, is a single father and a hard-worker. He lives with his four year old son, Roy. He cares for and raises his son in his own house, which is in Ricrican. This brave man is a farmer. He started selling his tuber crops; potatoes, olluco, and oca only five years ago. What Luis likes the best is spending the greatest part of the day with his crops. He says, “I am now accustomed to this routine”. Luis takes advantage of the time that he takes care of his crops to take care of the cattle that he has had for some years. He sells the cattle and his harvest in the central market of the city of Tarma. He also has a lot of visions. One of them is to buy a car in order to be able to work in public transportation. At the same time he wants to open a food store because there is not one in his area. This is his third loan with MFP. As a new member of his communal bank he is grateful for the support they offer him by accepting him as a member. He will use the loan to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer. He will spread the fertilizer on the different varieties of tubers that he grows.

loans.use: To buy organic sacks of fertlizer

loans.name: Njenvede Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: K. Sirag is 45 years old and a happily married father of six children.  Over the last decade, he has achieved many of his goals through hard work in his retail trade business in Jinja.   He began his retail trade business with capital earned from his earlier farming business.  He also has a side grocery business.  His retail business generates 80,000 weekly.  Because of his strong work ethic, he has many old and new customers every day, resulting in the growth of his niche and profit base.  He wants to be able to handle the operational cost of the business and meet customer demands, which sometimes inundate him.  There are days and seasons when he cannot meet the high customer demand because of too few commodities.  In the event that this happen in the future, he does not want to be caught off-guard.  The acquisition of this loan will help a great deal by enabling him to restock.  With this loan, K. will purchase more retail goods such as bags of sugar, salt, rice, cooking oil, and other items for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail goods such as sugar, salt, for resell

loans.name: Munhdalai

texts.en:
Munhdalai is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a "ger". His oldest son attends a local secondary school while his youngest two daughters stay at home with his wife. Munhdalai owns his own car and is a taxi driver in town. 

He started his first business in 2009 with the help of his wife by operating a cafe in a rented space. In 2010, they closed their cafe because his wife gave birth, so he started a taxi business to support his family. Munhdalai is a hardworking, modest and active man who said, "All I wish [is] to raise my children to be good people with high education so that they can live a decent life on their own in the future." He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to make necessary repairs to his taxi and replace parts as well as to buy furniture for his home.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his taxi and replace certain parts

loans.name: Tataimitha Group

texts.en:
Fatmata T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makally village thirty-two years ago. She is married and has five children, three of whom attend primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells rice, palm oil and ready-to-wear clothes. 

This is the first the loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business by buying rice and palm oil in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil in large quantities

loans.name: Juana Agripina

texts.es:
La Señora. Juana L. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad. También una parte de la población ha migrado a otros países en busca de trabajo para darles a sus familias un mejor futuro.
 
Doña Juana tiene 46 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda y tercera hija estudian en la universidad y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la comunidad. Vive en la casa que es de una de sus hijas.
 
La Señora. Juana es comerciante de animales, actividad que viene desempeñando hace 23 años, en su casa se dedica a la atención de sus hijos y también a cuidar sus vacas, cerdos, cuyes y pollos.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cerdos y pollos para continuar con su negocio. Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada  por su cuñada quien es socia activa del mismo. Su sueño es que sus hijos se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Barrio Sucre”. She lives in the parish of Cumbe, an area that experiences cold weather. The people engage in livestock breeding and agriculture, and many of them work in the city. In addition, a subsection of the population has migrated to other countries in search of work so that they can provide their families a better future.

Doña Juana has been selling animals for 23 years. She stays at home in order to take care of her children, but she also raises cows, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

The money from her loan will be invested in more pigs and chickens so that she can continue her business. This is the fourth loan she has received from the Communal Bank. Juana was invited by her sister-in-law, who is an active member of this group. Her dream is to see her children succeed in life.

loans.use: Purchase pigs & chickens

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, tiene 67 años de edad, administra una tienda, vive con su esposo y una hija de 17 años de edad; El negocio de doña María Elena es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, lo inicio hace 5 años por iniciativa propia, está ubicado en un local del mercado municipal, lo atiende de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
 Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, detergentes, leche y gaseosa, esta inversión es muy necesaria para el negocio, ya que sus inventarios se abastecerán de los productos más demandados por los clientes,  logrando así satisfacer sus necesidades.
Para el corto plazo doña María Elena espera tener un  negocio más fuerte, que el préstamo le permita realizar una mejora y que con esto pueda también recibir mejores ingresos y que el sistema de vida sea diferente.
texts.en:
María Elena lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department.  She is 67 years old and lives with her husband and 17 year-old daughter.  María Elena runs a store where she sells essentials.  She set up her store 5 years ago on her own initiative.  It is located in the town market and she serves there from 7.00am to 4.00pm.

María Elena is requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar, detergents, milk and soda.  This investment is essential for her business since she will stock up with the products that are in most demand among her customers and thereby be able to meet their needs.

In the short term, María Elena hopes to have a stronger business.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to make an improvement and that this will enable her to make better profits and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, detergents, milk and soda.

loans.name: Shohrat

texts.en:
Shohrat H. is 33 years old. He is married and his wife actively helps him to raise, breed and fatten sheep. Shohrat has three years of experience in sheep breeding and knows very well how to choose, breed and look after the animals.  As a rule, he purchases sheep in the  livestock bazaar, feeds them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Shohrat gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his family. Shohrat is now planning to expand his herd and purchase sheep. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase 15 lambs.

loans.use: to purchase 15 lambs.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 59 years old and lives with her mother, who is 89, in a ger,  a Mongolian traditional housing tent.  They live in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Oyun's children are grown and live by themselves. 

She manages a clothes-trading business out of a rented stall in a local market. She started her business in 2007 with working capital of 200,000 MNT. Her business was quite successful, which enabled her to expand her business with 800,000 MNT.  This has allowed her to contribute to the family's living. 

Oyun is a very honest woman with good communication skills. She wants to continue her business and says "I would like to have my own working place in the future." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
This is Lucita D., 68. Lucita is a high school graduate. She is a widow with two children who are helping her in the business. She lives with her sons and grandchildren in LD subdivision, Tala, Caloocan City, Philippines.

Lucita manages a glass/aluminium workshop located along the national highway, where her son is the chief worker, along with two other assistants. Lucita deals with customers while her son and her two other employees do the hard work. Their shop fabricates and installs aluminium and glass doors, windows and building panels. They earn an estimated net income of around 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.

To help her continue operating her business, Lucita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more materials needed as requested by the customers. She expects a boost in her income through this loan.

Lucita dreams that her business will be successful and wants to open another branch to generate employment in her local community. She prays for good health and a peaceful, happy life for her family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of god she receives.

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the word of god, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials for her doors and windows business.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benso, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de savon, de condiments et de couscous.                                                                                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Benso sont à leur premier prêt. 
La cliente MARATOU D. compte acheter des savons avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7500 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benso group are married women and widows. They average 36 years of age and five children each, and they all live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell soap, condiments, and couscous.

This is the Benso group’s first loan. Maratou D. plans to buy soap from resellers in Fana. She conducts her sales for cash or credit to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 7,500 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments, to pay contributions to social ceremonies, and to reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es un cliente antiguo de la institución  y  ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,  El Sr. Alberto cuenta con su propio taller de costura en el domicilio en el que vive, la  conyugue es quien le ayuda junto con su dos hijos a la confección de Chamarras a pedido o para la venta, la pequeña empresa empieza sus labores a las 8:00 am y la termina a  las 22:00 pm, las ventas las realizan en la cuidad de Oruro-Bolivia por tener un mercado concurrido y que la competencia no es tan reñida,  con el dinero del crédito comprara telas y forros para la confección de Chamarras, el mayor sueño de la familia es llegar a tener un  patrimonio estable y que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerzan en lograrlo día a día, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Alberto is an old client of this institution, and has a good record for repayments and a kind demeanor. Mr. Alberto has his own dressmaking workshop in his home. He works with the help of his wife and two children, and they make jackets to order or for sale. They begin working in their small workshop at 8:00 am, and finish their work at 10:00 pm. They sell their goods in the city of Oruro-Bolivia because it has a busy market and there is little competition. With the money from the loan, he will buy fabric and lining to make jackets. The family’s biggest dream is to have stable assets, and to have their children have professional careers. Because of this, they work hard every day. Mr. Alberto is thankful that the institution offers them support.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and lining to make jackets

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios (incompleto).
Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro ciclos, su primer préstamo  solicitado fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores y artículos artesanales (bordados).
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles dinero se va a comprar 10 unidades de pollos, cobayas, y telas de lana para la artesanía.  Dice que la artesanía solo las elabora cuando tiene pedidos.
En sus ratos libres le ayuda a su esposo en la confección de prendas de vestir en la localidad de Ilave.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la  facilidad del préstamo y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the “Las Trenzas de Oro” [Golden Braids] communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She started secondary school (but did not finish).

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four loan cycles. The first loan she requested was for PEN 500.00, which she used to invest in her business of buying and selling small animals and craft products (embroidered items). 

With this new loan in the amount of PEN 800.00 she [will buy 10 units of chickens, guinea pigs, and wool threads for her embroideries]. She says that she only makes her crafts when she has work commissioned.

In her free time she helps her husband make clothing items in the town of Ilave. Her dream is to improve her business and for her children to be professionals.

What she likes about the communal bank are the terms of the loans and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy 10 units of chickens, guinea pigs, and wool threads for her embroideries.

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Annie Rose has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from farming and hog raising.

Annie Rose aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30 year-old  single man, living and working in Tyre. Hasan has rented a barber shop for eleven years and is working hard to expand it. That’s why he has requested his first loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner.  In order to help attract new customers, Hassan wants to make some decorative changes to his shop, in addition to replacing his shop's seats. His customers include friends, neighbors and other community members who have come to know him through his work over the past decade.
 
Hasan says that he is very proud of the quality of his work, and he believes that his extensive experience is what distinguishes him from others in his field.
Hasan hopes to stay active and capable of covering all his necessary expenses.

loans.use: To do some decorative upgrades to his barber shop

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 52  años, vive  en compañía de su esposo e hijos en su casa que es propia. Toda su vida  ha trabajado en las tareas del campo, sus padres la enseñaron  a realizar estas tareas que a lo largo de los años se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos. Por otro lado, ella y su esposo trabajan en la apicultura, poseen una granja de abejas, donde extraen cada cierto tiempo miel para venderla, y esto sucede durante la temporada de primavera, que es cuando recaudan hasta 40 litro de miel  y en invierno  es escasa la producción hasta 15 litros. Asimismo cultiva cebada, trigo, maíz y papa de donde también las vende al por mayor al mercado de abastos de su zona. Disfruta de cada  actividad que realiza, porque es la forma de generarse ingresos, que considera que son las más estables, permitiéndole durante muchos años el sostén de su familia y por tanto, su deseo es mejorar su granja de abejas y aumentar su producción agrícola. Por medio de sus vecinos supo de MFP que la invitaron a formar un banco comunal que tiene solidez en la actualidad, son varias veces que ha trabajado en estos préstamos y siempre ha cumplido con sus cuotas. Para esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita, comprará sacos de abono orgánico y semillas de maíz.
texts.en: Catalina is 52.  She lives with her husband and children in their own house.  She has worked in the fields all her life; her parents taught her to do this work, which, over time, she has made into her principal source of income.  In addition, she and her husband keep bees.  They have a bee farm, where at certain times of year they extract honey to sell.   This occurs in the spring, when they collect nearly 40 liters of honey, and in the winter, when the production is a scant 15 liters or so.  They grow barley, wheat, corn, and potatoes, most of which they sell at the local market.  She enjoys what she does, since it is her way of generating a stable source of income, which for many years has helped her to sustain her family.  Naturally, she wants to improve her beehives and increase her agricultural production.  She learned about Kiva partner MFP through her neighbors, who invited her to form a community bank with them.  This bank is now functioning, and she has received loans from it several times and has always paid regularly.  This time around, she is asking for funding to buy organic fertilizer and corn seeds.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and corn seeds.

loans.name: Maja

texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old Maja is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 20. 

Maja is a farmer who owns and works a property in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and sells her harvest at the market. Maja also buys and resells coconuts. Maja works hard to help provide for her family's needs. 

Maja is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and other farm supplies. Maja is hoping to start another small business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La Señora. Juliana es socia del banco comunal Primero de Mayo, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, laboran en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Doña Juliana tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, una de sus hijas es casada, vive en su casa y comparte los gastos del hogar, sus tres hijas solteras tienen 19, 16 y 7 años de edad, sus dos hijas trabajan y la ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad siendo el fruto de su trabajo.

La Señora. Juliana se dedica a la cría de ganado, borregos, cuyes y gallinas los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Este crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer unos arreglos a su casa.
 
Su meta es tener una mejor casa.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the May 1st Commmunity Bank. She lives near the town of Cumbe, where the climate is cold and the people are kind, polite, and work at maintaining their culture and traditions. They work in commerce, raising animals, and in agriculture. Much of the population has moved in search of better work opportunities.

Juliana is 46 years old and a single mother of four children. One of her daughters is married, lives with her in her home, and shares the expenses of the home. Her three single daughters are 19, 16, and 7 years old. The older two work and the youngest studies at a small school in the city. The house where they live is on their own property and is the fruit of their labor.

Juliana works raising livestock: rams, guinea pig, and chickens, that she sells in her community. This is her first loan with the community bank and she was invited to join by a friend. She will use the loan to buy construction materials to repair her home. Her goal is to have a better house.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of sugar, rice and maize flour in his retail shop.

loans.name: Ceasar

texts.en:
Ceasar is a father whose principle in life is "to try and try until he succeeds." He is now 43 years old and has two school-aged children. They live happily in a village planting rice, vegetables and raising livestock. These are the main sources of their income. They aim to become successful so that they will continue sending their children to school until they earn a degree. 

Due to financial constraints, they want to improve their hog-raising business to generate additional income. Ceasar wants to ask for an additional capital of P20,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He mentioned that hard work and determination are the key to make the business grow. He hopes that someday, he will raise more pigs and earn enough income to support their children's education and satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for hog-raising.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is a 49-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his wife and children. 

Luong and his wife earn income by selling food, fruit juice and beverages from their food stall. They have done this for 11 years. 

Luong plans to take a loan to expand his business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for his stall so that he can better serve his existing customers and attract new ones. Luong hopes that his business will run smoothly and that he will be able to earn more money to cover his family's living expenses.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying bread, pork and furniture for his food stall.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, esta casada y socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace un año.
María venD. agregados para construcción, antes se dedicaba a vender verduras en la chacra y ahora gracias a los préstamos que recibió pudo venir a Ayacucho y tener su casita, Finca le ayudó hace un año para poder cambiar D. negocio, el cual ha ido incrementando en ventas, esta muy feliz por todo lo que pudo obtener como socia del Banco Comunal, ahora con el préstamo que solicita comprará arena al por mayor para vender al por menor, a ella le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a poder cristalizar esta idea D. cambiar D. negocio, también le ayudan a poder ser mejor madre, esposa y negociante.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Solución” Communal Bank.  She is 51 years old, and married with 7 children.  She has also been a member of FINCA Peru for one year.
Maria sells construction aggregate (sand, gravel, crushed stone, etc.).  Previously, she sold vegetables at a farm.  Now, thanks to the loans she has received, she was able to come to Ayacucho and buy her home.  For one year, FINCA helped her change her business, which has been experiencing an increase in sales.  She is very happy with everything she has received from the communal bank.  With the current loan she is requesting, she will purchase sand in bulk for resale.  She loves the training because it has helped her crystallize the idea of changing to a new business.  They have also helped her become a better mother, wife, and business woman.

loans.use: ro buy sand in bulk.

loans.name: Akhmad

texts.en: Akhmad is 36 years old. He is married with two children. When he was young, Akhmad started to learn the business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching it grow as a result of his sacrifices. He has run his business independently for the last ten years. His monthly profit from selling cattle is 100 USD. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to provide a better future for his children. For this reason, Akhmad is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN that will allow him to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder.

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es:
Rosa 51 años, una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio.
Su negocio es una tienda de víveres, la cual está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Inicio este negocio con n capital, gracias a Dios ha ido mejorando económicamente.
Esta actividad la realiza con su hija, su horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 6:00am hasta las 20:00pm.
Está casada, su esposo es un maestro de construcción.
Tiene una hija de 14 años, estudia en escuela pública.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir más en negocio y la compra de víveres como: arroz, aceites, azúcar, huevos, etc.
Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 51, is a hard-working lady who aspires to growing her business.  She has a grocery store set up in the front part of her house, which she started little capital.  Fortunately it has gone well economically.

She works with her daughter Monday through Sunday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.   Her husband is a superintendent of construction and her 14-year-old daughter studies at the public school.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the business by purchasing groceries such as rice, oil, sugar, eggs, etc.

Her dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, oil, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Zenabo

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 02  vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes  depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché du secteur 10 Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les voisins, les agents des différents services de la ville de Ouagadougou.

Elle veut s’acheter  un quart (1/4) de balle de pagnes.

Mme économise pour améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne construire sa propre boutique et aider son mari dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zenabo is married and the mother of 2 children, who are 12 and 9 years old. She has 5 people in her care.

 She has sold traditional wraparound garments, “pagnes”, for the past 9 years. She stocks up at the market in Ouagadougou’s 10th Sector. Her customers are her neighbors, who also provide various services in the city of Ouagadougou. 

She wants to buy a quarter (1/4) bale of pagnes. 

Zenabo is saving up to improve her business, and aspires to build her own store and to help her husband in their children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy a quarter (1/4) bale of pagnes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 62 años D. edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, está casada con Estalin, vive en compañía D. su esposo y su  hija D. 38 años D. edad, con los que comparte sus ideales, tiene una casa D. su propiedad la cual lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza María es la venta D. jugos D. frutas como manzana, papaya, especiales y sándwichs, para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño puesto D. ventas en el mercado informal D. su ciudad, en donD. atienD. a diario a sus clientes D. forma amable y alegre, actividad que lo ha realizado desD. hace 20 años, tiempo que supo ganarse a la clientela. Lo que le gusta D. su actividad es el poder sentirse productiva, la mantiene ocupada y la distrae, además que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual pueda apoyar en los gastos D. la economía familiar, ahora cuenta con una regular clientela que le consumen todos sus jugos, teniendo bastante ganancias. Este será su crédito numero 6 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera D. su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por tanto se compromete una vez más en cumplir con los pagos D.  sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado D. 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en el mejoramiento D. la infraestructura D. su puesto, tanto paredes como piso, comprando  mesas y sillas. Además D. frutas para la preparación D. sus jugos.
texts.en:
María, 62, is a happy and hardworking woman.  She is married to Estalin, and lives with her husband and her 38-year-old daughter; with them she shares her ideals.  She has her own home, which they managed to buy with great effort.

María's job is selling fruit juices such as apple, papaya, and special juices, and sandwiches, for which she has a small stall in the informal market of her city, where she pleasantly and happily waits on her customers daily.  She has done this work for 20 years, during which time she learned how to earn customers.

What she likes about her job is being able to feel productive; it keeps her occupied and distracts her.  It also allows her to have an income with which she can help with the expenses of the family economy.  Now she has regular customers who consume all her juices, giving her plenty of profit.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP institution, and she hopes for your collaboration to continue with her goals.  For this reason she is committed once again to making the repayments.  She also likes being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

With the requested loan of 3000 PEN, she will improve the infrastructure of her stall, both the walls and the floor, buying tables and chairs.  She also will buy fruit for preparing her juices.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to improve the infrastructure of her stall.

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: Mrs. Yot is a local farmer in Cambodia. She grows rice crops for her livelihood, earning a profit of $2.00 per day. She is the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom are students living with her while the oldest one works as a laborer and lives far away from the family in Thailand. Her husband is in the business of selling firewood by using a firewood-trailer. This is Yot’s first loan from Kiva and she will use it to purchase 2 additional cows that can be used to haul the firewood-trailer. This loan will help sustain her husband’s business. With the increase in income, she will save to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase 2 additional cows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene  47 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos independiente.

Hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosinas y galletas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizará para comprar mercaderías como veinte cajas de galletas, doscientos cajas de champan y otros productos para la campaña navideña, la mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Arequipa y la entrega en Puno.

Su deseo es que su empresa crezca, además renovar la presentación de algunos productos y tener más movimientos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ahorro es Progreso” (Saving is Progress) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children. One of them is independent.

Virginia has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her previous loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling candies and cookies.

She is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN that will be used for buying merchandise such as 20 cases of cookies, 200 cases of champagne, and other products for the Christmas season. The merchandise will be purchased in the city of Arequipa and delivered to Puno.

Her wish is to see her business grow. Virginia also wants to increase the inventory of some of her products and have more turnover. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of cookies, 200 cases of champagne, and other products for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Neris

texts.es: Nerys de 65 años de edad  vive en el municipio de Soledad y se dedica a la preparación de alimentos, como picadas y comidas corrientes y especiales. Su negocio surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, pues es madre responsable de hogar; con ello ha logrado la educación de sus hijos, quienes se dedican también a la comercialización de hayacas, pasteles, picadas para  eventos especiales y fiestas familiares, apoyando a su madre. Ella además alterna este negocio, con la venta de mercancías que trae desde Sampués,  una población del departamento de Sucre en Colombia,  para venderla a clientes de Barranquilla y de Soledad en el departamento del Atlántico. Su sueño de crecimiento no se detiene por eso tiene 14 años de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo, donde lleva 9 financiamientos, con los cuales ha logrado crecer como persona, desempeñarse efectivamente en su negocio y con ello aumentar su calidad de vida familiar, especialmente sus condiciones habitacionales y educativas de sus hijos.  En la actualidad está planeando acceder a su credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos de alimentos y muebles sampuesanos, (originarios de Sampués) para hacer su gran venta a finales del año, época en la cual hay mayor rotación de estas mercancías, por la gran demanda que tienen los clientes, quienes pagan buenas cuotas de créditos para obtener nuevos enseres para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nerys, 65, lives in the town of Soledad and prepares meals like picadas [snacks], daily menus and specials.  Her business arose from the need she had to earn income for her family because she’s a mother responsible for her home.  With it she’s managed to educate her children who help their mother also selling hayacas [a type of tamale], cakes and snacks for special events and family get-togethers.

In addition to this business she also sells merchandise that she brings from Sampués, a town in Sucre Department in Colombia, to sell in Barranquilla and in Soledad in Atlántico Department.  Her growth dream does not stop and this is why she’s been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 14 years.  She’s had 9 loans that have helped her grow as a person and to develop in her business and with this she’s increased her family’s quality of life especially with respect to her living spaces and her children’s education.

She is currently planning to access a Kiva loan to buy ingredients for her food preparation and furniture from Sampués for the great end of year sales, a season when merchandise turns over more because of increased customer demand who pay good payments to buy new things for their homes.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients and furniture from Sampués.

loans.name: Remen

texts.en:
Remen is 43 years old and lives in Purok 5 Molicay, Ozamiz City.  He is married with one infant-aged child. 

Remen has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business.  He has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for his business.

Remen has been a member of PMPC for four months.  In the future, Remen hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is a 50 year old, widowed mother of two who lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder son is disabled and the younger one is a student in school. She started her souvenir business in 2001 by renting a counter in the market. Due to the lack of money, her business hasn't expanded much. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It's been hard since my husband passed away. However, I will not give up". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to rent more additional counter in market and to buy supplies.

loans.use: to rent more additional counter

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 35, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. Selling groceries is the main source of income in the family. In order to improve her family economy, Sarom is requesting for a loan of USD 250 to purchase more groceries to sell at home to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, renew her house and support her child to study until he/she gets Bachelor degree

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at home

loans.name: Padmani

texts.en:
Padmani is a 33-year-old lady who lives with her husband and a child, age 8 years old. She started to sell rice in the village to support her husband financially. Every day, the daily laborers are buying rice from her. In this way, she earns 3,500 INR per month. She has two years of experience in this business. This income is not enough for her family’s cash flow. She wants to grow her business and to purchase rice in bulk. 

Padmani has requested a loan of 36,000 INR for purchasing rice in bulk so that she can grow her business and fulfill her customers' demands. She hopes to provide better education and study materials to her son. She can live a happy life with her family members and fulfill her family members' requirements.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria  is a divorced woman she needs a loan to fix her kitchen and her bathroom because she wants to rent the place where she is living in order to have more money Maria is still an artisan but her business is not as good she would like so she wants to do a good investment at her house she hopes you can trust her she is healthy and she is good with money In the picture she is at the bathroom that will be fixed

loans.use: to fix her kitchen and her bathroom because she wants to rent the place where she is living

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I need the loan to expand my second hand clothing business

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis lives on his farm with his wife and four children. He still has three children who are in school. He supports his family with the income from rice farming on his small, but productive farm. With the loan he receives, he hopes that he can buy machinery that will help him prepare the land he works on. His biggest goal is to be able to buy land of his own because he currently rents the land, and the farm he works on. He hopes he can acquire his own property to hand down to his children one day.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase stock (detergents and disinfectant) and packaging materials

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun S. is 31 years old and married with one child. She earns $1 a day selling grocery products. Her husband works as a carpenter and earns around $5 a day. This loan will be use to improve and expand the carpentry business by purchasing more tools.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: There are 7 people in this family.  The husband is dead.  The mother and two daughters are the main workers, and the other 4 children are still pupils. The mother and 2 daughters usually work in the green dragon factory, but their incomes are unstable by their uncertain work. The family does not have any other source of income. Huong's nephew, Pham The Diep, used to live with his grandmother when he was still a child, but now he lives with Huong and her family because the grandmother passed away.  Diep got a project scholarship from Mekong Plus to help pay for school fees.  Huong wants to borrow $50 to raise rabbits to earn more income to support the family. She will pay back the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise rabbits

loans.name: Lucas

texts.pt:
Lucas Bezeque M. was born on January 1st, 1957 in the district of Chemba in the province of Sofala. He is 50 years old, and single father of 7 children. His oldest son is 27 years old and the youngest 5. He was raised by his parents in Sofala and went to school until the 6th grade. In 1979, he completed his military service and started to work small business to provide for his family. His business today employs 3 people. He joined other credit programs such as the Gueguegue –Boane. But these credit programs only offered group loans, and the loans were much smaller. Lucas was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema through his neighbors. He requested his first loan in 2006 which he repaid in full.

With the loan of 50.00mt he plans in increasing his inventory to increase his business volume. His business is the only one in the neighborhood to sell supplies. He manages the business with his 3 sons. With the income he supports his family and the schooling of his sons and grandsons. In the future Lucas wants to buy a store and save. .

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao : Bairro 4 –Gueguegue -Boane Cliente : Lucas Bezeque M. Actividade : Comercio Valor de emprestimo :50.000,00mzm ( 2.000usd) Aplicaçao : compra de produtos para revenda Inicio : 01/10/2007 Fim: 19/03/2009

Lucas Bezeque M., nasceu aos 01 de Janeiro de 1957 no distrito de Chemba ,Provincia de Sofala, tem actualmente 50 anos de idade, solteiro pai de 7 filhos o mais velho tem 27 anos e o mais novo tem 5 anos, viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais em Sofala ,frequentou a escola até 6ª classe . Em 1979 foi a tropa. findo o serviço militar tendo ficado desempregado comecou a dedicar-se aos pequenos negocios de forma a sobreviver. A sua actividade conta hoje com 3 trabalhadores. Teve o 1º contacto de credito com associaçao Gueguegue –Boane de onde è membro Cujos creditos eram grupais, não tendo sido boa experiencia de credito para alem de os valores cedidos serem reduzidos, para tal a responsabilidade ser grupal . Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema ,atravez de conversa com os vizinhos e dai aproximou- se e solicitou o seu 1º emprestimo em 2006 e pagou sem dificuldades .Com o emprestimo de 50.000,00 mt pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Actualmente está explorando um estabelecimento comercial pessoal sendo o único no local que oferece um bom ambiente de negocio .

Ele dirige pessoalmente o negocio juntamente com os seus 3 filhos, Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares escolares e de saude dos seus filhos e netos. Futuramente pretende ter um estabelecimento proprio e poupar algum valor para os momentos criticos do negocio.

loans.use: To buy stock to cover the demand during the christmas

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza is a 45 year old married woman with three kids. She has had a convenience store in the neighborhood of San Francisco for more than 10 years.

Her business is located in a very busy commercial area, which helps her with her sales. Lorenza says that in the last few years there have been a lot of people moving out of the area in search of better work opportunities in Europe, and that her sales have suffered as a result of that.

Lorenza wishes to buy merchandise for her store and that is why she is requesting this loan. Among the products that she plans to buy are canned goods, sugar, flour, rice, meat and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenza es una señora de 45 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos; tiene una despensa muy bien surtida, ubicada en el barrio San Francisco desde hace más de 10 años.

Su negocio se encuentra en una zona comercial de bastante movimiento, lo que ayuda al negocio a tener buenas ventas. Lorenza cuenta que en los últimos años se ha sentido notar la alta emigración de la gente a países europeos en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, ya que las ventas han mermado bastante debido a este suceso.

Lorenza desea surtir su despensa y es por ello que solicita el crédito. Entre los productos a comprar podemos citar: productos enlatados, azúcar, harina, arroz, lácteos, carne, vegetales, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for convenience store such as canned goods, rice, flour, sugar, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann A. is married with 5 children, is 30 years of age and hails from Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fried chicken and turkey. She has been with LAPO as a client for the past 2 years. She has been in her business since the year 2002 and seeks a loan of $450 to buy more chicken and turkey for sale.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and turkey for sale

loans.name: Muguluka West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mwamimi K.. She is currently in the business of selling sugar wax and is requesting a loan to expand business. Mwamimi is 40 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 8 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Mwamimi makes approximately UGX 45000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start another business. Mwamimi has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mwamimi is joined in her small group by Rava N., Edith K., Sarah K., and Jane K.. Rava N. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to boost business. Edith K. is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to add to the business. Sarah K. operates a business as a bar attendant and wants to add to the business. Jane K. is currently in the business of operating a hotel and is requesting a loan to purchase more food and other hotel equipment.

loans.use: To add to sugar business

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Brenda S. is a very creative and hardworking woman. Due to her piñata making abilities, she started her business 5 years ago at her home. At that time she was motivated by the need to financially support her husband and give a better quality of life to her son who was 1 year old. Currently, she is divorced and is able to provide her little one with all he needs thanks to her business.

Lack of funds to model and expand her business have led her to ask for a loan of $675 which she will repay in 6 months. Lets help Brenda and her son to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda S. una mujer creativa y trabajadora dada la habilidad que tiene para realizar piñatas hace 5 años surgió su negocio en un acuarto de su casa, en ese entonces movida por la necesidad de apoyar económicamente a su esposo y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo quien tenia 1 año, actualmente ella esta divorciada y puede darle a su pequeño todo lo que necesita gracias a su oficio.

La falta de liquidez para hacer las remodelaciones y ampliaciones que necesita su negocio es lo que la hace pedir un crédito por US $ 675 que pagara en 6 meses. Ayudemos a Brenda y su hijo a tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: hacer  remodelaciones

loans.name: Rukkiah's Group

texts.en: I am a widow who has nine children: five boys and four girls. Five of my kids are married. Four of them live elsewhere while the others live with me. I am borrowing for third time from Asasah, a microfinance institution, for my son’s embroidery business. He has hired a few workers for the business. Wedding season has just begun and my son has started getting orders for embroidered clothes.  Therefore, he needs a loan to buy cloth, beads and thread in bulk. I would like to borrow in a group.  The other women include: Shahnaz B. (who will invest her share of the loan in her son’s motorbike spare parts business), Basheeran B. (who will buy a sewing machine and dress making material with the loan), and Riffat R. (who is borrowing  for her husband’s electronics store).

loans.use: to buy material to make embroidered dresses

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir S. is a 34-year-old trader who owns his own small shop where he sells car spare parts. He runs his shop in the same region where he lives, Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He works as a director in this shop and as salesman as well. Car shops like this are very popular in Azerbaijan and Bashir needs more funds to verify the numbers of equipment he sells. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 1200.

loans.use: to verify numbers of equipment he sells

loans.name: Hakimali

texts.ru:
Hakimali Y. lives in Shahrinav. He works as a private taxi driver. He has his own car. He lives with his family. He is married and has 5 children. He is 28 years old, and it is not easy to support such a big family. Therefore, he must work very much so that his family does not want for anything. Recently, his car had a serious breakdown, and now major repairs are necessary. Therefore, he has decided to take out a loan to be paid off in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Якубов Хакимали проживает в районе Шахринау. Работает частным таксистом. Имеет свой автомобиль. Живет вместе со своей семьей. Женат и имеет 5 детей. Ему 28 лет и прокормить большую семью не так уж просто. Поэтому ему приходится много работать , чтобы семья ни в чем не нуждалась. Недавно произошла серьезная поломка автомобиля и теперь необходим капитальный ремонт. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит , со сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Automobile repair

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Juliet has three children who are the most important things in her life. Therefore, when she realized that the family wasn't getting by on her husband's salary, she decided to help with household expenses by doing something that came easily to her like making meals such as tamales and also selling cosmetics through a catalog. She began business out of economic necessity since her husband was going through a period where he really was not working. She started approximately 5 years ago, selling house-to-house and now has a good number of customers.

She needs a $200 loan, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and fill an order of cosmetics that is pending.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Julieta tiene tres hijos y son lo mas importante para ella es por eso que cuando vio que ya no completaban con el sueldo de su esposo decidió ayudar a los gastos de la casa con actividades fácil de realizar para ella como fue la elaboracion de comida: tamales y también a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo Inició el negocio por necesidades económicas ya que su esposo estaba pasando por una situación donde realmente no había trabajo. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 5 años saliendo a vender casa por casa y ahora ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y surtir un pedido de cosmeticos que tiene pendiente.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Barubina N.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Barubina N.. She is married and has four children aged between ten and 21 years. In 2002, Barubina established her crops-selling business. She opens her business six days a week, five to eight hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Barubina requires a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, Barubina plans to start another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Thi Mai's Group

texts.vi:
Cô Lê Thị Mai 48 tuổi, mã số thành viên 06030006 cô là người phụ nữ rất chịu khó. Cô làm khá nhiều nghề như chăn vịt đẻ, hiện nhà cô có 200 con. Ngoài ra cô còn làm 360m2 trồng rau muống bán hàng ngày, chồng cô chăn trâu thuê. Vi vậy tổng thu nhập hàng của gia đình khoảng 160.000đ/ ngày. Với số tiền đó cô có điều kiện cho 5 đứa con đi học.
