Cô đã trả hết vốn chu kỳ trước và tiếp tục làm đơn xin vay chu kỳ 2 với số tiền là 3.360.000đ để mua vịt và cám để chăn nuôi. Trong nhóm cô còn có 5 thành viên khác cùng vay vôn

.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt 40 tuổi mã số 06030008 vay 3808.000đ, thời gian vay 12 tháng để mua thêm hoa quả về bán
  • Lưu Thị Lan 24 tuổi mã số 06030009 vay 4.256.000đ,thời gian 12 tháng để mua gà giống( gà thịt)
  • Kiều Thị Hồng mã số 06030010 vay 5.152.000đ, thời gian 12 tháng để mua gà giống (gà đẻ)
  • Nghiêm Thị Thanh mã số 06030005 vay 4.704.000đ, thời gian vay 12 tháng để mua máy làm mỳ
  • Nguyễn Thị Thành mã số 06030033 vay 3186.000đ, thời gian vay 6 tháng để mua cám chăn nuôi gà đẻ, với mức trả 135.000đ / tuần.
texts.en:
Ms. Lê Thị Mai, 48 years old, no 06030006. She is a very hard-working housewife with many activities, like raising egg-laying ducks (currently 200). Besides, she also grows 360 square meters of water spinach to sell every day. Her husband works as a buffalo herder. With all of this, the family's income is about 160.000đ per day, and allows her take care of her 5 school-age children. She has already paid back all the previous loan and has applied for a second loan of̀ 3.360.000đ in order to buy ducks and duck feed. There are 5 other borrowing members in her group

.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt, 40 years old, no 06030008, is borrowing 3.808.000đ over 12 months in order to buy and resell fruit
  • Lưu Thị Lan, 24 years old, no 06030009, is borrowing 4.256.000đ over 12 months in order to buy and raise meat chicken
  • Kiều Thị Hồng, no 06030010, is borrowing 5.152.000đ over 12 months in order to buy and raise egg-laying chicken
  • Nghiêm Thị Thanh, no 06030005, is borrowing 4.704.000đ over 12 months to buy a noodle machine
  • Nguyễn Thị Thành, no 06030033, is borrowing 3.186.000đ over 6 months to buy chicken feed. She intends to pay back 135.000đ per week.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chicken and ducks

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina H. D. F. is a member of community bank, Musuq Rumi. She lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their three children. Her youngest son is currently studying engineering systems at the local university.

Currently, Alejandrina is running a business insiD. an office building where she sells coffee and breakfast to the people who work in the office. She plans to invest her loan of 1000 soles into her business by purchasing chocolates, sodas, juices, sugar, eggs and salt. She dreams of moving from Ayacucho and investing in more stores. She is saving to help her children with their education and for other necessities for her home.

loans.use: To purchase chocolates, sodas, juices, sugar, eggs and salt for her store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, socia del BC Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de  Juanjui. Tiene 56 años de edad y vive con su esposo y dos de sus 6 hijos, los cuales 4 de ellos ya son independientes y 2 están estudiando y aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de menestras sancochadas, verduras picadas para sopas y ensaladas y esencias de diferentes frutas para la preparación de chupetes o refrescos. Tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará menestras de diferentes variedades, leña para la sancochar las menestras, frutas en cantidad par la preparación de esencias y verduras para tener todo lo necesario para la preparación de sus productos que vende y así poder quedar bien con sus clientes. 

Carmen manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere comprar un carro para que su esposo tenga una herramienta de trabajo y así como también ella pueda salir a otros mercados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is a member of the BC Las Trabajadores. She lives in the region of San Martín, Mariscal Cáceras province, Juanjui district. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and two of her 6 children. Four of them are already independent and two are students and still depend on her. She sells menestras sancochadas, diced vegetables for soups and salads, and fruit extracts for making snow cones and sodas. She owns a stand in the central market of the city. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will purchase menestras of different varieties, firewood to cook the menestras, fruit in large quantities to prepare extracts and vegetables. This way she will have all that is necesary to prepare her products she sells and satisfy her clients. Carmen says that Manuela Ramos is a big support to her and her family, much like it is to many other entrepenourial women. She works hard each day because she wants to buy a car so that her husband can have a tool to work with, and so that she can go out to other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy menestras of different varieties, firewood, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mrs. Huon S., a widow, is 49 years old.  She makes a living by growing rice and vegetables including cabbage  and morning glory. She makes an income of around $2 per day, which is used to pay for her family's expenses. She has three children, all of which are employed. Her eldest is a carpenter, the second-eldest is a tailor, and the youngest helps her with her business. They all live in Pursat Province. Huon is requesting a $500 loan to buy a cow to help her plow her land.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera  y  madre de 7 hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 300 compró  productos naturistas. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que apoya a sus hijos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 600 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará  productos naturistas.
Felicitas  desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Community Bank “Dante Nava” in the province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old. She is single and has 7 children and she is her only financial support. She used her first $100 loan to purchase natural products. She has been working with the bank for almost 2 years. She will use this $200 loan, which will be paid off in 4 months to purchase more natural products. Felicitas wants to continue working to support her children so they can finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural products

loans.name: Amador

texts.es: Amador tiene 40 años, es padre soltero, vive con sus 3 hijos que son estudiantes. La casa donde vive es propia. Es propietario de un motocarro que maneja, hace 4 años trabaja para una línea cosmética de perfumes y lencería distribuyendo sus productos a personas e instituciones por diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Amador se siente muy contento de estar en este oficio porque tener este vehículo le ha sido de gran beneficio, y puede trabajar de manera estable para esta empresa donde tiene un ingreso seguro, ya que haciéndolo de manera independiente como taxi, depende de la demanda, el clima y otros factores para ganar una cantidad diaria. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, con la cantidad que está solicitando comprará repuestos para reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Amador is 40 years old and is a single father who lives with his three children, who are in school. He owns the house he lives in. He owns the three-wheeled scooter that he drives, and for 4 years he has worked as a distributor for a cosmetic company that sells perfumes and lingerie. He delivers products to people and establishments around his city. Amador is very content with this job and having his vehicle has been beneficial. He enjoys stable work with this company and a secure income, whereas working as a taxi driver depends on demand, weather, and other factors in order to earn daily wages. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy spare parts to repair his scooter.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his three-wheeled scooter

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou C., 63, has two children and lives in Takeo province with her husband, Long Aun. They work together as farmers, and they make around US$1 each day. They also receive support from their two sons. One is a construction worker, and the other is a musician. Thou C. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike that her sons could use to commute to work. The motorbike will help her sons reduce their daily transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. is currently in the business of selling eggs and bread. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Margret is 37 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Malofou

texts.en: Malofou L., 47, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village people and public, 5 days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about 51 USD).  SPBD loans are Malofou’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Malofou's loan will be used to buy sacks of flour, cooking oil, bottle of syrup and a sack of sugar. Her older daughter helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her pancake business.

loans.name: Enma Erminda

texts.es:
La señora Enma Erminda Rodríguez A. tiene 48 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor del caserío de Lluin del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria y no continuó estudiando por falta de apoyo familiar. Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 3 hijos.
Actualmente es Juez de Paz de su comunidad,  tiene una bodega y también vende comida.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró animales menores para su negocio de comida.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará insumos para la elaboración de alimentos.
Enma sueña con comprarse un ómnibus para transporte de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Enma Erminda Rodríguez A. is 48 years old and belongs to the Buen Pastor (Good Shepherd) Community Bank in the village of Lluin in the Mache district of the Otuzco province in La Libertad, Peru. She studied up until the fifth grade of elementary school and then didn't continue her studies due to lack of family support. She married when she was twenty years old and has three children. Currently, she is the Justice of the Peace in her community. She has a shop and also sells food. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in four installments, she bought young animals for her food business. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will purchase ingredients for cooking meals. Enma dreams of buying an omnibus to serve as transportation for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is a 42 year old mother of four children, who are aged 9 to 21 years. She is married to a machinist and sells food in the Nyamasaria slum to augment his income. She sells cereals like beans and rice and would like to expand to start selling Irish potatoes as well. She says she will use the profits to pay back her loan and purchase more food stock for her business. 

Joyce recently joined the K-MET Volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW volunteer, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Cereals

loans.name: Nazia Muhammad Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji is the group leader of two other women. She is married to M. N., who runs a cloth-selling business. He buys clothes from Lahore, a city famous for its varieties, and sells to his native city Kot Radha Kishan. Nazia baji is a very supporting lady. She stitches embroidered dresses on orders and, with the income earned, she pays off the utilities of her house. In fact, the other two members of her group also engage in the embroidered clothes business for the same purpose. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes for her husband’s cloth-selling business.

There is another Nazia baji in the group who wants a loan to buy peanuts to resell. Noreen baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
Desde hace 5 años en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Mayra se dedica a su negocio de venta de carne atendida por ella misma todos los días siendo este el negocio que ella tiene con el cual sustenta a su familia.

Ha logrado mejorar su situación apoyándose de los créditos que Ceprodel le ha brindado y hoy en día una vez más ha acudido esperando ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito para así continuar saliendo adelante y proyectándose en su negocio de venta de carne.
texts.en:
For five years, Ms. Mayra A. has had her own butcher shop in the city of Chinandega. She runs this business herself everyday because she supports her family with it.

She has managed to improve her living conditions with the support that Ceprodel has given her in the form of loans. Today, she once again turns to this institute, hoping to be granted a new loan so that she can keep moving forward with her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 49 años, vive solo en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de peinados y cortes de cabello desde hace más de 32 años, pues hace 15 años decidió abrir su propio salón de belleza en una zona muy céntrica de su ciudad. Y a la calidad de sus servicios ha aumentado considerablemente su clientela. Carlos trabaja con una persona que contrata para que lo ayude a abastecerse con la atención de todos sus clientes. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos desea convertir su salón de belleza y peluquería en un Spa donde pueda brindar servicios adicionales. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los integrantes de su banco comunal que promueve la unidad y la responsabilidad en su grupo y su deseo es continuar con este mismo trabajo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará un equipo de manicure, un sillón de tratamiento facial y una tina para pedicure.
texts.en:
Carlos, 49, lives alone in a rented house. He has been styling and cutting hair for more than 32 years. Fifteen years ago he decided to open his own beauty salon in a central zone in his city. The number of his customers has increased considerably because of his quality services. Carlos works with another person who he has hired to help him provide services to all of his customers. In the near future, Carlos wants to convert his beauty salon into a Spa where he could offer additional services. This is his third loan with MFP. He is one of the members of his community bank who promotes unity and responsibility, and he wishes to continue with this same work. With the money he is asking for he will buy manicure equipment, a chair for facial treatment, and a tub for pedicures.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment for his beauty salon

loans.name: Acela

texts.en: Acela C. is from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Acela owns and operates a business raising crabs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Acela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell Acela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase crab fingerlings to raise and sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase crab fingerlings to raise and sell

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
    Гулчехра молодая женщина в возрасте 22 лет замужем, не имеет детей. Она домохозяйка, но без дела не сидит. Гулчехра имеет три коров, которые в день дают по 6 литров молока. Также она имеет пятнадцать баранов. В день посещения ее не было дома она была в отъезде в город за покупками. Её муж работает строителем на заказ. На полученный кредит Гулчехра хочет закупить ещё несколько баранов и отремонтировать крышу сарая, где она содержит скот.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Gulchehra is a young woman of 22 years, she is married and does not have children. She is a housewife and is always busy. Gulchehra has three cows which each give six liters of milk a day. She also has fifteen sheep. During the day of the visit she was not at home and was out in town doing shopping. Her husband works as a construction worker. Gulchehra wants to use the requested loan to buy several more sheep and fix the roof in the shed where she keeps the cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Maura es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maura se dedica a la siembra de papa en sus terreno, además compra de los productores, producto que luego de acopiar lo envía a la ciudad de Lima con carros alquilado. Además Maura tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Maura necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Maura son mejorar sus negocios y educar a sus hijos para que triunfen en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank. She's 40-years-old, and has a common law husband and 4 children. She earns her living growing potatoes on her land, buying potatoes from other farmers, and then, once she has enough, sending the produce to Lima in rented vehicles. She also has a grocery stO. in her house. Maura is seeking a loan for 3000 soles to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams include improving her business and educating her children so they can have a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Goreth's Group

texts.en: B. Goreth is 42 years old and the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She has five children and also cares for orphaned children. Goreth has had a beauty salon in Nyenga for fifteen years. She worked as a tailor before that. In her current business, she is mostly affected by the high prices of products that she uses, which leave her with a profit of only about $51 a week. She hopes to expand her business more and to educate all her children to the University level so that they can find good jobs. Goreth needs a loan for working capital. This will help her be sure of having a steady supply of products even when the prices are high.

loans.use: To buy more salon products to generate increased profits.

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en:
Yangi R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and green vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil and onions to sell. Yangi is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a fisherman. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Mil

texts.en: The 75 % of Cambodia people who has been growing a rice crop, because they thinks that the rice is a necessary product vital for their life. One of these people, Mrs. Mil K., age 57, who is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Mil K. is married with eight children: four are married and the remainders are single. Most of them are employed in different jobs. Her husband, Sharoeun, 59, assists her with the farm work. Mil K. is taking out her first loan to buy more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield and the rest of the loan she will buy a bicycle to ride to her farm field.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield and the rest of the loan she will buy a bicycle to ride to her farm field

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is currently in the business of selling bananas, apples, oranges etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize flour to sell.  Esther is 32 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 4 children who attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school expenses for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin P., who is 39 years old, and her husband, Mr. Belasambath Norng, 34, have been married since 1998 and have three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and the other one attends school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophoin has been a silk weaver for 23 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village where she lives, who then takes it to sell in the Phnom Penh market. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for commuting, and she will use part of her loan to buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting and silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan O. lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. She is facing a small problem because her field is infertile, so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding.

She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Phon Mem, is a construction worker. Mrs. Phan O. is the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker. The others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Poeu

texts.en: Poeu Y., 56, is a cake-seller living in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a widow and lives with two daughters, one of whom is married and the other single. To help feed the family better, one of her daughters sells beef soup in front of her home. Poeu Y.’s daughter started selling soup months ago, but she doesn’t have enough equipment to do her best at her trade. That is why Poeu Y. has requested a loan to allow her daughter to buy more equipment. She hopes to use some of the loan to buy two piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more equipment

loans.name: Mpasha Bamwe Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Rose A., 32, is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a determined and very hard working lady with a retail shop business that she has owned for 2 years. Before this shop business, Rose was a housewife involved in farming, until the proceeds helped her open up her retail shop.

She has been able to repay her loan with ease and she is now seeking another. She says that her good customer care and general organization have helped her succeed in business and she is now be able to make 200,000UGX as profits per month. She hopes to expand her shop further. Rose is married with 4 children aged 1-13 years, and 3 of them are in school. She also cares for 1 dependant. She has a dream of seeing all her children attend school and have the best education for self-reliance. She needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods like bean seeds, maize flour, baking flour, sugar, cooking oil, bread and so on to avoid running out of stock.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more goods.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Maria es casada, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, es cosmetóloga, Maria trabaja en un salón de belleza, actividad que realiza todos los días. Maria tiene proyectado implementar su propio salón.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles para su salón.
Los sueños de Maria es tener su salón de belleza y acceder a una línea de crédito mayor.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Alegría Huamanga”. She is 44 years old, married, and has six children. Maria is a cosmetologist who currently works every day at a beauty salon. She has plans to start her own business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy furniture for her own beauty salon.

Her dreams include running her beauty salon and accessing a larger line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Semfronia

texts.en:
Semfronia A. is from the city of Sto.Nino, Pagadian City. She is 50 years old. Semfronia is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Semfronia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Semfronia has managed her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Semfronia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Semfronia from PMPC. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Semfronia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and for working capital.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for a general store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is old man who is 57 years old. He is married and has three children, ages 8, 14, and 18. Charles and his family live in the Kicukiro District, Kigali Province in the village Kanombe near the international airport in Rwanda. This is also the place where his business is location. 

Charles, alone, works to provide for the basic needs of his family by selling various styles of clothes. Charles chose this business because it is profitable and easy. His business is very organized. Charles employs two people as helpers in his business so that his business runs smoothly.

Charles is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing an various additional clothes. His business is known in his region. He needs to expand his product line to satisfy his customers by offering them the good quality clothes in various styles. The profits that Charles expects to obtain will help him to save money for his family and pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Isakbaeva Chynar`s Group

texts.en:
Chynar is the leader of this group. This will be her 2nd loan with the Kiva field partner, Mol Bulak Finance. Chynar is married and she has four children. The oldest is a university student and the other three children study at the local school. Her husband owns a minibus and provides passenger transportation services. Chynar wants to start up a new business, breeding poultry. Although she doesn't have much practice, she is going to learn about this business in the local agricultural training center. Right now she has three horses and three cows in calf. The new business will increase her family's income. 

Humorhon, 42, is married and has four sons. She has a little workshop at home where she sews bedspreads, dowry items and national clothing. Her husband and young son deal in animal breeding. They will use the loan to buy three calves. In the future Humorhon wants to expand her business,  build a bigger sewing workshop and create new jobs. 

Mamadal will use this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. He has dealt in agriculture since 1994, raising vegetables, wheat and corn. Now he is getting prepared for the spring sowing. He owns 0.8 hectare of land, but he wants to rent one hectare more. His son helps him in this business. 

Zuura is 44 years old. Her husband raises vegetables and sells them in the local market. Zuura has four children and all of them are students. She is planning to sow potatoes this year. 

Their previous loan had a positive impact on all these clients.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Flaviana's Group

texts.en:
Flaviana C. is from the village of Gusa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old. Flaviana is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Flaviana is married to a farmer. To make a living, Flaviana owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. Flaviana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Flaviana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flaviana has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Flaviana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Flaviana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. is villager who lives in Kaoh K. Leu village in Kandal province. She is 53 years old and is the leader of her group loan, that consists of nine members, offered by AMK. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Oun S. and her husband, Mr. Sary Lorn, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. Although they try to work hard with their farm, they still earn less income than needed to support the family living. Mrs. Oun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy an engine for a fishing boat to support her husband’s new business.

This couple has six children, five or whom are employed in different business such as seamstress, construction worker and laborer, while the last one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To add her savings to build her house

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 42 years old. She sells a variety of food which includes ham, hotdogs, sausages and, sometimes, dried fish. She currently has dried fish which she sells to her regular customers. She also sells ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes. Having a child who goes to college, she said that she has to work hard to keep up with the increasing school fees. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to gain financial support for her business. She hopes to buy sausages, ham and more dried fish because these are what her customers look for.

loans.use: To buy dried fish, ham and sausages

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad M. is a 48-year-old trader who sells women’s clothes in the central market of Sabirabad city where he lives with his wife and three children.

Elshad started his business twelve years ago and, since that time, he has become very successful in his business. Usually he buys clothes from Baku city which is about three hours away from his city. It takes him a day to purchase all the clothes and then come back.

Elshad has very good taste and knows the demands of his customers. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase seasonal clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes

loans.name: Ol-Tite Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “OL-Tite” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Unisa K. (pictured left). Unisa was born in Makeni 35 years ago. He is married and has two children. His children are attending primary school. For many years now,  Unisa has been selling T-shirts and jeans, right at the center of Makeni city. He will use his share of the loan to increase his stock of T-shirts and jeans.

loans.use: Buy T-shirts and jeans in large quantity

loans.name: Thomas Amara's Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the R.C. Boys Primary School, Lunsar. These are diligent and hardworking teachers who have come to SMT/Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 10,950,000 in order to help them pay school fees for their children, invest in their businesses, buy pieces of furniture, buy a plot of land, etc.

R.C Boys Primary school was founded in 1995 in Lunsar small-town, northern Sierra Leone by the Roman Catholics to help educate the children of Lunsar and its surrounding villages. It is a government-assisted school with 7 teachers and 297 pupils.

With the help of this loan, the leader of this group, Thomas A. K. will use his share (SLL 1,000,000) to pay school fees for his children. Born in Lunsar, Thomas is a 62-year-old man who is married to a nurse and they have six children who are attending schools. Thomas has been in the teaching profession for forty years now.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice D is currently in the business of selling dried fish, tomatoes and onions, and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. Joice is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a police officer. She has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 3 est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans le village de N’Gama dans la commune rurale de N’Gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et  font essentiellement la culture de l’arachide et du riz.
Dans le but de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles,  les membres du groupe ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Madame Founé C.  qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25 kg de semence d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour  son  champ.  Elle se ravitaille semence d’arachide à la foire de Konodimini. 
Elle compte réaliser 40 sacs d’arachide sur sa parcelle de  2 hectares. 
Une partie de la  production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is made up of four women, all of whom are married and live in large traditional families. They are 48 years old with four children on average. They live in the N'Gama village in Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Mali). They met through friends and family, and primarily grow peanuts and rice for a living. In order to profit from these agricultural activities, the group members are seeking a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Madame Founé C., who is the group's president, aims to use the loan to purchase 25kg of peanut seeds and employ workers for the field. She replenishes her peanut seed stocks at the Konodimini market. She aims to generate 40 bags of peanuts on her 2 hectar plot of land. Some of the harvest will be consumed by those involved in its production and the rest will be sold. The profit generated will be used for household needs and the children's educational costs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds and hire workers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia P. is a widow who lives in Prk. Venus, Brgy. Patao, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling dried fish, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes and raising hogs. She has eight children who range from 7 to 30 years old. Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her dried fish business so that she can continue to save up for the future for the education of her children. Virginia P. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team. http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jessie's Group

texts.en:
Jessie V. is from the village of Boundary Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Jessie is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Tundan 2'.

Jessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits like mango, durian, and rambutan in the local community. Jessie is just starting this business and earns 5000 PH a month.

In 2009, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Jessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita S. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Enelita is married and has three children. To make a living, Enelita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Enelita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years. She says she wants to have a happy and harmonious family.

Enelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Enelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Enelita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married. She is a seamstress at Elmina. She has been educated up to the senior high level. Ekua uses her revenue from her sales to help her husband take care of the home. She supports her husband in taking care of the home. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more lining and cloth to sew for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to open up a shop in a different locality.

loans.use: purchase more lining and cloth to sew

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia C. is from the village of Magsaysay Saguday Quirino. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florencia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Florencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Florencia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Florencia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lafisatu

texts.en: Lafisatu S. is a petty trader. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She sells 'kenkey' (fermented corn dough), which she prepares with milled corn which she cooks and wraps in leaves for sale. She will use the loan she takes to add to her capital to buy more corn to prepare her 'kenkey' for sale. She will use her profits to cater for her five children and further their education.

loans.use: add to her capital to buy more corn to prepare  'kenkey'

loans.name: Azibeda

texts.en:
Azibeda is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated her business of selling fresh natural juices for over five years. Her customers are neighbors and passersby. Azibeda faces the major challenge of seasonality. During winter rainy seasons the demand for juice is low compared to hot summer seasons when demand is high. She hopes to purchase a matatu (fourteen passenger van) in the future.

Azibeda decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures to join. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a new freezer for storing natural juice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing natural juice for resale.

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en:
Risa, 24 years old, has been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He says the business has been profitable.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy goats and sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Risa hopes to open a wholesale shop in Naivasha town which will supplement his livestock income.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi S. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Noemi is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Noemi runs a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Noemi has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Noemi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Noemi is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Noemi from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to financially support her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Susan is widowed with two adult-aged children. Susan makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from pork and chicken barbecue and a food cart in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Susan is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for her food business. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for the food cart

loans.name: Nora Lucia

texts.es:
Nora de 32 años, hace varios años atrás trabajo en una empresa de fabricación de enlatados de atún en donde quiso independizarse y tener su propio negocio ya que su esposo la abandono con sus dos hijas.

Viviendo en un cantón llamado Playas (Posorja) uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos con sus dos hijas ha estado trabajando vendiendo productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).  Por el buen trabajo que realizo en la empresa pudo conseguir varias amistades que le ayudan ahora comprándole los productos. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, tratamientos etc. 

Quiere seguir trabajando en el medio de la venta de productos Yanbal por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos. En el futuro quiere tener un local en el centro para vender los productos y así darle un mejor futuro a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Nora is 32 years old and several years ago worked at a factory canning tuna. There she decided she wanted to start working independently and start her own business since her husband left her with their two daughters. She lives in a region called Playas (Posorja), one of the tourist areas of Ecuador that has a great variety of seafood. She lives with her two daughters and works selling Yanbal products. This is an organization that helps enterprising women begin their own independent saleswork. Through her hard work with the company she formed many friendships and these friends now help her by buying her products. She sells perfumes, lotions, deodorants, treatments, etc.

She wants to keep working selling Yanbal products and for this reason she wants a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, and cosmetics. In the future she wants to have a shop downtown to sell the products and be able to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: Perfumes, lotions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dozens of lappa (traditional dresses) to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia L. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, detergents, snack foods and toothpaste in her community. She is 53 years old, married and has seven grown-up children. She is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Lilia has been in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David S. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. David has a piggery farm, which he has run for ten years. He also has a second business in metal fabrication.
To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to own a pork joint (small restaurant) and a bar.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for resale

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mr. Sar S. was born in 1969, and he lives in Trapeang Sva village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sum Sophat, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice for the family's living.  Aside from farming, Mr. Sar S. is also a construction worker, where he is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. 
In order to support the family's transportation, Mr. Sar S. would like a loan to add to his savings in order to purchase a motorcycle. 

This couple has five children.  Two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is construction worker, and the other two attend the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy some important items for her business

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila H. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bilasuvar. Both of her children attend school. For the past seven years, she has operated a cattle-breeding business, breeding animals and selling dairy products to her neighbors. This business is the primary source of income for the family.

Nazila approached AqroInvest and Kiva to request a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase two dairy cows. Nazila is very thankful, because she believes the profit she will make from this business will allow her to improve her house and living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Grace is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy piglets & feed.

Grace has been raising livestock for four years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets & pig feed

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul A. is the leader of this group.  She is 37 years old and married to a private entrepreneur.  She has two daughters and a son; all of the children study at school.  

A year ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS, Aigul started a company called “Siberian Health” to sell medicines and cosmetics.  In this way she earns 4,000 KGS per month.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more cosmetics and medicines in order to increase the turnover of her business.  In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education and believes that her job will help to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and medicines.

loans.name: Women Of Excellency Group

texts.en:
Jean C. is the leader of the Women of Excellency group. She is a 33 years old and the mother of a school-going child, aged 10. Jean is divorced. 

She is a cross-boarder trader who gets clothes from South Africa and sells them near Gweru, Zimbabwe. She has been running this business since 2006 and sells the clothes in Shurugwi, a remote area that is approximately 33 km away from Gweru town. She also gets some income from a maintenance allowance being paid by her ex-husband. Her main challenges are lack of funding and changing government regulations.   

Jean requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of purchasing clothes from South Africa. She says that the extra income from this loan will have a positive impact on her business and family. 

In the future she would like to open a bigger shop in Shurugwi. 

In the photo, Jean is sitting.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rofelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Rofelia  , pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 43  años, tiene tres pequeños hijos que estudian en la Escuela Primaria a quienes ella brinda todo su amor. 
.   
Su  negocio lo inicio hace  tres años con la venta de  DVDs  (Discos con películas)   con un capital de inicio de  S/ 300.00 nuevos soles,   acondicionándolos en su propia casa a la que acuden diariamente sus  clientes quienes gustas de las últimas películas de ficción, de artes marciales, de acción, románticas entre otros. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00, comprara  DVDs al por mayor, además  tiene pensado comprar ropa para damas y caballeros  para ofrecer a sus clientes que asisten a su negocio.

Rofelia   se considera una mujer muy trabajadora  es por eso que tiene como sueño contar con un local grande y bien bonito en su propia casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Rofelia is a member of the ‘Las Margaritas II’ Communal Bank, located in the District of La Banda de Shilcayo within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 43 years old and has three young children who are in elementary school and to whom she provides all of her love.

She started her business three years ago selling DVDs with 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. She set up her business in her house, where her customers interested in the latest movies in fiction, martial arts, action, romance, etc. come daily.

With this loan of 1,400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase DVDs at wholesale. In addition, she plans to buy women’s and men’s clothing to sell to the customers that come to her business.

Rofelia considers herself to be a very hardworking woman. As a result, she dreams of having a large and attractive store in her house. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to improve in the area in which they work.

loans.use: to buy DVDs at wholesale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es casada tiene 53 años D. edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 1 hijo. Isabel vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona D. sud oeste  D. la provincia Cercado del departamento D. Cochabamba.
La señora Isabel y su familia se dedican a la producción D. leche cruda, que entregan diariamente a la planta PIL ANDINA, a través del modulo lechero que tienen en la zona. 
Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado lo tiene en una propiedad aledaña a su vivienda. La señora Isabel es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y su familia se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado D. las mismas.
La señora Isabel solicita el crédito para la adquisición D. alimento en general, cascara D. soya, alimento balanceado y otros, ya que en esta temporada del año existe en abundancia y es muy requerido por los productores lecheros,  y D. esta manera tener asegurada la producción D. leche. La visión que tiene la señora Isabel es que sus hijos puedan estudiar teniendo una buena alimentación y una vivienda segura.
texts.en:
Isabel is married, 53 years old, has barely an elementary school education, and has 1 child.  Isabel lives with her ​​husband, and they have a house in the area south west of the province of Cochabamba Cercado.

Isabel and her family work in the production of raw milk, delivered daily to the plant PIL ANDINA through a dairy module they have in the area.  Their living conditions are modest.  Their house has basic utilities and their livestock are on a property adjacent to their home. Isabel is a woman very dedicated to her work because she and her family get up very early every day to milk the cows and are dedicated to the care of them everyday.

Isabel sought a loan for the purchase of food in general; soybean hulls, feed and other food.  In this time of year the food is available in abundance and is highly demanded by dairy farmers, to be assured of production milk.  Isabel has a vision that their children can study, have good food and safe housing.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and soybean hulls for cattle.

loans.name: Sinoyia

texts.en:
Sinoyia has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his locality. This is his third loan having repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to spend the funds to purchase farm supplies such as manure and seedlings. 

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and to buy a bigger farm. His dream is to be the best and a well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as manure and seedlings

loans.name: Hannah Edith

texts.en: Hannah sells second-hand clothing at Elmina. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Hannah has been selling second-hand clothing for 12 years. She helps her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy second-hand clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: La señora Faustina es una mujer muy trabajadora que con su esfuerzo y el D. su esposo logro sacar adelante a sus hijos y les dio una profesión, ahora ella dice que es tiempo D. realizar su sueño, que es tener una tienda D. ropa para las señoras D. polleras para lo cual necesita el préstamo, ella tiene la tienda y las herramientas necesarias pero quiere surtir la mercadería con telas para eso utilizara el dinero para la compra D. telas modernas y realizar confecciones que están mas a la moda, también lo que ella hace es alquilar estas prendas para fiestas  y su mercancía tiene que ser  novedosa y a la moda por lo que invertirá su crédito para realizar su sueño, es una persona muy dinámica y muy alegre agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Faustina is a very hard-working woman who, through her own efforts and those of her husband, managed to get her children ahead in life and give them a profession.  Now she says that it is time to achieve her dream which is to own a clothes store for 'señoras D. polleras' (ladies who wear 'polleras' - a traditional skirt).  For this reason, she needs a loan.  Faustina already has her store and the tools she needs but she would like to stock her store with fabrics.  She will use her money to buy modern fabrics and make skirts that are more fashionable.  She also hires out these garments for fiestas and her merchandise must be new, original and fashionable.  She will invest her loan in fulfilling her dream. 

Faustina is a very dynamic and cheerful person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make 'polleras' (traditional skirts)

loans.name: Pon's Group

texts.en:
From villagers who live in Siem Reap Province, five low-income people have decided to seek a loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mr. Pon, 31, has been chosen as the leader of this loan group by the other members. Mr. Pon currently works as a porter in his community. He gets an income his job of about $3 a day to manage his family’s needs. He is married with two teenage children who are still unemployed. His wife sells a few items next to the village. Mr. Pon’s wife is now out of inventory in her store and she wants to resupply with extra-goods to continue on selling. That is why Mr. Pon is applying for a loan to assists his wife’s business with additional capital to buy more items to sell.  

The other four borrowers are: 
Mr. Bech, a porter, who is asking for a loan to mend his house, which is broken down. 
Mr. Soeurn is a porter and fish catcher, who will be using the loan money to purchase nets for fishing.
Mr. Khem is a fisherman, who is requesting a loan to buy a new boat to replace his old one.
Mr. Yorn is also a domestic porter, who is seeking a loan to repair his old house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Alex Jhon

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Alex Jhon que nació en la ciudad de Cusco, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo soy artesano y realizo pinturas, arte plástico y muchas cosas más, yo tengo un pequeño taller en mi domicilio y está básicamente esta implementada con cuadros, pinturas, oleos y otros materiales. Ya son 15 años que me dedica a este negocio y me va  muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo oleos, pinceles, bastidores, pasteles, etc. Mi sueño es exportar o exhibir mis trabajos en el país de Estados Unidos para que conozcan mi talento”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sr. Alex Jhon, who was born in the city of Cusco. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Alex said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I am an artisan who produces paintings, works made of plastic, and many other items. I have a small workshop in my home that is equipped with canvases, paints, oils, and other materials. I have already been in this business for 15 years and have done very well. My dream is to export or exhibit my works in the United States so that people can discover my talent.”

loans.use: to buy oils, brushes, frames, pastels, and other items.

loans.name: Sarlin

texts.en:
Sarlin is a 56-year-old widow and is working as a fishmonger. Her husband passed away six years ago. Sarlin has seven children: Alex, 38; Jenuel, 36; Ansel, 35; Jenny, 33; Max, 31; Yanti, 29; and Yordan, 16, who is studying at the second grade of senior high school. 

Sarlin has been a fishmonger for years. She sells fish in front of her house every day. The income generated from selling fish is spent on her family's needs and the educational needs of her son. Sarlin is dreaming of generating more income to better cover her household needs. She plans to commence a seaweed business, but she needs extra money to do so. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). She plans to buy seaweed seeds from the seaweed farmer, as well as ropes and floats to cultivate seaweed. She also plans to buy more kinds of fish to sell. Sarlin hopes that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, and to buy seaweed seeds, ropes, and floats to cultivate seaweed

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 13 years old.

Marichu is a farmer working in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur.  She primarily grows rice crops to sell.  Marichu works hard to improve her business and her family's living conditions. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  Marichu hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hukumatulo

texts.ru: Хукуматуло житель района Фархор. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. Он занимается развозкой людей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Hukumatulo lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 69 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker. Hukumatulo provides a taxi service.  He transports people and has been involved in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, D. 54 años es una mujer trabajadora. Está casada con Pascual, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con uno D. ellos, a quien cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad D. San pedro D. Cajas. En el pueblo la mayoría D. sus habitantes se dedican a la artesanía y el arte; pero muy pocas personas como Luzmila, encontraron éxito en otros campos D. desarrollo. Ella cuenta que hace 35 años, abrió una panadería y desD. ese entonces todo le va muy bien, la mayoría D. sus habitantes compran panes y pasteles en su negocio. Todos la conocen como esposa D. “pashquito”, como le dicen a su esposo D. cariño. Según cuenta cada día tiene nuevos clientes. Pero como en su sangre corre el gusto por el arte, ella también se dedica al tejido y bordado; sus 20 años D. experiencia se refleja en su tienda D. artesanía en el parque central D. la localidad. DonD. venD. sus principales tejidos, en épocas festivas llega a obtener buenas ganancias. Ahora ella quiere abrir su panadería en diferentes lugares, pero por el momento tendrá que esperar, pues su esposo se encuentra delicado D. salud. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP,  donD. se siente agradecida por su apoyo. Por ello promete ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Luzmila D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. harina para la elaboración D. sus ricos panes. Asimismo en la compra D. lana D. diferentes texturas y colores para realizar sus tejidos.
texts.en:
54-year-old Luzmila is a hard-working woman.  She is married to Pascual.  The couple have six children but only live with one of them.  They care for their child and educate him in their own home, which is in the village of San Pedro D. Cajas.  Most of the people who live in their village make handicrafts and create works of art.  However, a few people such as Luzmila found success in other fields of endeavor.
