Luzmila tells us that 35 years ago she opened a bakery and, since then, everything has gone very well.  Most of the people in her village buy their bread and cakes from her.  They all know her as Pashquito's wife as this is what they affectionately call her husband.  She tells us that she has new customers every day.  However, as she has a love of art in her blood, she also knits and embroiders.  Her 20 years of experience are reflected in the craft store that she has in the central park in her village.  This is where she sells most of her knitted products.  During holiday seasons, she makes good profits.  Luzmila would like to open her bakery in different places.  However, this will have to wait as her husband is currently experiencing poor health.  

Luzmila belongs to the 'Telarmachay' community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for their support.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Luzmila will invest the money she has requested in buying flour for making her delicious breads.  She will also buy yarn in different textures and colors to carry out her knitting work.

loans.use: to buy yarn in different textures and colors

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien, 23, is single. He takes care of two relatives, ages 11 and 14. Fabien is a self-employed businessman selling tableware such dishes, glasses, trays etc.. His shop is open from 6am until 5:30pm daily and he employees two people to help him. 

Fabien has requested a loan through Vision Finance in order to expand his shop by purchasing new tableware. With this loan he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, he hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to renovate his house, continue paying school fees for his two relatives and to build a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase more tableware for sale

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre luchador, perseverante y dedicado, que pese la falta de oportunidades y desventajas a las que se ha enfrentado en su vida debido a que nació con una distrofia muscular que lo tiene postrado a una silla de ruedas, nunca se ha dado por vencido y mediante la venta de dulces y mecato en los semáforos de la Avenida 80 en la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia, consigue el sustento para él y sus familiares. 

Jorge sueña con tener un puesto fijo de trabajo donde no tenga que desplazarse tanto, ya que por ejemplo en días de lluvia se ve muy afectado para desplazarse en su silla de ruedas, es por esto que actualmente solicita un préstamo para adquirir una nueva caseta donde guardar sus dulces y mecatos, para poder tener mas mercancía, mejorar las ventas, mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida suya y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a tenacious, persevering and committed man.  In spite of the lack of opportunities and disadvantages that he has faced in his life owing to the fact that he was born with muscular dystrophy which confines him to a wheelchair, he has never given up. Through his business selling sweet treats and candies at the traffic lights on Avenida 80, in the city of Medellín, in Antioquia department, he manages to provide for himself and his family members.

Jorge dreams of having a fixed workplace so that he doesn't have to move around so much because on rainy days, for example, he finds it very hard to move around in his wheelchair.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a new stand where he can keep his sweet treats and candies.  This will enable him to have more merchandise, improve his sales, improve his income and improve his own life as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a sales stand to work from and to buy more sweet treats and candies

loans.name: Leni

texts.es: Leni tiene 37 años, es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, emprendedor y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Para él sus hijos es el mejor regalo que le ha  dado la vida. La actividad que realiza, es la agricultura, en donde siembra cacao y maíz sobre una extensión grande de terreno que es de su propiedad. Hace dos años que se dedica a ésta actividad, aplicando lo que sus padres le enseñaron cuando era muy joven, tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, aunque éste último necesita contratar de 3 a 4 peones para que lo ayuden con el trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico, y con ello pueda cubrir las necesidades de su familia y la educación de sus hijos, sin embargo hay temporadas que sus plantas se ven atacadas por la plaga de insectos; pero no se desanima y continua trabajando. Este sería el crédito número 16 con la institución MFP, se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que le han dado a lo largo de todos estos años.  Ahora necesita del monto para comprar semillas de maíz y algunas herramientas que le ayudarán en la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Leni, 37, is a man with a strong desire to get ahead; he’s enterprising and hardworking.  He lives with his spouse and three children in his own house.  For him, his children are the best gift life has given him.

He’s a farmer; he grows cocoa beans and corn on a large extension of land that he owns.  He’s been in this line of work for two years applying what he learned from his parents when he was very young both in planting and in harvesting although for the latter he has to hire 3 or 4 day laborers to help him with the work.

What he likes about his activities is that they generate income that he can use to cover family needs and for his children’s schooling.  However, there are times when his plants are attacked by insect pests but this doesn’t discourage him and he continues to work.

This would be loan #16 with MFP.  He feels very grateful for the support he’s gotten over the years.  Now, he needs the amount to buy corn seeds and some tools that will help him in the next planting.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and farm tools.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre, deseosa de progresar. Es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres, y su hermano menor de 18 años, que es estudiante, habitando en una casa de propiedad de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Rosmery es la venta de ropa femeninas de todos los modelos, que  trae desde la ciudad de Lima, contando con una amiga en esa ciudad que le envía las ropa, así se ahorra en los gastos de viaje. Su mercadería lo vende entre amistades y familiares, quienes son sus principales clientes, e incluso trae a pedido, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 1 año. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico propia con el cual solventa sus gastos personales, también el tiempo libre que le sobra y los puede dedicar a otras actividades personales, por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es la impuntualidad en el pago de los créditos otorgados a algunos de sus clientes, pero esto no perjudica sus compromisos de pago, ya que es una persona responsable. Además considera su negocio rentable porque cuenta con una regular clientela, y desea  abrir una tienda de venta de ropas en una zona comercial y céntrica de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar en su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas para poder tener acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropas femeninas en mayor cantidad y buscando menores precios,  para tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosmery, 23, is a hard-working, very cheerful woman who is anxious to get ahead.  She is single and lives with her parents and 18-year-old brother, who is in school.  The parents own the home.  Rosmery sells different styles of women's clothing which are sent to her from the city of Lima by a friend so she saves on travel expenses.  She sells the clothing to friends and relatives who are her main customers, sometimes on an order basis, and has been in business for a year.  What she likes most about her work is that she has her own income and can cover personal expenses, also the fact that she has free time to do other things.  What she likes least about her business is lack of puntuality among some of her credit customers, but this does not affect her payments because she is very responsible.  She feels her business is profitable because she has a regular customer base and hopes to open a clothing store in the commercial area in downtown Pucallpa.  This is her first loan through the MFP institution.  She is grateful for the financial support so she can grow her business and is committed to paying the loan back on time so she can request more loans.  The 1,000 PEN loan will be used to buy women's clothing in bulk at lower prices to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married, with three children. She is 46 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Cresilda sells a variety of fish, shrimp, and crabs to earn a living and has had this business for six years. She has requested loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase more fish, shrimp, and crabs. Cresilda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish, shrimp, and crabs.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia es una señora trabajadora desde los quince años empezó a trabajar  en la venta de ropa ella empezó a vender ropa por catalogo y poco a poco y con la ayuda de dios pudo tener un local.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Antonio quien es un señor trabajador que ayuda a doña Yesenia  en lo que se pueda en ocasiones cuando el no va atrabajar se queda en el local y doña Yesenia va a los pueblos vecinos a ofrecer su mercancía.
Tambien cuenta con un pequeño local donde vende palomitas de micro ondas y productos marinela.

Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar más ropa de dama y de caballero ya que se vende muy bien y obtiene buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Yesenia is a hardworking woman who has been working from the age of 15 selling clothes. She started selling clothes by catalogue and little by little and "god's help" she was able to establish a locale. 

She is happily married to Señor Antonio, a hardworking man who helps Doña Yesenia with what he can when he does not go to work but stays in the locale and Doña Yesenia travels to the neighbouring towns to sell her goods.

She also has a small outlet where she sells microwave popcorn and Marinela (pastries division of the bread-making Bimbo brand) products.

She asked for the loan to buy more ladies' and men's clothes as they sell very well and she gets a good income. She thanks the Fundacion for the support it has given her to get ahead and triumph in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Raquel has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 39 years old, a responsible mother of two children. She is married to Mario, a small-scale farmer in the village of Carabatan Grande. Ruby has been engaged in her general store for over one year. As she said, with the income she generates from her general store, she is able to provide their daily meals and continuously send her children in school.

As of now, Ruby is requesting a loan amounting to P15,000 to purchase additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, curls, and other basic kitchen ingredients to sell. She believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and strength of mind.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries such as, canned goods, noodles, curls, and other basic kitchen ingredients to sell

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng, 49, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been a motor taxi driver for over seven years and is successful in his career. His wife is a homemaker. In order to improve his family's living conditions, Peng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials to fix and renew his house to be a comfortable house for his family. In the future, he would like to run a grocery store for his wife to sell at home and support his children to study until they get their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix and renew his house

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor vive en Curicó y vende pan centeno y queque. Hace más de 4 años que tiene su negocio y además vende jabones naturales que compra a una persona de Santiago que hace los productos la misma persona. Vende en Santiago y Curicó a pedido en empresas. Ocupara su préstamo para comprar de jabones y guardo un poco de capital para comprar insumos y hacer pan y queque. En el futuro ella le gustaría Establecer su negocio y poder ella misma hacer el pan y queque, pero para ellos necesita tener maquinas especiales y un local. Es mama soltera y tiene dos hijos, de 22 y 25 y están en la Universidad, estudian Medicina y Kinesiología. Le ha gustado trabajar con fondo esperanza porque le hace sentir El hacerla bien y apoyada y por la guía constante que tiene.
texts.en:
Flor lives in Curicó and sells rye bread and cake. She has had her business for four years and also sells natural soaps that she buys from a person in Santiago who makes the products. She sells by order to businesses in Santiago and Curicó. She will use her loan to buy soaps and keep some of the capital to buy bread and cake. 

In the future she would like to establish her business and be able to make the breads and cakes herself but to do so she needs special machines and a business space. She is a single mother and has two children who are 22 and 25 years old, studying Medicine and Kinesiology. She has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza because it makes her feel good and well supported, in addition to the constant guidance that she receives.

loans.use: to buy soaps and to save a portion of the working capital to buy breads and cakes.

loans.name: Dembagnouma 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  DEMBAGNOUMA 5sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  N’TENKONI un des villages de…, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  BINTOU, 3ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  N’TENKONI après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  40.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Camino Al Exito-Ccotañe Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal "CAMINO AL  EXITO-CCOTAÑE" perteneciente a la comunidad de Ccotañe, ubicado en distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo  en el departamento del Cusco.

Maria es una socia muy trabajadora que se dedica al negocio de tejidos, ella realiza diversos productos como mantas, ponchos y chullos que los comercializa a los turistas, la socia tiene 38 años y 7 hijos por quienes trabajar día a día.
La socia tiene muchos años dedicándose a tejer y desea salir adelante con este negocio mejorando su materia prima Y sus técnicas de tejido.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar lana natural y lana sintética. 

Los demás socios se dedican a la actividad de agricultura, crianza de animales, venta de comida, entre otras actividades.

Los socios están contentos y agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ellos y darles el crédito.

loans.use: para comprar lana natural y lana sintética.

loans.name: Maleha

texts.en:
Maleha is a 21 year old girl living in a household of four in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Maleha and her father Abdul Gafor are doing a share business of selling fresh vegetables and other goods, she normally package the goods and her father is selling them in the shop near to their house.
 
She would like to take a loan so her they can grow small business and get financial income to support the family.

Being an Afghan women it is very difficult to go out side of the house for working, taking photo is more than that so AFSG could not have permission from Maleha's family for taking photo.

loans.use: To buy goods and fresh fruits.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Mr. Esteban V. began his business of making and selling polyethylene bags five months ago. "I am beginning my business of making and selling polyethylene bags using recycled materials. For this I need to buy a machine that melts the plastic and has a large capacity and consequently a greater production outcome." He is asking for a loan of $1,200.00 in order to buy this machine.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Esteban V. tiene 5 meses con su negocio en donde fabrica bolsas de polietileno. “Estoy iniciando mi negocio en la fabricación de bolsas de polietileno y para ello utilizo material de reciclaje, necesito comprar un maquina para fundir el plástico y que tenga mayor capacidad y así tener mas producción” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la compra de la maquina.

loans.use: Buy a machine to melt plastic

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.en:
Ambaroy has owned her business for over 11 years.  Befor,e she worked in a carpet knitting association. She is married and has 4 children.  All of them go to school. Due the difficulties of supporting a family Ambaroy started her business in the open-air market. She worked without days off in winter and in summer.
Today she rents a small place in little open-air shop and sells her goods there. She sells summer women shoes. She has regular clients and tries to satisfy their requirements. In winter she sells a national rubber overshoes (galoshes) and slippers for outdoors.
Ambaroy became a client of Micro Invest in 2005 and her first loan was $160. Today she wants to increase the turnover of her goods and she requests $500. She plans to buy 200 pairs of summer shoes (chips), 300 pairs of open summer slippers and 100 pairs of children shoes.

loans.use: Increase the turnover of goods

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan S., 37, lives with her husband and her 5 children in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Mrs. Lan S., her husband and 2 of their children work together selling gasoline, earning $18 per day between them. The other 3 children are students. She would now like to increase their earnings by purchasing vegetables to sell at home, and for this reason she is taking out a $600 loan.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell

loans.name: Sithuok

texts.en:
Sithuok P.  is married and has two sons and two daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1991and started her own silk production in the same year. She also trained her husband, Var Kimhok to weave silk. He is a mason and assists his wife to weave silk at home when is he free from his construction work. P. also sells desserts at home and is raising cows as well. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  four times already. She is now requesting a loan with the amount of $100. She will use this money to purchase more silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Sra. Flor, 27, has one son. She belongs to the Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso ("Forward-Looking Women of Yungay") community bank. Her business operates in the Yungay market in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash.

Sra. Flor says that her bakery used to only make bread. Thanks to loans, she has improved her production and now makes a range of breads, along with pastries, cakes, tortes, empanadas, etc. Consequently, she's able to meet the demands of her customers. Her fondest wish is to open bakeries in the Peruvian city of Huaraz and other outlets.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,200 (1,200 Peruvian soles or about US$398), to be repaid in 6 installments, Sra. Flor will buy bulk supplies of flour, butter, sugar and salt.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Flor tiene 27 años y tiene 1 hijo. Pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Yungaínas al Progreso, su negocio se encuentra en el mercado de la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash.

La señora Flor manifiesta que en su Panadería solo producía panes, luego gracias a los créditos ha mejorado su producción, ahora elabora más variedades de panes, pasteles, kekes, tortas, empanadas, etc., de esta manera puede atender la demanda de sus clientes, su anhelo es abrir una Panadería en la Ciudad de Huaraz y otras Sucursales.

Con el reciente préstamo que le otorgo Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,200.00 ($ 398) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 6 sacos de harina, 2 cajas de manteca, 3 sacos de azúcar y 1 saco de sal.

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario M. lives in his own home in the zone of San Martín on the west side of the city of La Paz with his wife and two kids. He works in a bakery in the zone of Cotahuma in the same city. His wife recycles the flour containers and sells them in a rural area. With their previous credits, they constructed two rooms, installed a sewer system, and completed 40% of a containing wall. This credit will be used to construct the second stage of the containing wall and to finish stabilizing the foundation of their home. This is the sixth occasion that Mario is requesting a loan, and our socioeconomic analysis shows that he qualifies for another loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 1999.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Mario M. vive en casa propia en la zona de San Martín ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y su dos hijos, el señor Mario trabaja como empleado en una panadería de la zona de Cotahuma de la misma ciudad y su esposa recicla los envases de la harina y los comercializa en el área rural. Con los créditos anteriores realizaron la construcción de dos habitaciones, la instalación de alcantarillado y un 40% de un muro de contención. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en segunda etapa del muro de contención y concluir así con la estabilización de suelos en su vivienda. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1999.

loans.use: Construction of a containing wall in their home

loans.name: Sauda's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Sauda, age 30, is married and takes care of her 70-year-old mother. Sauda owns a banana sales business which she started in 2007. She works from 5 am to 6 pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about US$180 from her sales.

Sauda hopes to receive a loan to buy a stock of bananas for sale. She will share this loan with two other women who have businesses in clothing and food sales.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for sale

loans.name: Antiqa

texts.en: Antiqa A. is a 57-year-old  woman who has sold milk to the her neighbors for the past  ten years. She is married and has four children. Antiqa and her husband are unemployed. It is very hard to maintains such a big family and Antiqa decided to broaden her business by purchasing more milk cows and starting to sell milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. It will increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. She has applied for $1200 USD to purchase two cows for $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola A. is a mother of four children: Fidel, Paola, Margarita, and Raul. Her husband is a salesman at various markets where he sells clothing. Having to help out with the family's income 9 years ago, she started working alongside her husband until she branched off to sell toys and costume jewelry at the markets.

She needs a loan of $475 USD that she will repay in 6 months to repair her van, which is her work's main tool. Lets support Paola so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Paola A. es madre de cuatro hijos, Fidel, Paola, Margarita , y Raúl su esposo es comerciante en varios tianguis se dedica a la venta de ropa. Por necesidad de ayudar en el ingreso familiar hace 9 años empezó a trabajar a lado de su esposo, hasta q se independizo ahora se dedica a vender juguetes y bisutería en los mercados.

Ella necesita un crédito de US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para la reparación de su camioneta que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Apoyemos a Paola para que pueda seguir con su negocio.

loans.use: Repair her van

loans.name: Mario Eugenio

texts.es:
A business in carpentry is something that requires a lot of dedication and experience if you want to develop work/pieces that are accurately made and intricate. In the town of Cinco Pinos (city of Chinandega), Mr. Mario Lopez works at constructing furniture for the home. He works in his own shop and has managed to improve it by buying the machinery necessary in order to carry out his work.

Now, he has gone to Ceprodel to apply for a loan which will enable him to purchase more wood for the production of furniture. This business allows him to support his home's expenses and family, which consists of his wife and two children whom he loves a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de carpintería es una labor que requiere de mucha dedicación por lo que se necesita tener muy alta experiencia para elaborar las piezas con mucha exactitud y destreza. En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Mario L. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles para el hogar teniendo su propio establecimiento que ha logrado mejorar por lo que ha adquirido la maquinaria necesaria para llevar a cabo esta labor.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir la madera para la elaboración de muebles. Con este negocio él lleva el sustento a su hogar de habitación compuesto por su esposa y sus dos hijos a los que ama mucho.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to make more furniture. (Compra de la madera para la elaboracion de los muebles)

loans.name: Sariyati

texts.id:
Sariyati (43 year old) has been living in Bali since 1990. She lives with her husband and their three children. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker. She earns her living by selling rujak. Rujak is a traditional dish made of fresh fruits and peanut souce. Every morning her husband gives her a motorcycle ride to Badung market to buy the rujak ingredients.

She sells her rujak in front of her house. Her customers are mainly from the surrounding neighborhood.

She earns enough money to pay for the rent of her house. She hopes to the loan money to enable her to add her working capital.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Sudah sejak tahun 1990 Sariyati (43) tinggal di Bali. Usaha yang dijalani saat ini adalah berjualan rujak. Setiap pagi, dengan diantar suaminya menggunakan sepeda motor, dia harus pergi ke Pasar Badung untuk belanja kebutuhan untuk membuat rujak, seperti bumbu, buah-buahan, dan kacang. Jarak antara rumahnya dan Pasar Badung tidak terlalu jauh, sehingga dia tidak terlalu menyita waktu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Tempat dia berjualan rujak adalah di depan rumahnya. Pembelinya adalah kebanyakan orang sekitar dan juga orang luar yang sudah sering beli rujak ditempatnya. Penghasilannya cukup untuk membayar sewa kontrak tanah yang sekarang ditempatinya bersama suaminya dan ketiga orang anaknya. Dia berharap diberi bantuan pinjaman untuk dijadikan tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is fifty years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For twenty years now (and counting), she has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel oil, which are used to prepare many local dishes. For clarity, she notes that palm oil is produced from palm nuts whereas palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel and that palm kernel oil is a by-product of palm oil. Normally, she alternates production between the two products: that is, after producing palm oil, she automatically obtains the raw materials to produce palm kernel oil, and so on. In this way, she produces and supplies her oils to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals.

She is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine in order to increase her efficiency and to thereby produce her oils in larger quantities. In turn, she is confident that this loan will help her to expand the business so that she can generate more income to support her husband, to provide food her family, and to finance her children’s education.

Alima belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members promptly repay their loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase her business' efficiency by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., bags of palm nuts) as well as an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Leni Beatriz

texts.es:
Leni belongs to the “Mujeres Audaces” Communal Bank located at Jr. Roca Fuerte #421 in the Callería district of the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old, the mother of three minor children and her husband is employed. Leni sees the necessity of having a business and so with the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the business of renting Internet booths installed in her own home. Besides the business, she attends to all of the household chores and takes her children to school. Her daily routine is very tiring but at the end of the day she feels satisfied because she sees herself as an accomplished woman, mother and wife.

With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will invest in five Web cams, two used computers and a printer.

Every day Leni is growing as a businesswoman and she feels happy because she is providing for the necessities of her children. She is thankful for the immense support that Manuela Ramos gives to her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Leni pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en el Jr: Roca Fuerte Nº 421 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores, su esposo es empleado. Leny ve la necesidad de un negocio, es así que con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 soles decidió invertir en el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet instalado en su propio domicilio. Leni además del negocio atiende todos los quehaceres de la casa y lleva a los hijos al colegio, realmente su rutina es muy agotadora, pero al final del día se siente satisfecha porque se ve realizada como mujer, madre y esposa. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 Web Cam, 2 computadoras de segunda mano y 1 impresora. Leni cada día esta creciendo como empresaria se siente muy feliz porque esta aportando en las necesidades que puedan tener sus hijos agradece por el apoyo inmenso que Manuela Ramos le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase five Web cams, two used computers and a printer

loans.name: Tutindaga N.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Tunganege M.. She is married and has four children aged between two and 18. In 2003, Tunganege established her rice-selling business. She opens her business six days a week between nine and twelve hours each day. She is assisted by her children. Tunganege requires a loan in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, Tunganege plans to establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en:
G. Rukhsora is 42 years old. She is an optimistic married mother of three children with a strong desire to move up in the world.

As her children grew, so did the costs of their education, and the salary her husband made was insufficient to cover it all, so he decided to leave for Russia to earn more.

For five years Rukhsora has had a small business drying and remaking apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown allowing Rukhsora to contribute significantly to the household and education of her son.

Today Rukhsora requests 2500 Somoni ($US750) for the term of 12 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing and reselling. Rukhsora expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots for processing and selling.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es: Jacoba se dedica al arte textil, también brinda servicios D. peluquería,  las prendas que confecciona las deja al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Ella estudió arte textil y cosmetología, y con estas actividades apoya en el sustento familiar.  A sus 50 años es madre D. una hija, la misma que estudia y es la razón D. seguir adelante.  Su  esposo Jaime, la apoya en todo y está D. acuerdo con sus objetivos.   Jacoba quiere seguir creciendo en este negocio del arte textil complementado con la cosmetología, por eso decidió ampliar e implementar su negocio, para ello requiere D. un préstamo para realizar su propósito.
texts.en:
Jacoba works in textile arts and also provides hairdressing services. The pieces she makes she sells to her clients on credit or for cash. She studied textile arts and cosmetology and with these activities she supports her family. At her 50 years of age, she is the mother of a daughter, who studies and is her reason to get ahead. Her husband, Jaime, supports her in everything and is in agreement with her goals. Jacoba wants to continue growing in the textile arts business complemented by cosmetology which is why she has decided to increase and grow her business. For this, she needs a loan to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of her businesses both the making of clothing as well as her hairdresser's shop.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La señora Luciana, socia del BC Mujeres Activas,  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo que es electricista y con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de los artefactos que su esposo repara. Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, lo que le permite estar al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos. Inició su negocio con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y eso le ha permitido crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará diferentes tipos de repuestos, los que generalmente requieren sus clientes en los trabajos que realiza su esposo. 

Luciana manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere construir  un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Luciana R., a member of the Mujeres Activas (Active Women) microfinance institute, lives in the San Martín region of the province and district of Bellavista. She is 23 years old and lives with her husband, who is an electrician, and her two dependent children.

She sells spare parts for the devices that her husband repairs. Her business is located in her home, which allows her to look after her young children. She started the business with a loan from Manuela Ramos. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 4 years, and it has allowed her business to grow.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase several kinds of spare parts, the ones which her customers usually request from her husband for repairs.

Luciana states that Manuela Ramos offers support for her and her family, as well as for other enterprising women. She works hard everyday because she wants to build an office space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted spare parts

loans.name: Elsavar

texts.en:
Elsavar I., a 30-year-old trader who is married and has two sons, started his business in 2006 and has already become a successful entrepreneur. Operating his store in an Internally Displaced People Settlement, he has gained much respect from the many people he respectfully serves every day. Elsavar sells a variety of goods including diapers, tooth paste, napkins, light bulbs, and macaroni. As well, he works at night as a security guard at the local factory, earning about $90 per month, an amount insufficient to meet basic family expenses.

Because the goods he sells are in high demand, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase additional inventory. Elsavar and his family thank everyone for their help.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Sartawi” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace tres  años aproximadamente. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal de Villa Exaltación, ubicada  en la zona del mismo nombre, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con catorce miembros que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayoría; venden comida, dulces, fruta, cosméticos, abarrotes, ropa usada, ropa nueva y otros. Comercializan sus productos en puestos fijos y también de manera ambulante.
La asociación Sartawi precisa de créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos ya que por las fiestas de fin de año, es seguro que sus ventas aumentaran y también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The association called “Sartawi” has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for about three years. That association belongs to the center of Villa Exaltación, located in the zone of the same name, in the city of El Alto. Sartawi has fourteen members, who have shown that they are an organized group through their credit payments and internal activities. The members of the association pursue different businesses, but they are mostly merchants. They sell food, sweets, fruit, cosmetics, groceries, used clothes, and new clothes, among other goods. They market their products in fixed stands and also through traveling sales. The association Sartawi needs loans to buy more products for parties at the end of the year. Their sales will certainly increase, as will their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need loans to buy more products

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Mrs. M. has been selling vegetables since early 2008. She currently sells vegetables in Takmao Market, and can make an average of $5 per day. She is 48 years old and a widow. She is the mother of five children; two of them are single and the other three are married. Her single son's name is Mr. Klem Hem, aged 29, and earns a living by repairing motorcycles. He can earn the amount of $4 a day to help feed his family.

In the past, M. hired a store to sell vegetables. She hopes to own a store; thus, she is asking for a loan as capital to buy a store at the market for selling vegetables. M. currently lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a store

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Маматова Дилбар родилась 1955 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей. С  2002 года она  занимается предпринимательской деятельности. В оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует  женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских национальных платьев, халатов и штанов с различными вышивками и тесьмою ручной работы, которые она сама шьет дома. А также отрезы с готовой набивкой для национальных платьев, и штаны.  
С помощью программы Кива Дилбар хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для увеличения ассортиментов.
texts.en:
Dilbar M. was born in 1955. She is married and has 3 children. Since 2002, she has been an entrepreneur. She sells women’s clothing at the wholesale market “Korvon” in Dushanbe. Her product selection consists of national women’s dresses, robes and trousers with different hand embroidery and braiding, which she sews herself at home. She also sells fabric with designs, for national dresses and trousers. With Kiva’s help, Dilbar would like to take out a loan for $825 (3000 somoni) in order to increase her product selection.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials and accessories

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice L. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joice is 19 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has no children.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a shop

loans.name: Eden Group

texts.en:
Anastazia, who has owned a small grocery store in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for eight years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $90 working 12 hours per day.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more grocery items for the store, hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to enlarge her business.  

Anatazia, 33 years old, is married and has two children: ages 10 and 3.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rose, who also owns a small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
La señora Lucero C. H. tiene 39 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando debido a que se caso y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. 
Lucero tiene una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo combinado y comida que luego abandono debido a que no le daba el tiempo necesario para cuidar a sus hijas. Al tiempo decidió viajar a argentina y al regresar puso una bodega donde vendía abarrotes y que ha ido surtiendo con el tiempo, con las ganancias que obtuvo a logrado comprar sus andamios para sus productos. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la  compra de abarrotes.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de alimentos para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Lucero tiene el sueño de lograr que sus hijas sean profesionales.
Ella pertenece al club de madres de su sector.
texts.en:
Lucero C. H. is 39 years old, She lives in the Aurora Díaz area of the district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school studies, but did not continue her education because she got married and took care of her house. She has 2 children who still depend on her financially. Lucero has a convenience store. She started her business selling meals but later stopped because it did not allow her enough time to take care of her children. After awhile she decided to travel to Argentina, and on returning set up a convenience store where she sold groceries and over time has begun to have more items. With her earnings she was able to buy display shelves for her goods. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan for 300 soles which she received from her communal bank, "Las Auroras en Acción II", she purchased groceries. With a loan for 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy supplies for making food so that she can increase her working capital. Lucero dreams of seeing her daughters become professionals. She belongs to the "mothers club" (a womens association) in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S., 37 years old, is married and the mother of three children. One is presently in the senior high school and the younger two are in the junior high school. She is a multi-skilled businesswoman who trades in different business areas. Her husband is a farmer specializing in cocoa and crop farming.

Grace owns and operates a grocery shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and skimmed powdered milk, as well as such things as body lotion and shampoo. She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her 18 years of trading experience, she wants to increase her inventory by using her loan to buy more items for sale in her shop. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education.

Grace belongs to the village bank called ‘Yohane,’ which translates to "John."

loans.use: To buy items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and skimmed powdered milk, as well as such things as body lotion and shampoo, to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Mayvelyn

texts.en:
Mayvelyn is married to Manuel M. who manages a tricycle transport business. Income from her husband’s business was used to start her hog-raising business. They work together to care for their family and to prepare for the future education of their 8-year-old daughter, Mariuelle, who is currently studying in the elementary school.

Mayyelyn is 35 years old and a good wife and mother who always works hard towards the bettering of her family’s daily living. With regards to their business, Mayvelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to repair the tricycle, their main source of income.

loans.use: To repair her husband's motorcycle tricycle

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Don Hugo tiene 51 años, vive con su esposa, quien es profesora, tienen 3 hijos que aun están estudiando y son su mayor motivación de salir adelante. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales medicinales como; miel de abeja, jarabes o extractos de raíces de árboles, etc. según la enfermedad o dolencia. Adicionalmente, ejerce el oficio de cerrajero, construye puertas, ventanas y otras estructuras metálicas. Ambas actividades le gustan mucho, además le son rentables porque sus remedios vegetales son muy demandados y su trabajo como cerrajero, también es muy requerido debido a su buena labor y responsabilidad. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes hacen un trabajo bien coordinado y en unión. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de cerrajería y algunas herramientas para su uso, tales como cierras, llaves de torno, etc. Asimismo incrementará la cantidad de productos naturales que vende.
texts.en:
Don Hugo is 51 years old and lives with his wife who is a teacher. They have 3 children that are in school and are their motivation to move forward in life. For the past 15 years he’s been making a living by selling natural medicines like bee honey, syrups, extracts from the roots of trees, etc. He dispenses the right type of natural medicine according to the illness or the symptoms of his clients. He also works as a locksmith and he constructs doors, windows and other metallic structures. He likes both activities very much; also they are very profitable because his vegetables remedies are in very demanded and his work as a locksmith is also wanted by many people because of his careful work and his responsibility. This is his 9th loan with MFP, and what he likes about his communal bank is that among all the members they do a very good job and they work well together. With the money from the loan he will buy materials for his work as a locksmith and some tools, such as saws and drills. Also the money will him to increase the quanity of natural products that he sells.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy materials for locksmith business.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally Y. is a villager in Preak Svay Village in Kandal Province and he is a fisherman. In this business, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough fishing equipment. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing tools for his business.

His wife, Mrs. Channa Keo, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land near her house. This couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another three are attending the local school and the youngest one is just 1 year old. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools for his fishing business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P., 35, is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns ~3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel S. is a 39-year-old farmer and father of two children. He started his business in 1999 using a 1-hectare farm that he received from his parents when he married his wife Juanita Salvadoza. He says that he wants to buy an additional 1/2 hectare farm. He also aspires to have a successful life and a sustainable business.

He is asking for a loan worth Php 15,000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemical. The loan will definitely help the whole family achieve a better harvest and income.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos y su madre  en el Pueblo Joven José Olaya, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 15 años, confecciona prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, atendiendo pedidos diversos de la ciudad, esta actividad constituye la única fuente de ingreso económico de su familia, su esposo se encarga de distribuir las prendas confeccionadas.

Rosa ha sacado adelante a su negocio con el apoyo de nuestra Institución, empezó con un pequeño capital que junto a su primer crédito le sirvió para comprar su máquina de coser y desde entonces ha continuado trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para ganarse el sustento; construyó su casa y ahora planea darle a sus hijos, de 18 y 15 años de edad, estudios superiores.

El trabajo realizado por Rosa es muy bueno y original y sus prendas confeccionadas tienen mucha demanda por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito de 1500 nuevos soles a nuestra Institucion los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de telas e hilos para seguir elaborando los pedidos de sus clientes.

Durante los tres años que Rosa ha venido trabajando con nosotros ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42. She is married and lives with her husband, their two children, and her mother. They live in the Pueblo Joven José Olaya, which is located in the city of Chiclayo. She has been making clothes for 15 years. She makes articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She takes various orders from the city. This activity is the only source of income for her family. He husband is in charge of delivering the clothing that she makes. Rosa has gotten ahead in her business with the support of the Institution. She started with a small amount of money and her first loan, which she used to buy a sewing machine. From then on she has continued working with much effort to earn her sustenance. She built her house, and she now plans to give her two children, ages 18 and 15, a college education. Rosa’s work is very good and original. There is much demand for the clothing she makes. That is why she has seen the necessity of asking the Institution for a new loan for 1,500 PEN. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread to continue making her customers’ orders. During the three years that Rosa has been working with the Institution, she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments. Therefore, she is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread to make clothes

loans.name: Reginah's Group

texts.en:
N. Reginah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 57 years old and married with four children, of whom two are still in school. She also takes care of orphans and siblings.

Reginah has been a fish monger at the Lugoba/Kkoba landing site for twenty-nine years, and out of her experience she is able to make weekly profits of $85, which help her in looking after her family and paying the children’s school fees. She is a friendly person and appreciates the contribution that the loans have made in making the success of her business possible.

She hopes to become a supplier of fish to other fish mongers so that she can make more profit. She also hopes to construct a residential house for a rental property. Reginah needs a loan to buy more fish for resale to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Idda

texts.en:
Idda is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 22 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. her child is 4 years old.

Idda has owned a Food business selling chicken for 2 years, she works 7 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Idda`s  first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy chicken for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Idda hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for sale

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana Del Carmen G. D. P. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos dos ya mayores D. edad y una niña D. 9 años que se encuentra estudiando. Ana tiene su negocio el cual le permite generar ingresos que son D. gran ayuda para los gastos D. la familia, El negocio D. Ana es una tienda muy pequeña, la cual atreves D. este crédito piensa surtir, ya que le hace falta muchos productos que sus clientes le demandan, es por ello que solicita D. un crédito para surtir su negocio que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Del Carmen G. D. P. lives in Ahuachapán with her husband, their three older sons and their nine year old daughter who is a student. Ana has her business which allows her to earn income that is a great help with the family expenses. Ana's business is a very small store which she plans to stock through this loan since she is missing many products her clients ask her for. Because of this she requests a credit in order to supply her business which will help her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily Rebeca makes a living selling beads and jewelry in an open market in her community, and has applied for this loan to buy necklaces to sell to her customers. She is 32 years old, married to a businessman and has five children, all of whom are in school. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, she plans to open a jewelry shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy necklaces to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kimseng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimseng Y. is 28 years old. She lives in Prey Run Village in the Takeo Province. To earn a living, she works as a Khmer cake seller. In addition to this business, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Bun Sao Ly, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker. This couple has two children who are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Kimseng Y. is now requesting a loan to buy piglets, pig food, a cow, and fertilizers to support the rice field. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve the business.

Mr. Bun Sao Ly, her husband, is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig food, a cow, and fertilizers to support the rice field.

loans.name: Mahuna Léah

texts.fr: B. Mahuna Léah est née en 1959 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mahuna Léah est mariée à AVLESSI Abraham et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Mahuna Léah vit depuis 20 ans à Agbalilamè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec son mari et ses enfants. Mahuna Léah supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Mahuna Léah mène comme activité, la vente de divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons, lait, sucre, piles, sardines, bougies, etc.) et aussi de l'huile végétale et du riz à son domicile. C'est à Adja au Mono, et à Ikpinlè, au Bénin, que Mahuna Léah s'approvisionne. Il y a 19 ans de cela que Mahuna Léah mène cette activité. Mahuna Léah est une cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien. C'est dans l'optique de renforcer le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Mahuna Léah sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Mahuna Léah was born in 1959, in Adjouhoun within the county of Ouémé in Benin. Mahuna Léah is married to Avlessi Abraham and is the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend school. For the past 20 years, Mahuna Léah has lived in Agbalilamè, in the county of Sèmè-Podji, with her husband and their children. With her husband, Mahuna Léah provides for her families needs and expenses. To pay for her needs and those of her children, Mahuna Léah has a business selling a variety of goods (pasta, soaps, milk, sugar, batteries, sardines, candles, etc.), vegetable oil and rice from her home. Mahuna Léah supplies herself in Adja (in Mono) and in Ikpinlè (in Bénin). Mahuna Léah has run this business for 19 years. Mahuna Léah is a client of ALIDé and has properly repaid previous loans. In order to re-stock her products and better satisfy her clientele, Mahuna Léah is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 50 containers of vegetable oil

loans.name: Munene

texts.en:
Munene is 36 years old. He is married to Mercy and they have one daughter. He has been farming maize and beans for 10 years. He also sells rice as another source of income. Munene does not have a permanent structure for his rice business, so he fulfills customer orders that he gets from different towns.

Munene learned about Kadet through a marketing outreach and decided to become a client. He has applied for a loan of Kenya shillings 30,000. In his budget, he plans to use about Kenya shillings 5,000 to buy fertilizer for the farm and Kenya 25,000 to buy rice to sell. He knows that the prices for the rice are normally low, especially during the months of December and January, because it is harvest time, so he wants to maximize his profit before January. With the extra profits from his business, he intends to purchase a water pump to improve his farm, which has been affected by drought. 

He dreams of improving his family's living standards, educating his children, and building a better house for his family. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice

loans.name: Fanny Margot

texts.es:
Fanny es soltera, tiene 37 años de edad y vive junto a su madre y su hermano en el distrito de Túcume, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace siete años tiene instalada en su casa una bodega en donde vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar , aceite) y abarrotes en general. Este negocio es la única fuente estable de ingresos económicos con la que cuenta para sustentar a los suyos por lo que diariamente trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio.

Su negocio tiene mucha acogida, especialmente en esta temporada de fiestas navideñas y de fin de año. Fanny desea satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes pero no cuenta con el suficiente stock de productos por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y panetones.

Fanny desea darle a sus familiares una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución en ocasiones anteriores demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fanny is single, 37 years old, and she lives with her mother and brother in the Túcume district, about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last seven years she has had a grocery store set up in her house, where she sells basic food items (e.g., rice sugar, oil) and various other groceries. This business is the only steady source of income on which she can depend to support her family, for whom she works hard every day in order to make progress in her business. Her grocery store is very popular, especially during the Christmas and New Year holiday periods. Fanny would like to satisfy her customers' demands, but she does not have enough products in stock. Therefore she has acknowledged the necessity of asking Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa, for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to strengthen her business by purchasing groceries and 'panetones' (cakes, typically served during holidays). It is Fanny's wish to improve her family's quality of life. She has worked with our institution (Edpyme Alternativa) on previous occasions and has demonstrated her responsibility and punctuality in repaying her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and 'panetones' to increase her business during the holiday period

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Marisol es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Marisol tiene un taller de confecciones en un local alquilado que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad , cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan. Además Marisol viaja a las ferias los días sábados y domingos en donde vende ropa.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Marisol sueña con tener un taller grande, terminar los acabados de su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. Marisol works as a seamstress, using rented premises in the center of the city, and with the help of 2 employees. Marisol also travels to bazaars on Saturdays and Sundays, where she sells clothing. Marisol needs a loan of 1,050 soles, to be used to purchase fabric. Her dream is to have a large shop, finish the work on her house, and for her children to complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Prosel

texts.en:
Prosel M., from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental, is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Prosel owns and operates a specialized retail store whose revenue comes mainly from from buying and selling of ready-to-wear items such as shirts, pants, shorts, and any other goods according to customer demand in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Prosel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Prosel's second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tareza

texts.en:
Tareza D. sells food in a hotel and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Tareza is 40 years-old and a widow.   She has six children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another place to sell food.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.  BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy beer and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional commodities for her business.

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en: Imelda C. is from the village of Victoria. She is 42 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda C.'s Group. Imelda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the second loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 28 years old and he is still single.  Jean Baptiste is known for selling women's clothes. This is his third successful year in this business, which he runs from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Jean Baptiste is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by adding a variety of styles such as clothes for men and children.  With this additional business, he hopes to earn more profit than his previous business.  With these profits, one portion will be used to build a secure future for his future family. (He is getting engaged to be married.) The rest of the profits will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To buy men's and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Prem Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Prem Kumari M. is 39 years old and lives in the village of Thecho, Lalitpur, in a single family home with her husband, their son and their daughter. Her daughter is in the 8th grade and her son is in the 4th grade. She and her husband, Rabindra M., earn a living by making traditional idols. In Nepal, this type of work is very famous and the demand for their output is increasing. The couple has applied for money to buy raw materials to make more idols to meet the needs of their customers. Mrs. M. will use the additional income made possible by this loan to ensure a better education for her children and raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials used to make traditional idols

loans.name: C5260 Hope Group

texts.en:
Angelique is 40 years old and is married with five children who are aged between 3 and 16. She also takes care of one dependent from her family.

Angelique’s business is to sell a variety of clothes; her business is famous as well as organized. She describes herself as a hardworking woman in her daily activities. Her business is open from 8 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Angelique is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more bales of clothes. This purchase will allow her to serve more customers from the community which will help her to earn more money.

The profits Angelique expects to earn will be one of the ways she will develop her business and will provide all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes to grow her business

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.fr: Jeune commercant et celibataire de 41 ans,economiste de formation, a la fin de ses Etudes se lance dans les activites commerciales; il ouvre une boucherie en 2001 pour la vente des vivres frais comme la viande ,les cuisses de poulets, les cartons de poulets, poissons et saucissesAvec le pret qu'il compte recevoir , il veut rehausser le niveau de son commerce, rechercher les produits de bonne qualite et de premiere necessite pour satisfaire la demande des ses clients.Etant bon gestionnaire il fait preuve de beaucoup de rigueur et va toujours vers l'avant malgres les difficultes qu'il rencontre pendant les coupures de courant et delestage qui sont tres frequente dans la ville.Dans l'avenir il a l'intention d'importer a Kinshasa et dans d'autres pays et etre un grand grosssiste dont les benefices de sa vente lui permettra de fonder une famille et construire un grande maison; de sa rigueur il fait preuve d'une bonne volonte,tres solidaire et souvent assiste les autres dans l'exercice de leur activite.
texts.en:
This young businessman, 41 and single, who studied to be an economist, went into business at the end of his studies. He opened a butcher shop in 2001 selling fresh food such as meat, chicken thighs, and cartons of chicken, fish, and sausages. With the loan he expects to receive, he wants to expand his business and choose good quality products and staples to satisfy the demand of his customers. Being a good manager, he has demonstrated exactness and continues to progress despite the difficulties he encounters when the electricity is cut, either suddenly or on a rotating basis, which happens often in the town. In the future, he hopes to import goods from Kinshasa and from other countries and become a big wholesaler whose profits will allow him to found a family and build a big house. With his exactness, he demonstrates good intentions, solidarity, and often helps others in their work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace R. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old, married, and has three small children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Grace is just starting this business.

In 2010, she joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Ehrom

texts.en:
S. Ehrom is 33 years old. Together with his wife they have 4 children. Ehrom is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 12 years. He bakes the traditional bread “lepeshka” at his home. His family helps him with his business. Having many customers, Ehrom is selling the majority of his products right from his home. However, he is also running a retail shop in the central local market for selling the”lepeshka”. 

Now Ehrom is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni. He is planning to purchase flour from a wholesaler. Ehrom is grateful for all those supporting him and promises to manage the loan prudently.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.
