It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the traditional bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Mukisa Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en: M. Zulaika is on the shady side of 30 – to be exact, he is 32 years old. At this young age he already has five children. After much thought, he rationalized that taking care of his children would require doing some kind of business. With firm conviction and with a small amount of savings from his milk-selling business, he began a retail business in Butiki-Jinja. His business generates profits of 250,000 UGX per week. With these kind of profits, Zulaika has made a satisfactory rate of progress in his business. As an alternative source of profit he still operates his milk-selling business. With this loan, he wants to purchase more general merchandise retail items such as soap, salt, plastics and sugar.

loans.use: To purchase more stock, such as soap, salt, sugar and plastics

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria E. is from the village of La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years-old and the group leader of a five member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling soy sauce, vinegar and scrap materials in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Chuluun-Erdene

texts.en:
Chuluun-Erdene J. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His 2 elder daughters attend a local kindergarten while the younger daughter stays at home. His wife B. Odonchimeg helps her husband's business.  

Chuluun-Erdene started a transportation business in 2006. At the beginning of his business, he used his brother's car to transport customers, after while he purchased own car. He also run an automobile repair center.  He is a modest and hard working person. Chuluun-Erdene is requesting a 600,000 Mongolian tugrug MNT loan to purchase an old car and sell it after it is repaired.

loans.use: purchasing, repairing, and reselling a used car

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Betzaida is the coordinator of her group Luz y Progreso 1 & 2 (light and progress). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband.

Betzaida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting with a loan she took after a friend taught her to sell jewelry. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different kinds of silver jewelry.  She will use the profits to continue studying, and to improve her business. She dreams of having her own children and becoming a big family. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she likes the program and her business has been improving with the loans.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in L. Arcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free traD. zones are common.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Nancy Muthoni

texts.en:
Nancy Muthoni is a hardworking lady of 43 years. She is married to John M., a mechanic, and together they have three children aged 22 years, 19 years and 16 years. Nancy has been farming for about five years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 20,000.

Having had no history with any other microfinance institution, when she learned about KADET she immediately applied for her first loan of Kshs 50,000. She intends to use the loan to buy a stock of poultry feeds and more poultry to keep so that she will have more eggs to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start dairy farming which is also very profitable in her area.

Nancy hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of poultry feeds and more poultry to raise

loans.name: Adriana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Adriana C. B. tiene 30 años y es una ingeniera industrial con una microempresa llamada   “Marroquinería Alusso” que nació como su gran sueño de ser empresaria hace ya 6 años.  Aunque Adriana desarrolló su infraestructura hace apenas 1 año, ha ido creciendo con paso firme y ahora tiene como meta de posicionarse en el mercado local y a futuro en el mercado nacional, trabajando firmemente para lograrlo. Su unidad de negocio, cuenta con tres trabajadores, de los cuales dos son de planta y está  ubicado  en el barrio los Robles, sector cuya nomenclatura es de Barranquilla, pero técnicamente  pertenece al municipio de soledad.

 En la actualidad su credikiva es el primero que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo va a dirigir a la  compra de  sus materias primas en mayor volumen como sintético, cuero y accesorios, que adornaran sus finos diseños en esta época festiva de fin de año. Adriana planea en seis meses, posicionarse  en el mercado local y es que su gran desafío es lo competitivo de este segmento, pero como sus diseños son a la medida del cliente, aspira a repuntar sus ventas aprovechando el fin de años que se acerca y donde mas dinero circulante hay en el mercado. 
  
Adriana es una joven mujer muy emprendedora y como ingeniera industrial desde que comenzó su carrera, se enfocó en el empresarismo, por eso de antemano sabia que seria una empresaria y justamente inició con su sueño, pues se considera a si misma como una diseñadora empírica y amante del buen gusto  y  de los accesorios femeninos. En su trabajo se destaca en la elaboración de  bolsos y  gradualmente incursionará en la fabricación de calzado,  tomado de referencia la experiencia de sus padres y otros familiares, que han trabajado en estos oficios, por eso piensa que su aptitud dirigida hacia estas actividades será en un  futuro no muy lejano su gran éxito. Adriana es una mujer soñadora y delicada que produce naturalmente diseños muy exclusivos y de mucha  calidad, pues tiene el propósito de penetrar en el mercado nacional, tal como soñaron alguna vez sus padres y con ello pondrá en marcha el sueño de ellos,  que también es su propio  sueño
texts.en:
Adriana C. B., 30, is an industrial engineer with a microbusiness called Alusso Leather.  Owning her own business has been a dream for Adriana since she was 6 years old.  Although she only set up the business a year or so ago, it has grown steadily.  She wants to position the business in the local market first and then the national market, a goal that she is working hard to achieve.  Adriana has three employees, two of whom are full time.  The business is located in the Robles neighborhood which implies that it is in Barranquilla but, technically, it is a separate municipality. 

This is Adriana's first loan from Kiva, a loan she hopes to get from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of synthetic materials, leather and the accessories that dress her beautiful designs. She will use the supplies to make products for the upcoming holiday season.  Adriana plans to position herself in the local market within six months, a real challenge because she faces a lot of competition.  However, her designs are attractive to buyers and she expects her sales to take off over the coming holidays.  
  
Adriana is an entrepreneurial young woman and focused on building her business.  She has always known that she wanted to be an entrepreneur and now she's fulfilling her dream.  She chose to focus on accessories for women because she is a designer at heart and a lover of beautiful things.  She started by making bags and gradually added footwear, taking advantage of the experience of her parents and other members of her family who could show her the way.  She has skill and she believes that will help her make a success of the business quickly.  Adriana is committed to making high-quality products because she ultimately wants to establish a position in the national market.  That's a dream not only for her, but for her parents, as well.

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Virtuosas del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad  se formó gracias a la invitación de formar un comité que recibieron por parte de una de las integrantes del comité Mujeres Unidas de Isla Bogado. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, y está conformado por 18 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades. 
Así como la señora Clotilde D. quien invirtió el crédito en la compra de ropas para la temporada como de remeras, shorts, blusas y otros. 
Comenta que la venta de ropas le deja una buena ganancia y desea seguir con la actividad ya que la misma le permite dedicarse a su familia también, ya que ella abre solo en algunos horarios.
texts.en:
The committee of Virtuous Women from the San Miguel neighborhood formed following an invitation to create a committee by a member of United Women of Bogado Island.  

The Committee is in its ninth loan cycle with the Program Committee of Entrepreneurial Women with the Paraguaya Foundation.  It is made up of 18 members, all of whom work in different fields.

One of the members is Clotilde D., who used her loan to purchase seasonal clothing like shirts, shorts, and blouses.  She says she makes good profits selling clothes.  She wants to continue selling clothes since the job allows her to devote time to her family since she is only open certain hours of the day.

loans.use: Buying shirts, dresses, shorts, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia N. lives in Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has six children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Olivia owns a retail business. She has been in this business for more than ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Olivia sells her products from home. Olivia has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She also generates additional income through vegetable farming. The main business challenge for Olivia is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale, which she believes will improve her standard of living. Olivia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but she does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 43 years old. Erna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Erna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Erna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Erna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Erna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight members. They are located in Srae Kouk village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Van T., who is 52 years old, as the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for their own purpose. 
 
Mrs. Van T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Now her rice field is nearly ready for harvesting, but she doesn’t have enough money to support it. She decided to ask for a loan to hire farm laborers for harvesting her rice. Aside from farming, she also earns her living as a vice village chief.

Mrs. Van T. is widow with a child who owns a small stationery shop in their village.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers to harvest her rice.

loans.name: Bernardino Abad

texts.es: El Sr. Bernardino Abad F. G. vive en el caserio casablanca junto a su esposa e hijos. Trabaja como obrero de campo en el fundo IQF desde hace algun tiempo. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida. El Sr. Bernardino requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. bernardino esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en: Mr. Bernardino Abad F. G. lives in the community of Casablanca together with his wife and children. He has worked as a farm hand in Fundo IQF for some time. His wife sells prepared foods. Bernardino requires a loan to finish the construction of his home. He wants to provide his family with a better quality of life. Bernardino is very grateful for the support that he receives.

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of shoes

loans.name: Luis Leonardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 70 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo O., uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas marginales. Es conocido por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la comercialización de carne en el sector minorista del mercado Moshoqueque (el centro de abasto más grande de la región), el adquiere su mercadería en los principales distribuidores de la zona y la ofrece en venta durante todo el día. Su buen trato y carisma le han servido para contar actualmente con una clientela estable que siempre acude a su negocio para solicitar los productos que necesita.

Luis se vale de los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia y solventar su economía diaria. Actualmente desea adquirir más carne a su proveedor para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis is 70 years old and married.  He lives with his family in a marginalized urban area in the José Leonardo O. district.  It is one of the most heavily populated districts in the region.  It is noted for having most of its population living in marginalized zone.  It is known for its abundant commercial movement and for transportation.

For several years Luis has been selling meat in the retail section of the Moshoqueque market (the biggest centralized supply center in the region).  He gets his merchandise from the main distributors in the zone.  He sells throughout the whole day.  His good service and charisma have served him well.  He currently has a stable customer base, and his customers always frequent his business to request the products that they need.

Luis uses the income that he gets from this business activity to get his family ahead and to pay for the daily expenses.

He now wants to get more meat from his provider in order to be able to increase his sales and get more income.  In order to achieve his objective he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,000 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Nyamirima Twimukye Group-Bushenyi

texts.en:
29-year-old Sylvia N. is a used clothes sales businesswoman who operates from Bushenyi market in western Uganda.  Sylvia is single and has no children.  She has been in her business for 2 years.  

Second-hand clothing is popular in most rural parts of Uganda because it is cheap. Needless to say, most people residing in these areas live below the poverty line. Sylvia was once part of that group. It was after she had done much thinking over her narrow circumstances and their implications that she decided she had to bring value to her life through running a business. Since she began, hard work has become a byword associated with her.  Monthly, her business generates 250,000 shillings.

N. belongs to Nyamirima Twimukye group-Bushenyi.  She says that with the loan, she is going to purchase more bales of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to resell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Rany, who is 40 years old, works in maintenance on a ship to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 3 and 12 years old. Mary Ann joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for her children's future education. Mary Ann is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos,  dos mayores, uno de 16 que estudia en el colegio y una bebé de 1año y 8 meses. El marido es comerciante de mariscos.

Se dedica al comercio de artículos de bazar, juguetes, ropa entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual recorre toda la ciudad de Montecristi. Trabaja los días viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 8h00   hasta las 14h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todos los miércoles. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil. Ya son dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y  le ha ido bien en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, artículos de bazar y juguetes. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son que sus hijos estén bien y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The Soraya Microfinance Group gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its world renown handicrafts, such as the famous toquilla straw (Panama) hats.

This is where we met Ms. Rosa, a 45-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 4 children: 2 adults, a 16-year-old in high school, and a baby of a year and eight months. Her partner is a seafood merchant.

She sells general goods, toys, and apparel, among other products, for a living. She sells her merchandise door-to-door in the city of Montecristi. She works Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 8:00am until 2:00pm, accepting credit from her customers and billing them every Wednesday. She obtains her merchandise in Guayaquil. She has been in business for two years, and she has prospered so far.

This loan is for purchasing clothing, general goods, and toys. She has been in this microfinance group for four loan cycles, and she likes it because it is easy to qualify. She wishes for her children's well-being and for good health.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, general goods, and toys

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
Oscar, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre, él se dedica a la crianza de pollo y posee una tienda, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su madre, ellos viven en casa propia, no tiene un horario fijo para atender las actividades y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en alimentos para los pollos y mercadería para la tienda.
Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar la compra que necesita para fortalecer el negocio y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Su objetivo es mejorar el comercio, atender cada día mejor a los clientes y estar cómodos con su madre.
texts.en:
Oscar, 29, lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department.  He’s single and lives with his mother.  He raises chickens and has a grocery store.  He started the business with help from his mother.  They live in a house of their own.  He does not have a fixed work schedule and needs a loan to invest in chicken feed and in merchandise for the store.

This loan will help him buy what he needs to strengthen the business and meet customer demand.  His objective is to improve commerce, provide improved customer service every day and for him and his mother to live in comfort.

loans.use: to invest in chicken feed and in merchandise for his store

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch was born in 1980.  She is married woman to Mr. Phorn, who was born in 1974. This couple has six children: one is a cloth seller who has a salary, three are attending the public local schools, and the others are still too young to study or work. 

Mrs. Touch stays at home and cooks for her family. Her husband is a construction foreman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. In order to improve his construction business, Mrs. Touch would like to ask for a loan to buy more construction supplies for her husband's use.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Bakyara Twekambe Group A In Ibanda

texts.en:
Sarah N. is the leader of Bakyara Twekambe Group A in Ibanda. She is 33 years old, married and has four children aged 7 to 3 years. All of them are in school. 

Sarah sells used clothing and has had a ladies' salon in Bufunda for four years. She is able to make 90,000 UGX as weekly income and this has helped her in taking care of her family and expanding her business. 

Before starting her businesses, she first sold her cow and got start up capital. Sarah needs a loan to be able to purchase ladies' clothing for sale.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' clothing for sale

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Ollantaytambo  y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan De La Cruz; es casado; el socio tiene 38 años de edad; el tiene 2 hijos, de 15 y 7 años de edad; el socio es presidente del banco comunal; tiene como principal actividad la administración de su botica, en ella vende medicamentos, el socio junto a su esposa trabajan en la botica del pueblo, el socio también trabaja en turismo con su transporte haciendo traslados de turistas de Ollantaytambo a Urubamba y Cusco y viceversa. El socio tiene el trabajo con turistas de manera eventual, esto cuando hay temporada alta de turistas, pero por lo general el está atendiendo la botica con su esposa, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de medicamentos y de este modo ampliar su capacidad de venta.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Ollantay de Wayracpuncu" is located in the province of Ollantaytambo and in the department of Cusco.

The name of this member is Mr. Juan de la Cruz. He is married, 38 years old, and he has 2 children, aged 15 and 7. He is the president of the communal bank. His primary business activity is his pharmacy store where he sells medications. He and his wife run the pharmacy of the village. He also works in tourism with a transport vehicle, providing tourist transportation in Ollantaytambo, from Urubamba to Cusco and vice versa. He works in the tourism business occasionally, mostly during the tourist season. But more commonly he works with his wife in their pharmacy. He requires a loan to invest in the purchase of medications so to increase his sales capacity.

He is very thankful for the loan and he is committed to making the payments of the loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase medications for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Verbina

texts.en:
Verbina is from the village of Kalangahan, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Verbina is married and has children.

To make a living, Verbina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish like sardines and milk fish. She also provides motorcycle transport services with her husband as the driver. Verbina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Verbina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Verbina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Verbina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like milk fish and mackerel. This will be the second loan taken out by Verbina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like milk fish and mackerel.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 19 años edad y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella está feliz porque pronto va ser mama pues tiene 6 meses de embarazó. (Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal María Auxiliadora de la Asociación Arariwa que cada treinta días se reúnen en la casa de una de las socias en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco.  
  
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la señora Rosmeri que nos cuenta que ella trabaja ayudando a su mama en el mercado Túpac Amaru del distrito de San Sebastián, ella y su mama venden condimentos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los días, Ella es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora que con los ahorros abrirá una pequeña tienda de venta de bolsas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad la joven necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas de plástico, platos, cubiertos y vasos descartables y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Rosmeri was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She is 19 years old and lives in the same city in which she was born.  She is happy because she will soon become a mother.  She is 6 months pregnant.  (Cusco is noted for its beautiful landscapes and also for the fact that it is an area whose people work in tourism, farming and livestock raising).  

Rosmeri is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "María Auxiliadora" community bank which meets every thirty days in the home of one of its members in San Jerónimo district, in the city of Cusco.

In one of the community bank's meetings we got to meet Rosmeri who tells us that she works helping her mom in Túpac Amaru market, in San Sebastián district.  She and her mom sell condiments from 7.00am to 5.00pm, every day.  Rosmeri is an entrepreneurial and hard-working young woman who will use her savings to open a small store selling bags and other products.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as plastic bags, disposable plates, cutlery and cups, and other products.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as plastic bags, disposable plates, cutlery and cups, and other products

loans.name: Raffy

texts.en:
Raffy is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 
Raffy has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear.
Raffy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Raffy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery trabaja como empleada en la Alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de matricula universitaria de su hijo. La señora vive en casa de sus suegros  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y Kiva.
texts.en: Rosmery works as an employee at the Town Hall of the city of La Paz.  The loan she needs is to pay for her son’s university expenses.  She lives in her in-laws’ house, which is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz; she is married and has three children.  This is the first time she is working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: pay for her son's university enrollment.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven emprendedor que a sus 28 años de edad se hace cargo de un negocio familiar que existe desde hace 2 años, un almacén que fue creado gracias a la investigación y estudio de mercado que su familia realizo después de que su anterior jefe montara un negocio familiar.

Carlos trabajaba como Diseñador Grafico en una empresa diseñando estampados pero con la ilusión de salir adelante, independizarse y generar una microempresa que fuera el sostenimiento de su familia decidió dejar su trabajo y emprender esta idea.

Actualmente Carlos trabaja de lunes a sábado sin descansó, con la motivación de ver su negocio prosperar día tras día. Y con esta misma lucha de mejorar paso a paso hoy en día necesita invertir capital para comprar mercancía de contado y al por mayor, con la intención de generar mas utilidades y no dejarse vencer de la competencia, pero él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para dicha inversión y es esta razón lo que hoy lo impulsa a pedir un préstamo que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young entrepreneur who, at the age of 28, is in charge of a family business that has been around for two years: a store, which was created thanks to the research and market studies that his family conducted after his old boss opened a family business.

Carlos worked as a Graphic Designer for a company, designing patterns, but he had a desire to get ahead, become independent, and generate a microbusiness to sustain his family. He decided to leave his job and take on this idea.

Carlos currently works from Monday to Sunday without a break, and with the motivation to see his business prosper day to day. With this goal, to improve bit by bit, he now needs to invest capital to purchase wholesale merchandise in cash. This will generate him more profits and ensure that he is not beaten by the competition. However, he does not have the money for this investment. This is why he is now requesting a loan which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of stock.

loans.name: Baasan-Ochir

texts.en:
Baasan-Ochir, 29, lives with his 24-year-old wife and two sons who are four and two years old. They live on his father’s property in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2003 he has been running a taxi service with a car he bought from a taxi company. Depending on the season, his earnings are good. It is the main source of income for this young family.

Baasan-Ochir’s car has become old and in disrepair. He needs to fix it up and make some adjustments to it. Baasan-Ochir is requesting a loan to repair his taxi and so raise his earnings. This is his second loan; the first he repaid successfully and on time.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Cherrylymer

texts.en:
Cherrylymer is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Cherrylymer has a shop that sells beverages, chocolate powder, drinks & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Cherrylymer has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cherrylymer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Mr.Batdorj, 36 and a driver, lives with his three daughters and his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughters study in secondary school and his wife manages a basic commodities store beside their house. 

Batdorj has been working as a cargo driver privately since 2004. He has requested a loan to raise his store's circulating assets through purchasing more commodities from the market, especially facilities for study.  Because a new session of the academic year is starting, he thinks there will be a lot of sales at his store and the income is going to increase absolutely. 

By the way, his family is one of the very busy and happiest families of the world.

loans.use: To raise his store's circulating assets through purchasing more commodities from the market, especially facilities for study.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua is a retailer of pineapple and other fruits at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast.  She has done this for 8 years. Ekua uses her revenue to help her husband to educate, feed and clothe their children. Ekua will use the loan to acquire more fruits and vegetables for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save towards the building of a fruit stand.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a resident and a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He is age 29 and has been in farming for six years with his produce of milk going to the local market. He currently works with one farmhand. He is married with three children.

Micah has made a loan request for 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He says he wants to own at least two pedigree cows for the business in the future. He says the business will help him pay for his children's education.

He reiterates that lack of animal feed remains the major challenge for the dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa est une  femme mariée de 43 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants  âgés  entre 13 et 19 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce de poissons depuis 3 mois. Auparavant elle vendait des fruits pendant 10ans. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs  pour acheter des poissons et développer son activité de vente de poissons en l’élargissant et aussi en le diversifiant.  Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices  et améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa is 43 years old, and married with 4 children aged between 13 and 9. She has been working as a fish seller for the past 3 months. Before that, she sold fruit for 10 years.

She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since May 2011. Awa is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy fish and to strengthen her business by expanding and diversifying. Her goal is to increase her profits and to improve her family's social life.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en:
Khafiz is 55 years old. He is married and has three children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling large livestock at the local market. Every six to eight months, he buys baby calves from farms in villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the grown cattle to local butchers. His monthly income from the business is about 450 USD.

Khafiz is thinking about expanding his business because the income from his present number of cattle is not sufficient to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more young cattle. To do so, he needs to invest an additional 1800 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) in his business. This will be the fifth loan from AqroInvest to Khafiz, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Rancho Luna Group

texts.es:
el grupo Rancho Luna esta integrado por 4 personas, 1 hombre y 3 mujeres, dicho grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de El Pozo Bendito, El Paraiso, todos tienen varios años de conocerse y han tomado la decision de formar este grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias, el coordinador del grupo es el sr. Carlos Orlando, quien tiene 28 años de edad,vive en unión libre y se dedica a prestar los servicios de cortar pelo, tiene una barberia la cual la inicio hace 3 años y tiene clientes permanentes, muchos lo prefieren ya que corta bien el pelo y los precios son adecuados para sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una maquina para cortar pelo, una secadora de pelo, una navaja, una vitrina, espejo, hojas de afeitar, cremas, gel para pelo, asi ofrecer un servicio mas completo a sus clientes y obtener la satisfacción de los mismos. los otros integrantes del grupo son Magdalena quien se dedica a la elaboracion de pan, rosquillas y galletas.  Doña Ada quien se dedica a la elaboracion de rosquillas y doña Lidia quien se dedica tambien a la elaboracion de rosquillas.
juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Rancho Luna Group consists of 4 people, 1 man and 3 women. This group is located in El Pozo Bendito, El Paraiso. They have all known each other for several years and have decided to form this group in order to get ahead with their businesses and with their families. The group coordinator is Sr. Carlos Orlando who is 28 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He is a barber. He has a barber's shop which he set up 3 years ago and he has regular customers. Many prefer to use his service as he cuts hair well and at a reasonable price for his customers. He will use the loan to buy a haircutting machine, a hair dryer, a razor, a display cabinet, a mirror, razor blades, lotions and hair gel. In this way he can provide his customers with a more complete service and satisfy their needs. The other members of the group are Magdalena who makes bread, donuts and cookies; Doña Ada who makes donuts and Doña Lidia who also makes donuts.

Together they work hard to get ahead with their families.

loans.use: to buy hair cutting tools.

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: La señora Ángela Maritza se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella vende de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ella sale desde las 6 de la mañana con su hija de 3 años. Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar más ropa y de diferentes estilos y también comprara calzado, cosméticos entre otros ya que lo demandan mucho sus clientes y deja buena ganancia. De esta forma, ella podrá ofrecer mayores opciones a su clientes teniendo más estilos y tallas, ya que su inventario es muy poco y lo vende rápido.
texts.en: Ángela Maritza sells general merchandise door-to-door and through customer orders. She is out selling by 6 in the morning with her 3 year old daughter. She requests this loan in order to purchase more clothing in different styles, as well as footwear, cosmetics, and other items that her customers frequently request and which offer a good income. With this investment she will be able to offer her customers better options, more styles and sizes, since her inventory is very low and she sells it quickly.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Rinelda

texts.en:
Rinelda is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rinelda is 39 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Rinelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Rinelda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rinelda would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irenea is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Irenea has a candle making business in the Philippines. Irenea requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her candle making business.

Irenea has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Irenea would like to save enough to provide security for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her candle making.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 32 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her produce stand, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize and beans for resale and will help Winnie generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to continue expanding her business. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Safi

texts.en:
Safi (pictured above) and her husband, Man, have been married since 2000 and have four children, including three sons and one daughter. Two are attending school and other two are still young. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Safi's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia.

Safi's husband is a fisherman. Safi sells fish that her husband catches in local market. When her husband is free from fishing, the couple also runs a business selling recycling materials. In the past, Safi sold clothes, but she transferred the business to her mother.

Safi is asking for another loan in the amount of $800 to purchase more fishing nets for her husband and provide capital to help her mother buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets for her husband and provide capital to help her mother buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amarles

texts.en:
Amarles is married with two children and lives in the village of Lapaz, Cabatuan. Amarles is a very responsible mother and wife to her husband. She is engaged in a pig-raising business, primarily pigs for breeding.

Now, Amarles is requesting a loan of P 27,000 to buy feed and vitamins to sustain her pigs. She wishes that someday her business will expand to give her family a good quality life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to sustain her pigs

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is married and the mother of four adult children. She 72 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marcelina used her last loan to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan amounting to 18,000 Philippine pesos to pay for the labor costs in charcoal making. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 31-year-old, married woman with three children who lives in Kasese,Uganda.She has been in the salon business for 12 years.She started with 1 million UGX and now has 5 million UGX. Her hardships are price fluctuations, high fuel and transport costs, and taxes. 

Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for residence.Her business goals are to buy land on which to grow crops, move her business to a more permanent location and expand her business into new markets.

Rosemary intends to use the a loan to buy building materials for construction of her residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house.

loans.name: Jessenia Raquel

texts.es:
Jessenia es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus pequeños; gracias a su esfuerzo Jessenia pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Química, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus pequeños.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jessenia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de yogurt natural, todos los días desde tempranas horas  de la mañana inicia la elaboración de su producto, Jessenia puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jessenia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos para la elaboración del yogur, tales como leche, azúcar, preservantes, frutas, frutas secas, entre otros; de esta manera Jessenia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Jessenia is 37 years old, and lives in the city of Pisco with her two young children whom she loves more than anything. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who gives everything she has to help get her family get ahead since she supports her children on her own. Thanks to her own efforts, Jessenia was able to study chemical engineering, and in her free time she enjoys playing with her children. 

Through her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Jessenia works in a small business selling natural yogurt. She works every day, beginning production very early in the morning, and she works about 10 hours a day. Her business is doing well thanks to her dedication and the friendly treatment she offers her clients. 

Jessenia is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help provided she is able to buy ingredients for her yogurt such as milk, sugar, preservatives, fruits, nuts and others. As a result, Jessenia is able to continue working hard to achieve her dream of providing for her children so they can become professionals and good men.

loans.use: Para la compra de insumos

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos, tiene 38 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por tres miembros él y los dos padres, es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, viven en la comunidad de Kurumayu del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce cebolla, frejol y papa; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Don Carlos es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de su familia. Tienen una vivienda de paredes de adobe, techo de cañahueca y revoque de barro, esta clase de vivienda cada año antes de las lluvias hay que hacer el revoque, Don Carlos, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, con esto el podrá generar mejores ingresos y en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia y así poder reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old.  His family is comprised of three members:  himself and his two parents.  It is a modest family of scarce economic resources.  They live in the community of Kurumayu in the municipality of Mizque, in the department of Cochabamba.

He works in agriculture and animal husbandry, and produces onions, beans and potatoes.  He sells them in the same place he lives to vendors who are also from Mizque. 

Carlos is a very respected person in his community, for his dedication to his work and for being responsible for feeding and educating his family.  They have a house with adobe walls, and wattle and daub roof.  With this type of housing, the roof plastering much be done every year before the rains.

Carlos is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and agrochemicals, and with the profit he makes in the future he will improve living conditions for his whole family, and thus be able to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
“My strength lies is my hand axe, and without this, I would have begged on the roads,” says Lhingneichong. She is a woodcutter, and that is how she makes her livelihood for the family. She is pictured with her hand raised and is the featured borrower member of the group.

She and the other four women members formed the Star Group. The main motif of the formation of the group is to strengthen one another financially and socially. They believe that they will continue until the end. All of them live in the same village, which is about 65 kms from the capital town of Manipur, and which is also one of the northeastern states in India.

Lhingneichong sells charcoal in the village and nearby villages. She also supplies to other charcoal sellers in the town market and the capital market.  The wood is cut down from the forest and is turned into charcoal for selling. In order to get the wood supplies, she and her other partners contribute equal amounts of cash to rent the land for a period of one year. The land is usually shared by charcoal sellers, as the land is expensive for an individual to rent alone. Charcoal-selling is a good business, as it serves a number of purposes for different uses, and it is a non-seasonal product. 

With the Kiva loan, she will make a payment with the others for another plot of land for rent and will be ready for the next season. She is glad that she does not have to worry about the next season of making charcoal like before, when she used to get loans from money lenders at a high rate of interest. She is saved by Kiva and WSDS this season. 

She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva, and I will always remain grateful, and am looking forward to more help from Kiva.” The rest of the group members are also engaged in the charcoal business.

loans.use: to rent more land for firewood to use in making charcoal, and sell the charcoal to make more money.

loans.name: Eugénie M. Jocelyne

texts.fr: Âgée de 47 ans, Eugénie M. Jocelyne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Eugénie M. Jocelyne est mariée à un comptable du nom de Euloge. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Eugénie M. Jocelyne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Eugénie M. Jocelyne vend des produits cosmétiques dans sa boutique depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire,Eugénie M. Jocelyne vend aussi des boissons ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Eugénie M. Jocelyne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Eugénie M. Jocelyne devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Eugénie M. Jocelyne sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Irving

texts.en:
Irving is a 30 year old man, he is currently married to a loving wife, they have no kids yet, they are awaiting to manage a fair economic solvency before bringing children to this world. Irving provides for his house, nevertheless his wife contributes to the house income.
To address a living, Irving works as a supervisor on a machines factory, but he doesn't want to be an employer all his life, his biggest dream is to start a business of his own along with his wife. To achieve this massive goal, Irving is looking for a 15,000.00 MXN loan which will allow him to buy different thing to start his business.
Irving's wife happens to be a professional baker who is specialized on confectionery, therefore, the business they want to start is a bakery shop which will be managed by him and his wife. With the loan money they will buy ovens, raw material and refrigerators.
They are a young couple with huge dreams, therefore Kubo believes that it wont be long before the succeed.

loans.use: to start a bakery of his own

loans.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda was born in 1989, living with her family in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan in a household of 10.

Hameda and her Brother Abdul Hamed has a share business of selling vegetable, she is normally cleaning and package the vegetable at home and her brother is selling them at a small cart in the street near to their house.

She took the 3rd cycle loan from AFSG to improve their business, they are doing this busienss since 3 years. They can generates enough to cover the needs of thier family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fresh fruits

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has two young children that he is putting through school and taking care of thanks to the small general store that he helps run. The small store is located on the side of a major market where vendors converge twice a week to sell their wares. Charles benefits from the traffic and has one of the few structures of its size in the marketplace, which help him attract customers and his engaging personality has helped him get to where he is now.

However, though his store is a great asset, his inventory is relatively small to what it could potentially be, given his capacity for selling and the resource he has in having a large store to house a greater amount of goods. Charles has requested this loan to increase his stock and fill his shelves so that he can be a main supplier and distributor in his town outside the city of Trou-du-Nord. This would not only allow him to improve his own business to take care of his family, but to be a resource in closer proximity to many customers and fellow vendors who must travel further by foot or by public transportation in poor conditions to get many of the supplies that they need.

NOTE: Charles has established his business with regular clientèle in the community and is the president of his solidarity group. He represents nine other small business owners, who will each receive an equal share of this $1,200 loan to invest in their respective businesses. Each member has passed Esperanza's training program and demonstrated the ability and motivation to support their families and pay back their loan.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, canned food, hygiene products and various household items

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
My name is Juana R.. I produce and sell bread that I make in my clay oven. I have owned this business for 2 years. It is doing well because the bread that I produce tastes very good and my customers like it a lot.

At this moment, I need to remodel my oven (to make it bigger) to increase my production and sales. With the profits, I feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juana R. me dedico a la produccion y venta de pan hecho en horno de adobe, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años el cual me va muy bien ya que el pan que fabrico es muy rico y a mis clientes les gusta mucho, en estos momentos necesito remodelar mi horno (hacerlo mas grande) para tener una mayor produccion y venta, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: to buy firewood, barley flour, yeast, margarine, butter, salt, and oil.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Dilorom is 39 years old, is married and is the mother of 2 children. She has a high school education. Her husband helps her in her business, the children study in school. She trades in foodstuff and drinks. She owns a store and has a large selection of products.

She started working with MicroInvest by borrowing $150, back then she bought products on installment from local wholesalers because she did not have enough cash as she also sold products to her clients on installment. Today her inventory has reached $1400. In the future she plans to transition to selling products wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердиева Дилором – 39лет. Замужем, мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Муж помогает в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Она занимается реализацией продуктов питания и напитков. Она имеет магазин и большой ассортимент товаров. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 150$, тогда она покупала товар на рассрочку у местных оптовиков, так как у нее не было достаточно наличии. Поскольку, она тоже в свою очередь реализовала товар своим клиентам в рассрочку. В настоящее время её активы составляют 1400$. Она планирует на будущее перейти на оптовую продажу товаров.

loans.use: to transition to the wholesale sale of commodities

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
I am Saima A. and I learned how to knit when I was very young. Four years back, I started my own business of making various wool products at my house. My husband is a plumber at a shop for very low pay.

I have one boy who is three years old and when he reaches the age four, I plan to send him to the best school in our area. I wish to expand my existing business for which I will have to hire a few girls from my neighborhood. I will also have to buy a large stock of cotton. I am requesting 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Lino Ventura

texts.es:
Lino Ventura is a responsible father of his family who cares for his son, due to the fact that his son’s mother died, leaving only the two of them. Nonetheless, his son gives Lino the strength to keep moving forward in life. Currently his son is married and is a good man. However, Lino wants to keep working, as it is already a passion for him, and in the future he would like his son to inherit the business and keep growing it.

For this reason, Lino is requesting a loan of $375, which he will repay over a period of 5 months. With this money, Lino wants to buy a new welding machine, which will allow him to offer better service to his customers. In this way he will grow his business so it will be well-known in his community as a business that does very good work. With your help, Lino will feel he has the power to grow his business, and because of this he will have the peace of mind that his son will be able to continue to guide the business that Lino began on a good path.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lino Ventura, es un padre de familia responsable, que cuida de su hijo, puesto que la madre de él murió y se quedaron solos los dos. Sin embargo el hijo le da la fuerza a Lino para seguir saliendo adelante en la vida. Actualmente su hijo se encuentra casado y es un hombre de bien. Sin embargo don Lino desea seguir trabajando. Puesto que esta ya es una pasión para él y para que en un futuro pueda heredarle el negocio a su hijo y este siga creciendo.

Es por esto que Lino está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Y con este dinero Lino desea comprar una Máquina nueva para soldar, y con esto podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y así crecer su negocio para que este quede consolidado en su comunidad como un negocio que hace muy bien sus trabajos. Con tu ayuda Lino podrá sentirse superado al crecer su negocio y así tener la tranquilidad de que su hijo podrá continuar por el buen camino el negocio que con mucho esfuerzo comenzó Lino.

loans.use: Buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Yusta M..  In May this year, she received a loan from SELFINA to establish a business selling clothes, purses and perfume.  She has successfully repaid this loan and now requires another to purchase additional stock and continue building her business.  Yusta is a single mother of three - Hassea, aged 18, Faustina, aged 15, and Haluni, aged 12.  She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes, purses and perfume.

loans.name: Mondinotu

texts.en: Mondinotu A. is married with 3 children, is 35 years old and hails from Itire in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in her business since 1995. She has been with LAPO as client for the past 3 years and needs a loan of $275 to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Muguluka West H Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mary N.. She is currently in the business of running a hotel and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Mary is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has 7 children ranging from age 8 to 22 and all of them go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately UGX 12000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in the business. Mary has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mary is joined in her small group by Margret N., Hasifa N., and Edisa N.. Margret N. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Hasifa N. is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to uplift business. Edisa N. operates a business selling sugar wax and wants to expand business.

loans.use: To add to hotel business

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en: K. Adolat was born in 1967 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married with one child.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Like many rural women, she is engaged in the business of raising and selling livestock.  By education and profession, she is actually an accountant, but her love for animals motivates her to be engaged in selling livestock. She is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Raza

texts.en: Raza lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He has a metal shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. He is a very talented young man, so during these 5 years he has filled lots of contracts and made a big shop. He needs to complete his stock so he wants to take an individual loan to further his business with more success. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete materials necessary for his business

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty E. owns a provision store in Ghana which sells a variety of goods.  She is married and has two children. While her business is doing very well, she sees the opportunity to increase sales by maintaining a bigger inventory with a wider range of goods.   Therefore, Gifty is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
Las Señoras D. la asociación Banco Comunal LUCERITO, son personas que en su mayoría viven y tienen residencia en la Zona Cupilupaca Central, por intermediaciones D. la avenida periférica D. la ciudad D. La Paz, ellas se dedican al comercio, como la venta D. ropa, venta D. frutas y otros rubros al comercio. La asociación se ve muy unida y con una visión D. progreso en sus respectivas actividades, esperan que el dinero obtenido como crédito D. la entidad fortalezca sus negocios y que más adelante se pueda seguir trabajando con responsabilidad y puntualidad. La presidenta Dña. Rosa Q. D. L. manifiesta las ganas D. trabajar y además D. ser uno D. los mejores grupos en la institución. También se traduce en lo dicho anteriormente por la presidenta la voz D. todos los componentes.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

The Ladies of the Bank Communal Lucerito are people who mostly live and have homes in the Cupilupaca Neighborhood of LaPaz. They are mostly businesswomen who sell clothes, fruit and other items. The association is very united around their activities and has a strong vision for progress with the expectation that the money obtained as a credit with strengthen their business and that in the future they will be able to continue working with responsibility and punctuality. The chairwoman, Rosa Quente, reiterates their desire to work and indicates that they are one of the best groups of the institution.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Diolizana

texts.es:
Diolizana belongs to the bank Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”. She lives in Jr: Zavala Nº 775, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She’s 37 years old and is the mother of 3 young children, and her husband is a laborer. Diolizana has decided to ask for a loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos to invest and open a multi-services business: providing photocopies, lamination, notebooks, and digitizing of documents. She currently maintains a business in her own home, allowing her to do home chores, but besides all this work, she able to take a small break from 1 to 4 pm. With this loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be repaid in 4 moths, she will invest in the purchase of supplies: 2 thousand sheets of bond paper, 3 printer ink cartridges, 20 laminate sheets, 25 notebooks, 50 manila folders, 50 poster boards. Diolinzana is very happy because she contributes to the household income and her biggest wish is to grow as a businesswoman and she thanks Manuela Ramos for the support they have given.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Diolizana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”domiciliada en el Jr: Zavala Nº 775 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores, su esposo es obrero. Diolizana decide hacer un préstamo de Manuela Ramos S/ 300.para invertir y abrir un negocio de Multiservicios: fotocopias, enmicados, espiralados y digitación de trabajos. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio en su propio domicilio, esto le permite ver los quehaceres de la casa, a pesar de todo el trajín, ella puede darse un pequeño descanso de 1.00 pm hasta las 4.00pm Con el este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de insumos: 2 millares de papel bond, 3 tintas para impresora, 25 micas, 25 espirales, 50 fólderes de Manila y 50 cartulinas. Diolizana se siente muy contenta porque apoya en los gastos que tiene en su hogar y su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria y agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado

loans.use: To purchase supplies (paper, ink, lamination supplies, poster board etc.)

loans.name: Junes N.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 58 -year-old Junes M..  She is married and has seven children aged between 18 and 38. She has one dependent who lives with her because she is orphan. In 2006, Junes established her genge business. Working six days a week, and one to four hours a day, she earns about US $10 every month from this business. Junes requires a loan in order to buy soap, sugar, tomatoes, onions, groundnuts, and cooking oil. She thanks you for your support.  

Genge
The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, tomatoes, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Chu Thi T. is 50 years old. With the first loan worth VND 2 million, she raised ornamental birds. At first the family did encounter some difficulties, but after ten years they have been very experienced in their business. Today this business is  her family's main source of income. Besides, they have earnings from livestock raising and farming. Hence, her family's economy is developing and getting more and more stable. For the next loan cycle, she applies for VND 9 million to further invest in her business to enhance the family's economy.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina tiene 42 años, es divorciada y no tuvo hijos así, que vive sola.  Se dedica a la confección de chompas, chalinas, pantaloncillos, guantes, etc., tejidos a máquina, actividad que es su principal fuente de ingresos para su manutención.  Realiza esta actividad desde hace 20 años, gracias a lo aprendido desde niña, ella hizo de este hobby una profesión, ya que siempre le ha gustado tejer, lo difícil de su trabajo, es conseguir material para la elaboración de sus prendas, ya que el precio es elevado, pero aún así ella sigue trabajando muy duro día a día.   Valentina quiere progresar, crecer en su negocio, para asegurar su futuro económico.  Con el dinero que solicita, comprará mucho más material para elaborar sus lindos tejidos y mejorar el acabado, para aumentar su venta, desea que en el futuro su negocio se convierta en un gran taller.
texts.en:
Valentina is a 42 year old woman who lives along, as she is divorced and without children. She works sewing jackets, scarves, pants, gloves, etc. Sewing these items with a sewing machine is her main source of the income which she uses to support herself. For the last 20 years she has worked in this craft which she learned as a child. She made her hobby her profession, since she has always enjoyed sewing. The hardest part for her is to obtain material to use to create her products, since the price can be quite high. Nevertheless, she works hard every day. Valentina wants to progress, and to grow her business in order to secure her economic future. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase much more material which she will use to sew her lovely creations, and to improve her finished product in order to increase sales. She hopes to turn her business into a large shop in the future.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material (wool and others) to create many kinds of clothing.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon S., 47, and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Yi, 49, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1978 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Five children are in school and two sons have full time employment.

Mrs. Samon has been weaving for twenty years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been growing rice for twenty years. He grows rice in his rice farm a bit far from home for food.

Samon is requesting a loan of 300 to purchase thread and silk for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase thread and silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu H. is a 32-year-old woman who lives in the Trapaing Svay village in Takeo Province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Mol Sameth, is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from house, he usually pays a good amount of money for transportation to work. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Thu H. has decided to ask for a loan so that she can buy a motorbike for him. 

She has four children, three children of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also pictured on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhum Dang  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan will go to sixteen people in Phum Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhum D. is a village bank president, selected by the members. She is a basket seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sdao Kin, is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they still earn only a little income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokhum D. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business. Mrs. Sokhum D. is 39 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer while the others attend the local school. Group member Mr. Yung N. is not taking a loan, but his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead of him. 

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.
