Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start a breeding business

loans.name: Ashur

texts.en:
Ashur B. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Ashur has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Ashur harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. In this way, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. He requests 1000 USD for the term of 10 months. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Kaundime

texts.en:
Kaundime has been a coconut, cassava and clothes seller in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Nia Moja loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more coconuts, cassava and clothes for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Kaundime is 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 5 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts, cassava and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Penn Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of four children. She runs a firewood and palm oil business. Pauline lives and sells her products in Bamenda, Cameroon, near GHAPE. She will use her loan to purchase firewood, palm oil, rice, corn and beans to resell at her store on Foncha Street. 
 
This is Pauline’s seventh loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2001. She has had her business for long enough to know that she will be successful with this loan. She sees that her customers, that is, her community, benefit from her business because they do not need to travel as far to have access to firewood and her food products. She also sells her products at moderate prices, so she believes she is competitive.

She has used profits from previous loansto buy items for her business’s kitchen, essentially investing in her business. With this loan, she hopes to use the profits to pay for her children’s school fees and their books. Pauline prefers GHAPE loans because they allow long-term loans and that has helped her be able to invest in her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Monsieur  est un homme très travailleur qui exerce depuis 2007 le commerce de cartes de recharges et d’eau minérale, il est marié avec une femme qui est commerçante et avec 02 enfants. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille. Il veut agrandir son commerce pour pouvoir mieux vendre et répondre à la demande de ses clients c’est pour cela qu’il s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit pour acheter des cartes de recharges togocel, 100 FANVIVA, et 20 sachets d’eau minérale.
texts.en:
Kokou is a hard-working man who has sold mobile phone cards and mineral water since 2007. His wife is also an entrepreneur and they have two children. He supports his family with the income from his business. Kokou wants to expand his business to meet the customer demand. For this reason he has turned to WAGES to request a loan to purchase TogoCel mobile phone cards, 100 FAN VIVA and 20 bags of mineral water.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phone cards, mineral water and FAN VIVA

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: La señora María Elena H. con sus ahorros pudo construir un cuarto al cual le está haciendo falta el techo. Pero ella desea ponerle la losa de concreto porque es más segura y duradera. Por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo el proyecto y terminar la recamara de sus hijas, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra. Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene como empleado domestica, ya que su esposa el señor Miguel Ángel Salce de la Cruz, se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Señora María Elena H. was able to save enough to build a room onto her house, but it still needs a roof. She would like to put a concrete roof on it so it is safer and more durable. Right now she doesn't have the money she needs to finish the project and finish her daughters' bedroom. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase the matierals and to pay for the labor. She plans to pay back the loan with the income she earns as a domestic employee since her husband, señor Miguel Ángel Salce de la Cruz, will take care of the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A concrete slab

loans.name: Jencen

texts.es: Jencen tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene un hijo, por el momento viven en la casa de sus padres. Desde niño conoce a la perfección los trabajos agrícolas, por ser de padres agricultores. Orgulloso y contento remueve la superficie de sus terrenos para que posteriormente la abone y logre una buena producción en tiempos de cosecha, la que después comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad, aunque posteriormente piensa vender en la misma chacra para evitarse el transporte. Jecen se siente muy orgulloso de ser chacarero, esta es su única fuente de trabajo, y la mayoría de las veces le ha sido rentable. Además, cuenta con el apoyo de sus suegros, que le brindan sus tierras a sin ningún costo, por ello que sus metas a corto plazo son de comprar sus propias chacras de cultivo y un terreno donde pueda construir su casa. Para alcanzar este objetivo está trabajando como peón; aunque le es muy dificultoso por el momento no es imposible, comenta. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para abonar la chacra de papas que hace 3 días ha sembrado.
texts.en:
Jencen, 21, lives with his partner with whom he has a son. For now, they're living with her parents. He's had a thorough understanding of farm life from the time he was a boy because his parents are farmers. Proudly, happily, he turns over the top layer of soil in his fields so that he can later fertilize them and ensure a good crop when the harvest rolls around. Afterwards, he'll sell the crop in the markets in the city or, perhaps, he's thinking, sell right from the field to avoid the transportation costs. Jecen is proud to be a farmer. It's his only work and, for the most part, it's been a profitable business. He counts on support from his in-laws who provide land to him at no cost. Jencen's short-term goal is to buy his own farm and land where he can build a house. To reach his goal, he's starting at the bottom. He says that the goal is difficult but not impossible. The money that he's applying to borrow is for chemical fertilizers to fertilize the potato fields that he seeded 3 days ago.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida P. lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old and married. Her husband works as a jail guard. Mrs. Leonida applied for the loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase junk and other scrap materials. One of the richest men in the Philippines started like her, collecting and purchasing junk (used bottles and cans) and other scrap materials (like old newspapers and magazines)from different households and offices and sell these in waste recycling businesses; now he owns prime real properties in the Philippines, Taiwan and Hongkong. His story is always an inspiration for Leonida. The income she generates from her business helps their daily expenses and paying the tuition fees of her children. She plans to have sari-sari store aside from her junk shop.

loans.use: To purchase junk and scrap materials for her junk shop business

loans.name: So

texts.en: So O., 46, lives with her family in a small thatch house located in Kompong Cham province. At present, she and her husband make a living as farmers. They grow various crops--they are flexible depending on the growing conditions of the different seasons. This couple has six children. Most of them are rice hulling workers. So O. will be using her loan to rent the neighbor's farmland and buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Izatbibi

texts.ru: Изатбиби – женщина 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Её муж разнорабочий. Зарабатывает не так уж хорошо. Изатбиби занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Кондитерские изделия ей поставляет разные фирмы а также домашние кондитеры. Изатбиби старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Izatbibi is a 48-year old mother of three. Her husband works day jobs and does not earn much. Izatbibi sells sweets at Gafurov's Farovon market. She purchases the sweets both from companies and private suppliers. Izatbibi would like to expand the variety of sweets in her shop by offering imported sweets. This would help her increase her family's income.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: imported sweets

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy O. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Christy is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Christy owns a business venture operating transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tricycle rentals to the local community. Christy has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (approximately $62) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Christy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Christy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Christy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo has been a single parent for the past 10 years and life is a little difficult for her because she has to cater for herself and 5 of her children who are still in secondary school. Titilayo sells cement out of her home and she has been in the business for the past 2 years, after learning the business in 6 months. Titilayo is 40 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cement to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to sell

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar T. is a 43-year-old father of two teenage daughters. He currently lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two daughters are 17 and 19-year-old and both go to a local high school. His wife is a cook and works in a small local restaurant. Chuluunbaatar currently drives a cab in the town. He has been in the taxi business since 2007. Since the start, his business has done quite well; his business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT to 400,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Chuluunbaatar hopes that he would be able to purchase new taxi for his business one day. He requests a loan to repair his old car that uses for his cab business.

loans.use: to repair his old car that uses for his cab business

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en: There are two low-income people show in the picture above. One of these people, Sam T., 44 years old, is looking for a loan to buy a used-motor in order to make her family’s transportation easier. She and her husband are Khmer music players. They are also hired by neighbors to play the music for their wedding parties. This couple has blessed with eight children; two of their children go with them to play music. The other one who is jointly taking this loan; Mrs. Khat H., age 65, is a vegetable seller, who asking for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy a used-motor in order to make her family’s transportation easier

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 35 years old and lives in the village of Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is married to Jerold, a government employee. The couple is blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. They are: Jecel - 14 years old; Jennifer - ten years old; Christine Joy – five years old, and Gerald Paul – two years old. Just like other parents, Cecilia is hoping to send her children on to higher levels of education someday. She is hoping that with the help of her business she will be able to finance their schooling.

Cecilia is engaged in a retail business where she sells different snacks in the school canteen located in their village.  Aside from cooked snacks, she also sells other grocery items which the students like. She also sells vegetables and fruits in their village on the weekend. She knows that her business can grow if she has sufficient business capital. For this reason, Cecilia is hoping for a loan amounting to PHP5,000 for her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny is 44 years old and married to Alejandro, a farmer. They were blessed with eight children; one of them is married. They live in Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela.

Benny is engaged in a retail business on the school campus in their village where she has a small stall to in front of their house display her products. Her weekly net income is PHP 1,500. Every Saturday and Sunday she also sells various items in front of their house for additional income. She wants to access a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP17,000 for the expansion of her business and to purchase more products that she can sell.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two sons. She runs a pharmaceutical business in Ivano-Frankivsk next to a local children’s hospital. Olga owns 3 small pharmaceutical kiosks and sells medications to retail clients. She launched this business 6 years ago and she currently earns a net profit of 8,000 Grivnyas per month.     

Olga is seeking a loan of 8,200 Grivnyas to purchase assorted pharmaceuticals for the cold season when viruses, cold and flu lead to increased spending on medications. Olga’s business is the main source of income for the family and her husband is also actively involved in the business. One day Olga is hoping to continue to develop her business by opening several more pharmaceutical kiosks.

loans.use: to purchase assorted pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: D. S. Nicole est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nicole est mariée à AHOUANSOU Gilles, un revendeur. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. C'est depuis sept ans que Nicole vit à Djeffa, dans la commune D. Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Nicole vient en aiD. à son mari dans les charges D. la famille. Nicole a fait seulement le cours primaire. Depuis 5 ans, Nicole mène comme activité, la vente D. produits D. beauté et des ustensiles D. cuisine (plastiques, plats, etc.)D. façon ambulante. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Nicole fait ses approvisionnements. Nicole a déjà obtenu une fois D. crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Afin D. renforcer son activité et D. mieux satisfaire la demanD. D. plus en plus nombreuse D. sa clientèle, Nicole sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès D. ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. S. Nicole was born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Nicole is married to Ahouansou Gilles, a re-seller. The couple has 3 children, some of whom are attending school. For the past 7 years, Nicole has lived in Djeffa, in the county of Sèmè-Podji, with her children and husband. Nicole helps her husband pay for the family's expenses. Nicole only attended primary school. For 5 years, Nicole has run this business, selling cosmetics and kitchen utensils (plastic buckets, dishes, etc.); she sells as she walks around town. Nicole supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Nicole has previously had one loan from ALIDé, which she fully repaid. In order to improve her business and better satisfy the growing needs of her clientele, Nicole is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products/ cosmetics (body lotion, face creams, perfumes etc.)

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Lane Kuru' Group. 'Lane Kuru' is a Temne phrase meaning “believe in God”. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city who have come to SMT/Kiva to seek their very first loan. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Wara T. (left) is the leader of this group. Wara was born in Masongbo, on the outskirts of Makeni. She is now approximately forty-five years of age. She is married and has four children who are all grown-up and on their own.

Wara sells 'gara lappers' (locally dyed cloth). She has got ten years of experience in this business. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business. She will use the loan to buy lengths of white cotton, inks, caustic soda, and a bowl that she will used in her 'gara'-dyeing work.

loans.use: Buy working materials like lengths of white cotton, caustic soda, powder, inks and a basin

loans.name: Elder Francisco

texts.es: Elder Francisco tiene 30 años de edad, su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de una manera mucho más humilde. Por lo que inicio con muy poco dinero, pero esto no la detuvo para salir adelante además de los muchos sacrificios para su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, pan, galletas, refrescos naturales y jugos. Además sueña  con incrementar su negocio lo suficiente para que sus hijos sigan con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Elder Francisco is 30 years old and he owns a local store. He's dedicated himself to this store for more than three years now because he's always liked to work in a more humble manner. Although he started with very little money, it did not deter him from coming out ahead in addition to the many sacrifices for his family. The financing he requests is for the purchase of staple grains, bread, cookies, natural sodas and juices. He also dreams of increasing his business enough that his children can continue it.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Increase of Inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió superior completo, se dedica a la compra y  venta de ladrillos.

Nelly nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar mas mercadería y así aumentar su capital y ganancias

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda mas grande de productos para la construcción.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nelly, 39, has been a member of the "Brisas del Lago" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in the district, province and department of Puno. She is married and has two children. She finished high school and she is a brick merchant. Nelly tells us that she used her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement in increase her capital. She now needs 3000 new soles to buy more merchandise and thus increase her capital and profits. Her dream for the future is to have a larger building supplies store. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena D. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Lorena is married and has 2 adult children. Lorena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and giving her the ability to engage in business activities. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 25 years old. She is an unmarried mother. She cares for two children, ages 2 and 3. Oliva lives in the Nyarugenge District, Kigali Province in the capital of Rwanda, where she has her business. Oliva has been an entrepreneur for many years. She employs two people in her business as helpers so that her business runs well. 

Oliva has 6 years of experience selling cow meat. This business is very interesting for her because is profitable, even when she has little money, all of which is used for her business.

Oliva would like to request a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing large quantities of meat. Thiswill allow her to continue to develop her business. 

The hours of her shop are from 7:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening every day, even during the weekend. It seems that Oliva is serious about her business. That is the reason that she will reach her goal of expanding her business and increasing her monthly profits.

loans.use: To buy cows for meat

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en: Sattar S. was born in 1964. He is married and has one child. S.'s family lives in the city of Baku. Sattar has been in his business for two years. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose C. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock some bags of beans, sugar, salt, etc., to sell. Rose is 42 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock some bags of beans, sugar, salt, etc., to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem S. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products. She has a business of tailoring, which provides an income of about USD 2.00 per day. Her husband runs a business of cleaning cars and motorbikes, earning an income of USD 13.00 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to build a bigger place to clean the cars and motorbikes. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to pay for the children’s schooling. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a bigger place to clean the cars and motorbikes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila L., 51 years old, is a rice grower from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She has four children. Her eldest is 19 years old. She dreamed of sending all her children to school but then she has limitations because at the moment her family has financial problems. That is why she would like to focus on her business. She dreams of having a bigger farm someday. 

She would like to ask for a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Né vers 1960 à San, Djeneba K. n’as pas eu la chance d’ aller à l’école, elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus, elle est mariée et mère de 13 enfants. Elle  vit chez son époux dans le quartier Santoro I de la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Elle a commencé le commerce de poisson fumé avec son mari il y a plus de 20 ans  et l’exerce actuellement pour elle même au grand marché  de San et dans les foires environnantes. 
Elle est très sollicitée dans  des foires hebdomadaires, de San  ville et environnants.  
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de faire recours à l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elle est à son deuxième  prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
Madame Djeneba compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 40 cartons de poissons fumés à Mopti et payer les frais de transport pour son acheminement  à son magasin situé au  grand marché de San. 
Elle a une clientèle composé de femmes et d’hommes et vend, en détail,  à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 160 000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt et utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus .
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in San, Djeneba K. did not have the opportunity to attend school, but became quickly interested in revenue-generating activities. She is married and the mother of 13 children. She lives with her husband in the Santoro I borough of the San Prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She started selling smoked fish with her husband over 20 years ago, and currently runs her own fish-selling business at San’s main market and at other market fairs in the area. In order to satisfy increasing customer demand, she decided to call upon the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where she is requesting a second personal loan, having correctly reimbursed the first one. Mrs. Djeneba wants to use her loan to buy 40 crates of smoked fish in Mopti, and also pay the transportation costs to her store located at San’s main marketplace. Her customers are both men and women and she sells retail, for cash or credit. She hopes to attain monthly earnings of 160,000 FCFA she will use to reimburse the loan, and use the remainder to pay her children’s tuition fees, buy food, and invest in other revenue-generating activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy smoked fish

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est âgée de 34 ans, elle s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce de détail de  jus et de savons liquide, elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse de  stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit après remboursement du premier pour l’achat de 16 sacs de produits de jus et  4 cartons de savons liquide. Elle est mariée et mère de 1 enfant.
texts.en:
This woman is 34 years old. Since 2008, she has been retailing juices and liquid soaps. At the moment, her stock is depleted, which is why she is seeking a second loan from WAGES, the first one having been duly reimbursed. This loan is to help purchase 16 bags of juice products and 4 cartons of liquid soap. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing juice products and liquid soap

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur  Dramane Koné est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Dramane Koné, après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,   s’initia depuis plus de trois ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente des bazins blancs, soude caustique, teintures, etc. Il mène son activité à Wayerma I en face de l’Agence Malienne pour la Presse et la Publicité (AMAP) de Sikasso, non loin de la prison centrale où il dispose d’une boutique. Monsieur Koné est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux ans. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 20 paquets de soude caustique, 17 pièces de bazins, 13 sacs de potasse, 15 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes, etc. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et les revendre à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes teinturières de  la ville de Sikasso et environs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce présent prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane Koné is married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in Wayerma I, one of the residential neighborhoods in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After havng tried a variety of different activities without success, three years ago Mr. Koné started his business of buying and selling white damask fabric, caustic soda, dyes, etc. He carries out this activity at Wayerma I, across from the Malian Agency for Press and Advertising (AMAP) in Sikasso, not far from the central prison, where he has a shop. Mr. Koné is very much sought after by his customers because of the quality of his products. Mindful of meeting the needs of his ever growing number of customers, he joined micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than two years ago. He is on his third individual loan, his previous loans all having been properly repaid. This new loan will allow him to buy 20 packets of caustic soda, 17 pieces of damask, 13 bags of potash, 15 boxes of dye in different colors, etc. He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and sells to a clientele made up mostly of women who dye fabric and who are from the town of Sikasso and the surrounding area. With this new loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs which will mainly be used to contribute towards household expenses and pay interest on the loan, the rest being invested in his business.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El Señor Demetrio H. A., es soltero no tiene hijos él se vino al trópico de Cochabamba para buscar trabajo y tener una vida mejor. 

Demetrio H. A. es un joven dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja como chofer de taxi en el sindicato de transporte “PORTEÑO” haciendo un recorrido de Ivirgarzama – Pto. Villarroel, el no cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres ya que ellos fallecieron recientemente, sus hermanos ya están casados por lo cual él se independizo a muy temprana edad y en su tiempo libre trabajo como albañil en diferentes ciudades. 

El señor Demetrio H. A. se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un lote agrícola para así poder plantar de cítricos y empezar una nueva vida. Su mayor sueño es poder tener una vasta plantación de cítricos y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Demetrio H. A. is single and has no children. He came to the Cochabamba tropics to look for work and to have a better life. Demetrio H. A. is a young man who is dedicated to his work. He works as a taxi drive for the “PORTEÑO” taxi syndicate. He works the route from Ivirgarzama – Pto. Villarroel. He does not have his parents’ support because they recently died. His siblings are married, so he became independent at a very young age. In his time off he works as a bricklayer in different cities. Demetrio H. A. came to our offices looking for a loan for a down payment on a plot of farm land. This way he will be able to plant citrus and start a new life. His biggest dream is to be able to have a vast citrus field to be able to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land to plant citrus

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. M. is forty one years old, single and has two children aged twenty two years old and nineteen years old whom she hopes to give a quality university education. Her business is located at Choka, near a very busy highway in Nairobi. She sells timber, twisted bars, galvanised iron pipes, paints, nails, water pipes, taps, cement, iron sheets, bolts and other items to local builders. Most of her customers are loyal repeat customers and walk-ins. 

She has been in this business for the last nine months and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good and the only major challenge she has is slow moving stock as potential customers do not purchase building materials since they fear to build because of land ownership issues. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well. She is taking a loan of  50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to replenish her stock of iron sheets, water pipes and nails. In future she sees herself build her own business premise in which she will be serving thousands of customers. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and determined.

loans.use: iron sheets, water pipes and nails

loans.name: Aidalor

texts.en:
Aidalor L. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 22 years old. Aidalor is married and has 1 school-age children. To make a living, Aidalor owned a business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling electronic products like cellphones, cellphone accessories and also electronic loads in the local community. Aidalor has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aidalor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aidalor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in a direct selling business. Aidalor is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aidalor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Victoria Women's Group B-2, Lugazi

texts.en:
Ever since her friend made a believer out of her through persuasion, Ruth N. has set her shoulders to the wheel, working vigorously hard to establish a vantage point in the local market in Lugazi for her six-year-old boutique. This required that she take the reins early and boldly in making the right and impacting decisions. She made success doubly sure by these attributes.

36-year-old Ruth has an applied and experienced mind. Her business generates her 200,000 shillings on a monthly basis. Being the wise, hardworking and focused woman that she is, operating a pay-phone business has also been a wise decision.

With this loan, Ruth wants to restock her boutique with new clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Luis Grover

texts.es:
El Señor Luis Grover G. T. tiene 21 años es soltero y no tiene  hijos, el es el sustento de sus hermanos y su madre la cual trabaja vendiendo comida en un puesto ambulante ya que su padre falleció cuando él era muy joven; el trabaja actualmente como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

El cliente no conoce de créditos, es  la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de CIDRE cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida su familia, y lograr que sus hermanos terminen el colegio y puedan estudiar una carrera técnica.

El señor Luis Grover G. T. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le Comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja la institución, y sobre los beneficios de Kiva para personas emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Luis Grover G. T. is 21 years old, single, and has no children. He supports his siblings and his mother, who works selling food from a traveling stand because his father passed away when he was very young. He currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver in the "2 de Agosto" (August 2nd) union, which he has been doing as an active member for more than three years. The service he offers is profitable because of the high number of people who request this service for its ease, speed and efficiency. The union has taxi stands and shifts for each affiliate at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama where people come to request the service. The customer is not familiar with loans. This is the first time that he has obtained a loan from CIDRE, and its purpose will be for the purchase of a new motorcycle, so he can offer better service to his customers, which will also allow him to improve his income and consequently improve quality of life for himself and his family, and make it possible for his siblings to finish high school and be able to study a technical career. Luis Grover G. T. came to CIDRE to request his loan after his co-workers told him about the good credit conditions offered by the institution, and about Kiva's benefits for enterprising people.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital, purchase tools for work

loans.name: Odith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Odith M. es una mujer que ha trabajado mucho desde muy joven, tiene tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 20 años y a fuerza de vender pescado los ha sostenido y continua trabajando, para lograr su sueño de que estudien en la universidad y tengan un futuro exitoso. Su microempresa inició con la meta de mejorar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida desde hace ya 10 años; en un comienzo vendía a vecinos y amigos, hoy su clientela no solo la conforman ellos, sino  restaurantes, pescaderías  y familias que le compran semanalmente, cuando ella llega de Tasajera pueblo pescador del departamento del Atlántico y se los ofrece frescos y aun buen precio y en otras oportunidades lo trae de la Guajira del norte de Colombia.
Su Credikiva es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual lleva 2 años de ser su cliente; con él comprará pesado al por mayor para responder a pedidos de pescaderías y restaurantes de la ciudad  y también para repotenciar el enfriador donde los conserva. Su sueño se centra ahora en tener un local ubicado en el mercado del pescado con todas las condiciones higiénicas y de refrigeración que le permita en un futuro organizar puntos de ventas en sectores potencialmente comerciales.
.
texts.en:
Odith M. has been in the workforce ever since she was a young woman. She has three children ranging in age from 10 to 20 years. At the same time as continuing her work selling fish, she has raised the children. Her dream is for them to study at university and have successful futures. Odith started her small business ten years ago with the goal of increasing her income and improving her standard of living. At the beginning she sold the fish to neighbours and friends; today she not only sells to them, but also to restaurants, fishmongers, and families who buy from her weekly. She transports the fish from Tasajera, a fishing village in the department of Atlántico, and she also offers her customers soft drinks at good prices. On other occasions, she brings the fish from La Guajira in the north of Columbia. This is Odith’s first loan with Kiva partner, the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, where she has been a client for two years. With the loan she will buy fish at wholesale prices in response to orders from fishmongers and restaurants in the town. She also plans to improve the refrigeration system where she keeps the fish. In the future Odith hopes to own a hygienic, refrigerated stall in the fish market so she can organize other points of sale in newly-developed business areas.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale prices to sell to restaurants etc

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilu, de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, esta casada con Raúl, de 50 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos, Miguel de 26 y Elva de 18 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Le gusta mucho mantenerse activa y ocupada, se dedica a un variedad de actividades y oficios; como el de vender panes y pasteles que diariamente prepara, de la misma manera se dedica al cuidado de cultivo de arveja, maíz, habas y papa, productos que siembra con una socia, ambas comparten los gastos y las ganancias, asimismo cría animales, y en su establo posee 5 carneros, 3 vacas y 4 chanchos; a todos ellos los cuida y alimenta. Cuando están bien gorditos los mata y vende su carne a los pobladores de su localidad, ya todos la conocen; ella va de casa en casa a ofrecer este producto perecible. En adelante quiere abrir una pequeña carnicería donde pueda atender a sus clientes y vender carne de calidad. Es el primer crédito con MFP y le gusta pertenecer a su banco comunal porqué todos ahí son como una gran familia. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar 2 toros de mil soles cada uno.
texts.en: Marilu, 45 years old, is a happy and hard working woman.  She is married to Raul, who is 50 years old.  They have 3 children, two of whom are living with them; Miguel is 26 and Elva is 18.  They live in their own house in the Chiras area.  She likes to stay active and busy.  She is involved in a variety of activities and trades, such as the sale of bread and pastries that she prepares daily, she also grows peas, corn, beans and potatoes, products that she plants with a partner and they both share the costs and income, and she also raises animals.  In her stable she has 5 sheep, 3 cows and 4 pigs, all of which she feeds and takes care of.  When they are fattened up, she slaughters them and sells the meat to the people in her area.  Everybody know her since she goes door to door selling these perishable products.  In the future she wants to open a small butcher shop where she can take care of her customers and sell good quality meats.  This is her first loan with MFP and she likes belonging to her community bank because everyone there is like a great family.  With the loan she will be able to buy 2 bulls for 1000 soles each.

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls.

loans.name: Ana Rocio

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank Active Women II, located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, and department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and has no children. She has studied to a complete degree of higher education.

Ana has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months and her first loan was for 500 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN), which she used to increase the capital of her business selling hardware. 

She is requesting a new loan of 800 PEN, which will be used to purchase contruction materials for her hardware store. 

Her dream for the future is to have more capital for her business and to open a store in Puno. 

Her favorite part about the Communal Bank is the terms of repayment.

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Barcilisa

texts.es:
La  Sra. Barcilisa tiene 41 años ,es madre de tres hijos menores  y esta casada con el Sr. Eugenio Nuñez.
Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para dama ,caballeros y niños ,luego de haber  trabajado varios años con un pariente logro montar un  pequeño taller con la ayuda de su cónyuge quien trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras por la calle.
Ellos ya tienen buena clientela formada y necesitan de este crédito para la compra de telas en cantidad por los pedidos que tiene en esta temporada y las fiestas que se aproximan. 
Barcilisa    desea  abrir un salón y exhibir sus prendas  .
texts.en:
Mrs. Barcilisa is 41, married to Mrs. Eugenio Nuñez, and they have three children.
She makes clothing for women, men, and children.  After having worked for some years with a relative, she was able to open a small workshop with her husband’s help.  He is a street vendor of fruit and vegetables.

She now has customers and she needs the loan to buy fabric in quantity for the orders that she has for this season and for the holidays that are coming up.  Barcilisa would like to open a store to display her clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and embroidered edging

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna S. is a mother of four daughters. Her husband is a driver hired by the Ministry of Health. Muna has knitting skills, and started a small workshop in her house serving neighbors and relatives. The returns from Muna's workshop helped her pay her daughters' education expenses.

Muna's oldest daughter is a university student. Muna took a loan from FATEN to pay her daughter's last course tuition fees. This is the second loan Muna has taken from FATEN.

Muna appears in the picture here in FATEN's office

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Hope can still be found for someone who has lost the single most important person in her life. A widow at the age of 58, Jelly F. has learned this truth in a rather painful way. Her beloved husband is gone. Jelly finished only high school and has no children to support her. But, a hope still stands beside her. A reason for living has come along when it seemed that nothing was left to live for. Jelly is living not just for herself, but for the people around her whose health and lives she is enriching with the business that she runs. 

Jelly is a CCT* community partner who gains and applies her entrepreneurial training in managing her fruits and vegetables business. She treats this business a treasured thing in life to which she dedicates her effort and resources. She sells healthy foods to people in her community, spreading the wealth of good health to people whose needs she is striving to meet. With this business, Jelly earns Php 9,000 every month, which she uses to meet her daily needs.

Jelly is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 to help her grow her business. She intends to use the money to purchase more fruits and vegetables to add to her table of goods for sale. She looks forward to doing her best to maximize every resource she has to make her business grow.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza Y. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Feliza is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Feliza owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals like chicken/pork adobo and pancit bihon to customers in the local community. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Feliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and to use as working capital. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Feliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for restaurant

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio, de 52 años, convive con Bertha, de 46 años. Ambos tienen un hijo, Antony, de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La principal actividad de Bacilio, es la agricultura, los que hacen 20 años siembra, fertiliza y cuida con mucho esmero, pues sus sembríos de papa, arveja, y maíz, son los mejores de su localidad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica esté exitoso hombre, él también se dedica al cuidado de sus animales vacuno y ovino, como también de los burros, que le ayudan a trasportar el abono o también los productos que cosecha, en el que son luego distribuidos en la ciudad de Tarma y Huasahuasi, así como también los lleva a la ciudad de Lima. Ahora piensa sembrar arveja en menor proporción, complementando con la fortificación de sus sembríos de papa, los cuales darán un buen fruto. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y como socio antiguo de su banco comunal, se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que reciben de parte de sus integrantes. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar un saco de semillas de arveja, y varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 52 years old and lives with his common-law wife, 46 year-old Bertha.  They have one son, Antony, who is 8 years old.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

Bacilio's main business activity is farming.  He has been growing, fertilizing and carefully looking after crops for 20 years.  His potato, pea and corn crops are the best in his area.  However, this successful man does not only grow crops, he also cares for his cows, sheep and also donkeys who transport manure and also the products that he harvests.  He distributes his crops in the cities of Tarma and Huasahuasi.  He also takes them to the city of Lima.

Bacilio is thinking of growing fewer peas and strengthening his potato crops which will provide good results.  This is his seventh loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member of his community bank, he feels grateful for all the support that he receives from the other members.  He will use his loan to buy a sack of pea seeds and several sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy a sack of pea seeds and several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob P., 65, is married and lives in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians – Nob P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $750 to purchase fertilizer and cows. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and cows

loans.name: Solidario Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Buena Vista: La Señora Beatriz S. se dedica a la venta de refaccion en especial venta de tamales, por otro lado tambien vende ropa, como blusas, y oro brasileño, desde hace 6 años ella se dedica a la venta ambulante,con la ayuda de su esposo y la de sus hijos ella a salido adelante, ella como encargada del grupo anima a sus compañeras para seguir luchando por sus sueños, doña Lidia Rebeca M.: su deceo es seguir luchando y sacar adelante a su familia su sueño es poder tener una libreria  mas grande donde pueda tener bariedad en papeleria o utiles para escuela, doña Alida Violeta H.: es una mujer muy luchadora ella vende elados, pero tambien vende tamales de con sus luchas a sacado adelante a sus familia y le a podido dar lo nesesario a sus hijos. Las señora solicitan esta credito para compra de productos comestibles para tienda y para elavorar tamales y compra de mercaderia para libreria
texts.en:
Buena Vista Communal Bank:  Mrs. Beatriz S. sells food, especially tamales.  She also sells clothes, like blouses, and Brazilian gold.  She has been a street vendor for the last 6 years.  With help from her husband and children she has been getting ahead.  As group leader she encourages her fellow members to continue fighting for their dreams.

Mrs. Lidia Rebeca M. wants to continue fighting to support her family.  Her dream is to have a larger bookstore where she can stock a variety of paper goods or school supplies.

Mrs. Alida Violeta Hernández is a very hard working woman who sells ice cream but also sells tamales.  Through her struggles she has managed to support her family and provide the basics for her children.

The women are asking for a loan to buy food items for the store and to make tamales and to buy merchandise for the bookstore.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for the store and to make tamales and to buy merchandise for the bookstore.

loans.name: Nida's Group

texts.en:
Nida, the 21-year-old wife of A. A. and mother of a nine-month-old daughter, lives in Okara, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She has resided with her family in the area named Sheikh Basti for the past 20 years, and her brick house contains two rooms.

Her husband operates a spice-selling business, providing his products to a variety of grocery and general stores in the city. Nida also supports her husband in his business by selling spices to her community clients. She is also a very good mother and housewife and discharges her responsibilities very well. Nida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spices such as salt, pepper, red-chili powder, etc. in bulk quantity to enable him to fulfill his orders on time and target a maximum number of clients. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years, and Nida is confident that an investment will put his business into a more profitable position.

Nadia is a new loan user of Asasah, and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will bring positive changes to her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy spices to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem M. (pictured with her daughter), 59, is a widow with one son and four daughters. Three are married, two attend school and another one is a car repairman. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chhem is a rice farmer. In addition, she also raises pigs at home. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a Tuk Tuk (motorcycle-based taxi) for her son-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Mujeres Capaces 3 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Capaces III se conformó en el año 2009, y siguen adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que la mayoría de las integrantes tiene un ingreso reducido.
Las señoras son de la ciudad de Encarnación, distante a 40 km. de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven, relacionadas a la venta  de frutas, verduras y comestibles.
La Sra. Cecilia R. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y como se aproxima la época de otoño desea ampliar la variedad de sus frutas, comprando las cítricas, pero para ello necesita de un crédito de modo que pueda obtener un mayor ingreso con el aumento del margen de ganancias.
Las mujeres están agradecidas por el acceso al crédito, ya que es el único lugar donde pueden obtener capital de trabajo, teniendo en cuenta su nivel de ingreso.
Renuevan por 6ta vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el buen pago en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee “Mujeres Capaces III” (Capable Women III) was established in 2009. The group continues to move forward with great effort even though most of its members have limited incomes. These ladies are from the city of Encarnación, which is 40km away from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. They will use this money for their various business activities that are conducted in the area where they live. These businesses involve the sale of fruits, vegetables, and groceries.

Sra. Cecilia R. sells fruits and vegetables. As the autumn season approaches, she wants to expand the variety of fruits that she offers by acquiring citrus fruits. However, she needs a loan so that she can generate more income and increase her profit margin.

The women are grateful for having access to this loan since it is the only way they can obtain operating capital to help them raise their income level. They are receiving their sixth loan and entering this loan cycle with a good payment history.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina I. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Divina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling baked goods like loaf breads, cookies and pastries in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Divina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. 

Divina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, sugar and milk. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like flour, sugar and milk
